reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2023
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Only lasted 5 minutes.
reviewText: I set up this fountain and initially it worked well. After running for about 5 minutes it stopped working. I followed the procedures in the instructions and cleaned and reset the fountain, It still did not work. I noticed a blue light was illuminated on the pump when plugged into the panel and submersed. When lifted briefly from the water the light turned red. I tried cleaning and restarting the pump numerous times with no luck. The manufacturers literature indicated that they should be contacted if there were any issued and that they would provide a satisfactory resolution within 24 hours. I sent an email to the customer service address with a detailed description of the issue, including my steps to remedy the problem. The next morning a saw a reply from them advising me to repeat the steps I had already taken. I did and responded to the email. I have not received a response and it is now beyond the 24 hour period and there appears to be no relief. I will have to return the item and order another one like I am replacing. That one lasted more than a two years in a fairly rough environment.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It works and hasn't died, yet...
reviewText: I bought this to replace the pump on my bird bath in the front yard. One issue I knew going in - there's no battery as part of the system so any shading turns the pump off right away. My old one had a small battery that would keep the pump going for quite a long time after the sun was off it, or through temporary clouds.The other issue is that the shut off isn't very effective. It will eventually shut off, but many a time I've gone outside to hear the pump grinding away with no water and the pump is still just moist. Living in the South West where it is > 100F all summer my small bird bath can dry out daily so I assumed this wold cause the pump to burn out very quickly but so far it has kept going through the summer. YMMV.My previous pump was either more sensitive to the water level or the sensor was better placed, I don't know. I guess the solution for me is to bury a big reservoir of water below the bird path so it runs of out water less frequently.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Stopped working after a month
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. UPDATED REVIEW: I'm so disappointed that this fountain stopped working after just a bit over a month of use. I cleaned the filter and wiped down the solar panels, but nothing. So sad! Such a huge waste of money for less than 2 months of use. And how convenient that it stopped working just after the return window closed.I'm in love with this little solar fountain! I created a Japanese themed zen pond for myself using a 7 gallon livestock feed tub from a feedstore and a resin pagoda, also bought off of Amazon. After setting up the fountain I was amazed that it immediately began working when placed in the water. When the water shoots up higher and it's a windy day, you will need to refill the water more often, but that's why I chose a deep and wide livestock feed tub with 7 gallons of water. A shallow birdbath would need frequent water refills. The water sounds aren't as loud as I'd prefer, but it's peaceful to watch. But the real show begins at night! The rotating colors shining onto the moving water look like glitter! And I was impressed with how long the fountain and lights worked late into the night. I went to bed, but woke up around 1am to use the bathroom and the little fountain was still operating! Great buy! I'm so glad I spent a little more to get the night time light show!

Ah well, it's like everything else ... all those bells and whistles (the lights and longer solar charge) are just a way to raise the price for less product.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2023
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works well...with limitations
reviewText: I bought this little pump for a bird bath. It works as expected with adequate power, and the many nozzle attachments give a lot of spray possibilities. It does need to be cleaned frequently because it sucks in all the bird bath debris and plugs up.First problem: the little suction cups on the bottom of the device are useless to hold it in place. I finally used three small rocks to keep it in the center of the water.Second: spray height and volume are highly variable depending on amount of sunlight, so it's hard to regulate on a sun/cloud day. Add wind, and the water blows everywhere out of the bird bath. Most of the nozzles shoot water too high to be useful in a bird bath when it's sunny. I need to refill water repeatedly.So....the pump works just fine except for the suction cups (not sure for how long; I've only used it for a few weeks), but it doesn't really work in a bird bath. And it will require an anchoring system of some kind to keep it from randomly floating around your body of water and spraying everywhere!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2020
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love it & bought 2 more:UPDATED 6/9/22
reviewText: Finally bought this after seeing several advertisements ~ LOVE IT! It has added a little fun to our birdbath and I found I check it reg'ly as it makes me happy. Plus, it has added some fun to our summer yard. I have now bought 2 more (1 to replace the original see info below). I have 1 unit in the bird bath and now added one to our little waterfall/pond (5' x 3' pool). They turn on with the sun and off when in shade so they do not run all the time like a solar charged battery allows. I actually like this arrangement better. The fountain starts spraying as soon as the sun shines on it. It turns off responsively too~ if light is temporarily blocked (a shadow from my hand as I fill the Bbath or a temp pass of a cloud), it turns off immediately. It is so immediately responsive, it gives the impression of an off/on switch. It does not have a switch so If we are leaving for a few days, I just put it on the shelf on our covered deck where it stays turned off until I set it in water again. The different fountain heads in deed provide for a variety of patterns of spray. It is a powerful little thing too , 1 of the heads shoots easily 12 -18" high. If you choose not to use a patterned spray head, water will just gurgle & bubble out of the top which the birds like as well. I learned to put a ring of rocks in the bird bath to keep it centered & prevent it from moving itself too close to the edge & spilling water over the side. Colo had a string of 90+ degree days in Aug this year, so I would fill the bath everyday. If water gets too low the fountain cannot spray. Also, the motor will continue to run if the sun shines on the device but there's no water. This happened 1 or 2 and I could hear it running as soon as I walked out on the deck; it was +30'away which demonstrated the motor has plenty of power. However, It's completely quiet while in water. After 3 months of use it just quit working BUT I feel there was 1 too many times I let it run completely dry. I ordered 2 more to replace the original and added the second unit to our lil pond /waterfall area. It works great in the pond and scoots itself all over the surface. Another tip to users : I used fishing line to tie a rock to the unit thereby tethering it so it would stay out of the shaded areas and prevent it from getting stuck up against the edges. It is working great and I do not have to worry about it running out of water! As for longevity we will see; I intend to use 1 unit in the heated bird bath this winter. We'll see how cold weather affects it but also keeping in mind Denver temps can be on the mild - moderate side with a mix of cold to comfortable. Generally it is not like the looong freezing winters of the Northern states. If the 2 units do not hold up thru the next few Fall months, I will edit my 3 star longevity rating. it is a fun little feature and I recommend it to others ~ in fact I may put it under the tree this Xmas!********update: the 2 new units i bought since writing this review have held up very well!! I still luv these little fountainheads. I decided to NOT use them Nov-Feb. but outside of that time period they are in water & working almost everyday. To store them I simply take them out of water & keep covered thru winter months. I even left them outside on a shelf where they live thru extreme temp changes. I keep the 5 star rating & would go higher if i could for these reasons: longevity excellent,affordability vs value is outstanding, ease of use & maintenance could not be easer or more convenient.I would add a durability rating & give it the highest rating too. This is in consideration of my experience that they are out in all weather i.e. wide temp swings of Co. Springtime -32 -80+ that cause feet of snow, Summer’s extreme heat over100+ , hailstorms & even Fall nites that cool quickly. It’s a wonderful , fun affordable & durable addition to the yard or any body of water u want to make a lil more special but a low work impact! I’ll try to add picts next

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2020
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Price is good, performance is just OK, birds love it!
reviewText: You get what you pay for. That said, the birds are enjoying it!Water pressure: You only get full pressure when all solar panels are fully exposed to strong sunlight. Having a branch or a bird sitting on the fountain will severely change the pressure.Spray stability: If you have full pressure, you get a nice solid consistent stream of water. But anything on the solar panels or any small cloud will turn the stream into a squirter. I'm guessing there is an electric condenser inside that collects the solar power and releases it to the motor once filled up, so you get a quick squirt and a second or two of pause.Jets: If you have full pressure, the jets spray the water over a foot high. If you have the slightest bit of wind, it may blow the water right out of your bird bath. So I am leaving the jets off completely and get a few inches of water squirting up which is plenty to keep the water rotating and cleaner.Birds: With all the low-price elements going on, the birds definitely enjoy using the bird bath! Even when low light turns the fountain into a squirter, the birds got used to it very quickly (a couple of days) and are not the least bothered by it anymore. I frequently get 6 or more birds on my bird bath (with one or two more waiting in line) from multiple species. I've had it for a few weeks, and I did not regret it - I already bought a second as backup.I might come up with something to hold the fountain in place in the middle of the bird bath so it doesn't float all over the place and push out the "easy access branches" I laid in the bath.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2020
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solar Fountain
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I love this little fountain. It was easy to setup. I just attached the nozzles and sat it in water and it worked. It does only work during the daytime, but it does not require full sunlight; though, less sun equals less power so it trickles down to a tiny spurt. But it’s a consistent spurt every few seconds even in the shade. The area I placed it in gets several hours of direct, unobstructed sunlight though. It will slow down whenever it’s in shadow, including when you step in front of it. It runs until late in the day, but does stop when there is absolute no sunlight, so around 630-7 in mid September in my area.I purchased this so that I could have an outdoor water bowl for my dogs because they kept drinking out of my plant saucers, which I don’t want them to do, since sometimes there is neem oil in that water and I’m not sure if that may cause digestive issues.My dogs quickly learned to use this fountain instead and, despite being generally skittish, they will drink from it even in full sun when the fountain squirts its highest.This does occasionally squirt out nearly half the water in the early hours when it’s in full sun for much of the morning and afternoon. But sometimes it stays pretty contained. I’m not sure if there’s a way to control this. I have the same problems with a much more expensive fountain in my bird bath, so I think this is typical and to be expected.It also does move around the container a lot, so I covered it with a small metal cage (bottom of an old plant hanger) to keep it away from the edge of the container.It is a great little addition to my yard/garden, and I think the birds might use it too whenever my dogs are indoors. I’m grateful not to have to worry about mosquitoes breeding in the water. And I actually don’t mind that it squirts so much water out, since I have to change the water regularly anyway.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Brilliant Addition to My Garden
reviewText: I recently added the Floating Solar Powered Water Fountain Pump to my garden pond, and I am absolutely thrilled with its performance. Here’s why I love it:Effortless Solar Power: The best part about this fountain pump is that it runs entirely on solar power. There are no wires to deal with, no electricity costs, and it’s eco-friendly. The solar panel quickly charges even on cloudy days, ensuring continuous operation.Beautiful Fountain Effects: The pump creates a variety of fountain patterns that add a mesmerizing visual element to my garden pond. It’s delightful to watch the water dancing and sparkling in the sunlight. The adjustable nozzles allow me to change the fountain pattern according to my preference.Easy Installation: Setting up the pump was incredibly easy. I simply placed it on the water surface, let the solar panel absorb sunlight, and it started working right away. There’s no complicated installation or maintenance required.Low Maintenance: Once installed, the fountain pump requires minimal maintenance. I occasionally clean the pump and the solar panel to ensure optimal performance, but that’s about it. It’s hassle-free and saves me a lot of time.Quiet Operation: The pump operates quietly, which is perfect for enjoying the peaceful ambiance of my garden. It doesn’t disturb the tranquility, allowing me to relax and enjoy the sights and sounds of nature.Durable and Weather-resistant: The materials used are durable and weather-resistant, which is essential for outdoor use. I feel confident that the pump will withstand various weather conditions throughout the seasons.Affordable and Cost-effective: Considering the benefits it brings, including enhancing the aesthetics of my garden and providing a soothing atmosphere, the price of the fountain pump is very reasonable. It’s a great investment for any garden enthusiast.Overall, I am absolutely delighted with the Floating Solar Powered Water Fountain Pump. It’s efficient, easy to use, and adds a beautiful touch to my garden pond. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking to enhance their outdoor space with a sustainable and visually appealing water feature.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Disappointing Performance: Solar Fountain Falls Short of Expectation
reviewText: I had high hopes for this solar fountain, but unfortunately, it did not live up to its promises. Here's a breakdown of my experience:Eco-friendly Design:The idea of an eco-friendly, solar-powered fountain was very appealing, but in reality, this product only works intermittently. It claims to run automatically in 3 seconds when sunlight is sufficient, but I found it to be highly inconsistent. Even on sunny days, the fountain often failed to start, and when it did, the spray height was much lower than advertised, barely reaching 20-30cm instead of the promised 40-60cm.Sprayer for Different Water Styles:While it comes with 6 different nozzle heads, they don't make a significant difference. The water height remains unimpressive regardless of the nozzle used. Additionally, the "exclusive fixer" meant to keep the fountain in place is ineffective; the fountain moves around randomly in the birdbath, making it difficult to enjoy any serenity from the water's trickling sound.Advanced Technology:The water-shortage protection feature and filtration box sound great in theory but fail in practice. The fountain stops working frequently, even when fully submerged, and the filtration box gets clogged easily, requiring constant cleaning. Despite being made of PET laminated solar panel, the fountain struggled to work properly even in mild weather conditions, let alone harsh environments.Multiple Applications:The fountain is quite small, with a diameter of only 6.3 inches, and requires a minimum water depth of 1.2 inches. This limitation makes it unsuitable for larger ponds or pools. While it might be suitable for a small bird bath or a tiny pond, the frequent malfunctions and low water height make it more of a hassle than a helpful addition.Helpful Tips:Following the tips provided, such as not allowing the water to get too low and keeping the pump clean, did not solve the fountain's problems. Even with diligent maintenance, the fountain's performance remained disappointing. The fact that it does not store any energy means it stops working the moment the sun is obscured, making it unreliable.In conclusion, this solar fountain did not meet my expectations. It is unreliable, requires constant maintenance, and fails to deliver on its promises. I would not recommend this product to anyone looking for a consistent and enjoyable water feature for their garden or pond. Save your money and invest in a higher quality, more reliable option.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Only one I've tried but good enough I bought 2 more
reviewText: I like the power but for my bird baths, I have two bird baths like this https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0D36P14FR/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1 which are both fairly big, and the fountain using the included jet attachments is to powerful even for my large bath. The splashing water loses too much and it would not last a day saw I took my drill and drilled through the holes to make them bigger, had to keep trying till I was surprised at how large I had to drill them as this thing is that powerful. There are alternative, the power diminishes significantly if you cover any of the solar cell so I could have just put some water proof tape on the cell to reduce the height of the jets but I like fine tuning the output pressure to my own baths. Anyway, I've had one for over a year but I broke the connector the other day and bought a third just after I set up the second bath. I keep a sponge close by and wipe it down every few days or sooner if needed, the pump needs wiped down also, to keep the bath free of algae, dirt and debris and you should not use anything but water to clean it. Birds are old dinosaurs and are sensitive to chemicals. A bird bath is a lot easier to keep clean, fresh water everyday and regular cleaning will keep healthy birds coming back. Very beneficial and less messy than feeding birds, which may not be a good idea anyways, but fresh water is always needed and welcome.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2020
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect purchase
reviewText: This is NOT a paid review!!This little fountain is awesome!My test to see how well it worked:I attached the tip I wanted, suctioned it to a bread pan, filled with water (covering the pump but not the tip) and the minute I stepped outside to try it the water started to spray.My findings:A) If the sun hides behind a cloud or a panel is covered (I did with my finger to test) it stops but as soon as the panel is back in full exposure this bad boy kicks up again.B) It does drain your pan of water pretty quickly unless it's set up in a wide enough base to continually recycle through, a birdbath would be perfect size to prevent the pump being out of water - which will destroy it.C) Plus, it's solar so not adding to a bill or wasting resources (the water will be drunk by the cats~ this will give it flow)So worth it, going to buy another! It looks so cool, I can't wait for the little area I bought it for to be set up. My kitten is a weirdo and loves it when the water sprays up as I'm filling the water bowl, she's going to love it!Edit 3.13.20: my outside area is set up. Today I submerged the pump in about a foot of water. It's giving perfect flow to keep the water fresh for my cats. I'll eventually build a better (as in actual) fountain but for now it's pretty dang perfect!Edit: 6.4.20 One of my units stopped working. I cleaned the area it was in, making sure the pump had no chance of running when out of water. I put everything back together and nothing. I reached out to CS to see if thry had any suggestions. Before they had an opportunity to respond I decided to take a wet cloth to the solar panel (I wipe in down every couple of days from the dust build up in my area) and it immediately started up again. This was about 4 weeks ago. Still pumping strong!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2020
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great with a few Drawbacks
reviewText: Here are my major take aways after setting up this fountain. I have not been paid or offered gift card.1. When solar panel is in the sun, the fountain is pretty strong and runs very well - the sun has to hit the panel. If any shade hits it, the motor will weaken and "pulse" as some reviews mentioned. So you have to find a place that will consistently get full sun throughout the day. Cannot stress this enough. It is not like solar lights where it conserves and runs on a solar battery (I think because a water pump requires much more energy))2. The cord was not long enough for me - you may want to order an extension. Because the panel needs full sun, and I don't want my bird bath directly in the sun - I will need an extension cord - in order to place the panel where I need it, and somewhat hide the cord and not having it dangle midair. This is why I docked a star. The extension cord was another $16 dollars - and the sum is probably more than what I would have liked to spend to get it set up properlyIf I had an outlet outside, I wouldn't waste my time with this - however, if, like me, an outdoor outlet isn't available - this works pretty nicely, although not perfect, and like I said, you will probably want an extension cord, and you will end up spending close to $35 total, which IMO seems a lot for this device..

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I needed
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I read all the reviews before I purchased this, and in spite of the complaints about random shadows ceasing the fountain activity, I bought it anyway. The reviews are true and correct, any slight interference with the sun (passing clouds, overcast skies, my own shadow, etc.) does cause the pump to halt immediately. This solar panel does not store the suns power - not even a smidge - so if that's what you need, this is not the product for you. However, for my purposes, this is perfect. My goal was to create a hummingbird fountain and provide a daily water source for my hummers and butterflies. I don't need the pump to run at night, that would just cause faster evaporation. Even when the pump is not running, there is still a water source for my friends, as I have it set up to keep a small bowl full. When the sun shines again, the pump resumes it's purpose of recycling the water and keeps it moving. I can't really speak to longevity yet because I've only had this for about a week now and so far it has not disappointed. If it does, I'll come back and update.The pump arrived on time and was neatly packaged. All the parts were there and in perfect condition. Comes with a little instruction manual too and was very easy to assemble. I included a measuring tape with my pictures to show the panel size, it is pretty small, but it does the job as intended. I do wish the cord was longer because I would love to have mounted the panel on my roof - once the sun sets past my awning my little fountain is done for the day. The clear hose has a curve to it from being in the package which resulted in the fountain not shooting straight up, it wants to maintain the curve resulting in a lop-sided spray. To resolve this, I found a small piece of red PVC laying around and ran the clear hose up through it to keep it pointed straight up - worked perfect.I saw a review or two that said the tips don't fit the hose but after a bit of persuasive wiggling the tip went on and worked as advertised. In fact the tips worked so well that they sprayed higher than I needed for this project so I did a bit of modifying to my hose and PVC contraption until I got the spray height I wanted. Again, keep in mind that the height of the spray is directly related to the strength of the sun. Strong sun = strong spray. And I can switch the tips whenever I want. Btw, there is no ON-OFF switch on this, but not to worry, once the water at the bottom of the planter (or pond or whatever you use) gets too low, the pump automatically shuts off so that it doesn't burn itself out. I like that a lot.So, I guess it's all about what you will be using it for. I am super happy with mine and plan to create another fountain for my rock garden. I will be buying again.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars great solar pump for small foutains
reviewText: I had previously purchased this pump a year ago. I thought it wasn't working and so I ordered a new one. It turned out, that the old one actually was still working, and therefore, I returned the new one.How does it work? I was given 2 different size ceramic flower pots. I purchase a plug for the larger pot. I had an old plastic container that used to hold VHS discs. I punched a hole in the bottom of the container, then ran the clear plastic tubing that came with the pump up through the plastic disc container, which I turned upside down after setting the motor to the solar pump inside the plastic container. Next I filled the large flower pot with water. I ran the plastic tubing through a hole in the bottom of the smaller pot and put one of the fountain heads on.Pros: After placing the solar panel in the sun, I have a beautiful tabletop fountain that sits atop a wrought iron table in my small flower garden behind my house.Cons: The pump only works when the sun hits the panel.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Peaceful and soothing

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nifty little gadget!
reviewText: I'm using this pump to make an easy diy bird bath in a basic 20 inch plastic terra cotta plant dish.A few things to know prior to purchase:1. It's corded: The solar panel (which you stick somewhere that gets full sun for the majority of the day) connects to the pump inside the bird bath via a 10 ft cord. Not a big deal for me since I can hide the cord in the bath with some rocks. But just be aware you will have a cord hanging out of the bird bath (or water feature) from the pump to the solar panel.2. No sun/no pump: The pump will only operate when the solar panel is receiving full direct sunlight. So if a cloud covers the sun... or a shadow/obstruction gets between the solar panel and direct sunlight, the pump will not operate until the sun comes back out/or shadow or obstruction removed. Not a big deal, since I'm using this to keep the water fresher/cooler for the birds (it does a great job for that!). But if you'd prefer it to run more consistently during daylight hours, you'll probably want to purchase a solar pump with the internal solar rechargeable battery (which is more expensive but can be found on Amazon).3. You may have to adjust the solar panel at some point during the later half of the day as the sun starts to move. Or... If you are lucky without any obstructions (house, trees, etc) you may not have to.4. Comes with 5 different spray nozzles to provide various shooting, fountain or bubbler-like effects. Or... You don't need to use any of the included attachments and just use the pump to circulate water. But keep in mind when using the attachment heads that provide the high fountain effect: it's going to shoot 12 inches of water into the air when you get full sun/full power (at least that's my experience in the FL sun). That means: You need a big enough bird bath to accommodate the over spray/splashes...otherwise you'll lose all your water in the bath a few sprinkles at a time and need to refill the bath. Also... If it's a breezy day, the breeze can disrupt the 12 inches of fountain spray and push it outside of the bath. Hence, need to to refill the bath.I had a big issue with keeping the water from sprinkling or splashing out of my large 20 inch dish when using the 12 inch high fountain spray type attachments. Drove me nuts! Since there is no way to regulate how high the fountain will spray, what to do? I used a drill with a small bit and made the holes ever so slightly bigger... And it worked! Slightly larger holes reduced pressure and provided a spray 6 inches high VS 12 inches and solved the issue of splashes/over spray.Also... Good news: A basic plastic straw can act as an extender (in this order: Pump, straight rod attachment, straw, funnel looking attachment... And if you wish, then put a fountain cap attachment on the funnel). I was messing around with rocks inside the bird bath (for birds to perch on) with the pump hidden under the pile of rocks. Using a straw allowed me to extend the reach of the pump from under the pile of loose rocks.5. The pump has a nifty auto-shutoff feature if the bath ever ran out of water to prevent the pump from burning out.6. Also a small mesh filter is installed to help keep loose debris (dirt, leaves, etc) from entering the pump and blocking it. There are 2 backup replacement mesh filters included as well.I highly recommend... As long as you don't require the pump to remain on all day without interruption due to sun going behind clouds.Works really well to be keep your bird bath fresher and cooler. It's a fun and versatile little gadget for bird baths or decorative water features. Neat gift idea too!Update April 2024: I'm one month shy of owning this for one year... And it suddenly died. Have run the pump daily in my bird bath and it never gave me a minutes trouble. Contacted seller to see if there was a fix... and they replaced the item for free! I'm very impressed with the prompt service and response from customer service.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy set up, works great!
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Very easy set up, only took a few minutes to get it working. The fountain works best in full sun and will stop as soon as the sun dips behind clouds. The solar panel is adaptable and could be easily positioned towards the sun. The solar panel does not store power like a solar light, no sun means no power, the stronger the sun, the higher the water output. I was able to turn a bird bath that was too deep for birds to ever feel safe enough to use, into a functional and beautiful addition to our backyard. I added a few rocks to give birds something to hold onto while they get a sip of water or cool off in a bath. Considering buying another one for a wildlife watering dish.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2023
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Surprising stream
reviewText: I own a small, shallow bird bath that I wanted to add a fountain feature to. But I needed a very small pump for it to work. This is the smallest I could find. It's adorable. It looks like a toy but it isn't. With direct sunlight on the small solar panel, the stream is a good 15" tall, and when it comes to fountains, size matters. It's actually too much for my bird bath. The water goes over the edge especially in wind, making the water drop below the required level. The pump then shuts off to protect the motor (a red LED confirms this condition). I'll have to use one of the alternate fountain adapters. It's also quiet.I do wish the solar panel was larger, as such a small footprint reduces its ability to be in full sun. I also wish it came with a taller ground spike to raise it above tall grass. It seems they decided on the size of the panel and spike based on what could fit in the small box, which isn't the best way to design products.Like most solar devices, the pump will stop if it doesn't get enough sunlight. The only way to avoid that is to get an electric pump and I'm not about to run a long extension cord under the ground. Plus I doubt I'd find an electric pump this small.The only other thing on my wish list was if it had several colored LEDs mounted on the top. That would've required more power, but not very much, and wouldn't have added much to the cost.My main concern is longevity, as some reviews said the pump died prematurely for no apparent reason, but that seems to be the case with many of them, not just this one. I had one solar and one electric fountain pump many years ago and both died after a short period.Fingers crossed this little guy lasts because it does the job quite nicely and at a very reasonable cost.

reviewText: I recently added the Passionbility Solar Fountain to my outdoor space, and I have to say, I love this little guy! reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Read if you live in a hot place!!
reviewText: Edit: I’m changing my review from 1 to 3. The little motor *does* work, but the water temperature can’t be too hot.Unfortunately for our little fountain, we live in the south and our summers are brutal. Yesterday morning it was working great, but as the day went on and the water heated up in the sun, its power dwindled. It needs full sun (no clouds whatsoever) to run consistently, but the temperatures also have to be just right.Basically, you get what you pay for with this little guy. It’s inexpensive, but with that price point comes definite quality limitations. I wouldn’t recommend this to someone who lives in an especially hot climate, but if you live in a more mild area, I think it would be just fine.———The little motor works great outside of water, but it almost completely stops as soon as it’s submerged. Water spits out sometimes, but it’s not a steady or significant stream.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2023
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars A lot of work for very little return
reviewText: 1) The instructions. Badly written & lacking crucial info.2) If you open the pump, this doohickey pops out. Do you see it in their diagram? No.3) I figured out on my own where & how it installs. It's the Hi or Lo switch.4) If the bird bath, for example, is not in a sunny spot, you can unwind the cord from underneath the solar panel and5) separate the pump from the solar panel in order to mount the panel in a sunnier spot, but now deal with a cord. The solar panel is 3' from my full spectrum growing light. I tried different levels of water, different heights of pump placement and raising the solar panel all the way up to the aforementioned light. All the pump did was just gurgle or spurt. Fountain did at one point spray as depicted in their diagrams using one of the many choices of fountain heads, but I can't get it to repeat. This feature of separating the solar panel from the pump, explains why there are suction cups under the pump (photo 4). 6) The solar panel did not respond one bit to my small growing bulb.I am waiting for a sunny day if we ever get one before my return window closes (my heart goes out to the wild forest fires in Canada) to test if this fountain can live up to it's claims. So far, not hopeful.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Make sure you clean it often
reviewText: I bought Aisitin solar fountain Pump 3.5W (X003QPSZXB) in late October 2023 & started to use around Mid-May 2024. Be sure to follow instructions & recommendations about frequency & how to clean. BE CAREFULL NOT TO DROP THE VERY SMALL PIECE OF PLASTIC INTENDED TO REDUCE WATER FLOW WHEN REMOVING FILTER HOLDER. Besides the outer filter needing cleaning if you see less water being pumped than usual & its floating on ample water, it is vital to access the impeller to clean it as well. In my case something small made it’s way through the filter & stopped impeller from turning. Once I washed the area it began pumping again.I took away a star because if the pump also had a battery back up it would in all likelihood pump for several more hours a day than it does because it stops when not in direct sun light. On very cloudy days or when a shadow falls on it, the steady flow of water stops & it just pulses water slightly or not at all.

reviewDate: Reviewed in Italy on April 29, 2023
reviewTitle: Fontana solare con tanti giochi d'acqua, per far divertire i nostri figli e far rilassare noi grandi
reviewText: 📜 Descrizione:Questo articolo, attualmente venduto al costo di 29.99€, arriva in uno scatolo brandizzato.All'interno troviamo la fontana solare, 4 sacchetti dove all'interno troviamo vari ugelli in plastica trasparente ed il manuale multilingua, anche in italiano.Per chi ha un giardino, ma anche una piscina, una di queste fontane è l'ideale, perché ravviva uno stagno statico o una vaschetta per gli uccelli.Questa, in particolare, ha un pannello circolare integrato alla fontana e la pompa è posizionata al di sotto. Non appena viene posta sotto al sole, inizia a funzionare automaticamente, senza alcun pulsante on/off... ...una sorta di crepuscolare al contrario.Logicamente, l'ho provata oggi e con il sole eroga tutta la sua potenza di 1.5W (che per muovere l'acqua è più che sufficiente).Il pannello solare ha una potenza d'assorbimento da 3.5W ed entrambi hanno 6V. La portata d'acqua della pompa è di 240l/h.Logicamente parliamo di un sistema totalmente impermeabile, in quanto deve stare dentro l'acqua per mesi ed, infatti, troviamo un IPX8.Cosa interessante è che la pompa può essere utilizzata anche per muovere l'acqua in strutture esterne, per ricreare ruscelletti artigianali, ecc..La mia impressione è che funziona bene... e la cosa che più mi è piaciuta di questa pompa è che il pannello solare sta fisso lì e non si separa dalla fontana, quindi non si vedono fili penzolanti scendere dalla vaschetta degli uccelli e la seconda cosa, è la presenza degli stabilizzatori che se aperti e, successivamente, allargati, tendono a tenere la fontanella al centro della vaschetta... rendendo il gioco d'acqua ancora più carino e d'impatto.In conclusione posso scrivere che questo articolo ha soddisfatto le mie aspettative e rende i miei figli felici, nel vedere i giochi d'acqua che questa fontanella riesce a realizzare.Logicamente il costo è un elemento importante da tenere in considerazione, ma esulerà dal voto finale in quanto, come membro Vine, voglio condividere con te solamente la mia personale esperienza con quest'articolo, poi starà a te valutarlo globalmente.💡 Suggerimenti/Informazioni:- Ti consiglio di pulire regolarmente il filtro, almeno una volta a settimana, per evitare che la pompa si danneggi. Specialmente, essendo in un luogo aperto, le impurità che si depositano nell'acqua sono molte e, queste, arrivano dritte nella spugnetta nera finendo col ridurne la portata... quindi, appena vedi che la portata del getto d'acqua viene a diminuire, anche se dopo 1 giorno o meno... pulisci il filtro, perché evidentemente ha filtrato sporco dalla vaschetta in cui si trova. (Chi ha acquari conosce bene i segreti dei filtri).- Se il sole va via (per esempio di notte), il pannello solare non eroga più energia e la fontana si ferma.Quindi, per tutto ciò scritto (basandomi sull'articolo arrivato), la mia personale valutazione è 5 stelle su 5.🖊️ Ps: In caso di novità effettuerò un aggiornamento.Ti saluto con la speranza d'aver risposto alle tue domande, dubbi o semplicemente alle tue curiosità... grazie per aver letto le mie parole e spero che questa mia recensione ti sia stata utile...Alla prossima!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Fountain!
reviewText: This fountain arrived quickly, and works well. It does NOT work in shady conditions, even a heavy cloud will stop the action. It came with many nozzles for different spray types. Easy to set up, and it WILL float in a pool or pond. (Not just for birdbaths!) I recommend anchoring it to a support hidden underwater, the plastic straw bumpers fall off readily and aren't really long enough to prevent water loss. For the money, it's a great little fountain. If you have a big pond and want something obvious from a distance, this is NOT your fountain. But if you have a small decorative pond and don't want to bother with wiring and possible electrocution, this fountain is superb- just unbox, attach your spray nozzle and plunk it in the pond.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good Price
reviewText: We bought the blue Yzert Solar Fountain 3.5W Upgraded Solar Bird Bath Fountain with 4 Fixed Pipes 7 Nozzles. As long as there is sun, it works. We have it in our pool and like how it look. The instructions are minimal, they could be better, we still don’t know how to place the pipes, but it is working fine. We bought this because it is solar and did not want anything with a battery. The different nozzles allows us to change it up. Early morning, you’ll get a short stream of water, as the day goes it becomes taller and stronger; the sunshine dictates the water flow and height of the stream. Glad we chose the blue; It is a nice bright blue. Price is fair, we may purchase a second one.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful & keeps mosquitoes out
reviewText: I wanted to add some sort of fountain to my birdbath to attract birds. This works perfectly. I use it more as a bubbler than a fountain. It has multiple options for fountain type and height. For me, if the fountain was to tall and windy, the water blew out, so it ran low quickly. The bubbler option works the best for me in the wind and doesn't scare the birds away. It easily assembled by attaching 4 tubes to the bottom, placing in the water, and removing the paper covering the solar panel. The hardest part is figuring out which fountain attachment (which is also easy to attach and change) to use. When I clean the birdbath every one to two weeks, I use my brush to clean around the water intake vents to keep it running smooth. I have not had to change the filter yet, been using it since March.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty fountain and keeps birdbath water clean.
reviewText: As other reviews have pointed out, the fountain only works if the sun is out. It doesn’t have a battery to store solar energy. Luckily, I live in a place where we get a lot of sun. I was a little worried because my brother told me I could burn out the motor If the water went dry. That’s happened lots of times with no problems. In fact, I can hear the motor quietly running even when there’s no water in the birdbath. But the fountain starts immediately as soon as I put water in. The fountain comes with different nozzles so that you can adjust the type of water flow. When you set it up, you have to attach four small tubes. These not only feed water into the fountain, but they keep the fountain centered. I’ve had the fountain two months and it works beautifully as long as the sun is out and I remembered to fill up the basin. The fountain is not only pretty, but it aerates the water to help keep it clean and free of green goop. For the price, I’m definitely happy.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect birdbath edition, circulates water and looks pretty
reviewText: I’ve had a couple of these over the years, they are a nice addition to our birdbath and circulates the water, sparkles to get the birds attention, and provides a nice sound.The solar panels work well and, if you keep the sponge filter clean, will result in a nice steady stream.We don’t use any of the attachments, as the bubbler is fine as is, and doesn’t spray water out of the birdbath.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works well but spits water out of the birdbath
reviewText: Fountain is easy to use and looks great, but it works a little too well in that it spits water out of the birdbath. I have to refill it twice a day, and that's in the PNW where it hasn't been hot! The first day I set it up, the sun wasn't even out, but the birdbath was almost empty by day's end. I tried all the different nozzles and combinations, but it still emptied the birdbath much faster than normal evaporation. Otherwise, it's pretty, quiet, and the birds appear to like it.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Birds love this
reviewText: Love this solar fountain. It works well and the nozzle sprays are all good. Works well and comes with filters you can replace to keep the water flow good.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good Idea, But Consider A Few Points Before Purchase
reviewText: This compact solar fountain is a good choice for areas of full, uninterrupted sunlight as it does not charge and continue to operate out of full sunshine to which I was disappointed with as my backyard patio is covered, but gets nice morning and evening sunlight in late spring through early fall. Thus this fountain barely performed in that location. I moved it out to the front deck which is full sun all day and it worked amazing. I spent several minutes changing out the different spray attachments to see how each worked and looked before selecting one. Changing the attachments is very easy so that is a plus. There are also four clips and plastic tubes which attach to the underside of the fountain to help it stay centered in whatever basin, birdbath, bowl or container it is placed, if you want, and the tubes can be cut to accommodate. Once I had it situated and my container filled with water, I was initially pleased with the power of the spray and the overall look. However, upon returning about 10 minutes later to check it, the fountain had STOPPED! It had used up all the water in the roughly 10inch diameter x 3inch deep basin! My conclusion was that most of the water spray had gone up and over the edges of the basin thanks to a light breeze and the attachment I had selected. Since I live in an area that is always a bit breezy, I'm going to need to reevaluate the size of the container to catch the falling water and/or a way to fully secure the fountain to the center of whatever container I use to avoid water spray over the sides.After all this, I'm not sure I will keep the product or if a submersible fountain set up will work better for what I want.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars FINALLY, a solar bird bath fountain that works!
reviewText: This is the THIRD solar fountain we purchased this summer. The first worked for a SINGLE DAY. The second worked for almost a week. This one has been going for a couple months with zero issues. It just works. You do need to pull the filter sponge out periodically to clean the debris off of it (grass, leaves, feathers etc), but it's so simple to do and the fountain will work perfect when reassembled. I'm so happy we finally found a fountain that works so well.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2024

It turns out this was the problem ...a few grains of sand had gotten in there and were preventing the impeller from spinning. So I can now recommend this product. It works well.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 14, 2023
reviewTitle: Well Made & Effective
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Thought I’d take a risk on a solar floating fountain as I’ve a couple of small ponds mainly for water adapted plants. The box comes with the solar panelled fountain and lots of attachments etc - usefully there’s a comprehensive booklet and there’s really not a lot to do other than placing the pump in the water - you allow the air to bubble out of it as you submerge it by placing it in the water at angle. It then floats and should start to work (it works even when cloudy but only minimally for obvious reasons). I have used the tube attachments which fit into the sponge (there are pre made slots in the sponge) basically to keep the fountain more or less centred in the planter.The placement of my ponds is a little shady and the pump did throw some water up but I considered it would be nice to have it sited somewhere where it could work for most of the day. I had a planter which came with a bung so filled with water and placed in an area of the garden I know gets more or less sun all day (north facing garden being the issue)….. and the fountain is great- very effective and super to have some water play as well as the sound. I think I’ll still end up buying another two for the ponds even if they do fall in shade at times during the day.Build wise the fountain is nicely finished and appears to be well constructed - the glass should be more resistant to the effects of UV unlike plastic. The pump started to work as soon as I got it out of the box - I’d recommend to anyone who has a water small feature in the garden - very reasonably priced.Update: had this for a couple of years now and still going strong. Bought 2 more since. Not sure why negative reviews are left when all the packaging clearly states it won’t work as well if it’s cloudy or dark - it would mean having to store the energy and that would mean a battery - a heavier item would not sit well in water. For the money this is great and works as it should. If the sprays seem weak you need to check that the mesh protecting the pump from debris doesn’t need cleaning as this usually the cause. Always good to check the glass for limescale build up (if topping up the water feature with tap water) as this inhibits the solar cells - BarKeepers Friend helps clean the glass if it’s just dull and limescale remover for deposits.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Strong little fountain
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This little fountain does what I want. It’s small but packs a punch. reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2017
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great at the beginning!
reviewText: I was very excited to get this pump as the reviews were good but most wrote the review soon after recieving it. I wanted to give the pump a little time before reviewing it. The little pump was powerful and the solar battery worked as it was written. When full sun hit the cell, the pump worked full cycle, but when a cloud or anything covered even part of the cell, the pump either stopped or slowed which was fine because that is how this particular one works, no power is stored for cloudy days, but that is OK. . BUT, after the second week of having it, the pump quit working all together. Now, I can't tell if it is the pump or solar part. I think it is the solar cell, because I feel no vibration of the pump at all, which I take as no power being sent to the pump. Maybe it was just bad luck and this particular little solar pump was just a lemon. I have not written to the seller yet as I don't think I have any recourse and am passed the time of return. I will update review if I speak with the seller.Follow up:The 5 star is for the seller. After reading my review they sent me out a replacement before I contacted the. Fantastic seller and a great little solar pump.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2017
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Pump, Needs More Nozzles
reviewText: pump is really great, Made a concrete pool for it and works like a charm. What it needs are more different nozzle styles. I modified one by closing the small holes around the outside and enlarging the one in the middle. This causes a small spray and less loss of water, a good compromise between using as blubber and having a lot of small sprays. Could also include a six foot plastic tube (3/8" inside dia) to give you more options and a way to easily drain your water container.For those wondering looks like the flow stops during an eclipse

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2018
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Updated - NOT Worth the money
reviewText: UPDATED - 11/23/18 - Well, that was short lived. It was working fine for a few days. Then it just quit. I took my fountain apart to look at the pump, nothing clogging it. I played around with it but could not get it to work. It just plain quit. Not worth it. I will save my money and purchase real solar fountain pumps.I bought this with little expectations, it was about $25 so I thought if it works great, if not I can have fun with the solar panel. (NOTE!!! I do not use the attachments for spraying, I just use the pump and solar panel to power a bird bath fountain I already have.)I bought it to power a small bird bath fountain which had a plug in pump that I never hooked up. It has sat around for about 5 years just holding water but I never used the pump that was in it.Went about cleaning it up and installing this little pump. Works very well for now. It does exactly what it says, it runs in direct sunlight and pushes the water up the approximately 18 - 24 inches of fountain. It does not have a lot of pressure but it pushes the water enough to circulate and make the fountain work. I finally have a running water bird bath.I just set it up today (11/16/18). If/when it fails I will try and remember to come update the review. I am going to experiment with placement of the solar panel to get the most run time. I also ordered another one so when this one fails (as it will, eventually) I will have another ready to use.Pros - worked out of the box, was able to adapt to my bird bath fountain, easy to use.Cons - did not have the little foam filter listed, that is it but I cannot give 4.5 stars.Overall very happy with it so far.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2016
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars The Fountain Works Well
reviewText: This fountain works very well. In fact, so well, that if there is a light breeze, it can pump out the birdbath. I drilled out the shower head attachment holes to 1.25mm to make the spray coarser and not too high. With the separate solar panel, one can orient it for best operation. On overcast days, the fountain pulses, but will not operate continuously. (It's solar remember).This was my second solar fountain. The floating style, while appealing, did not work in the low-angle winter New England sunlight. This one does.At first, it did not work, but required a light tap to knock loose some particles loose from manufacturing. Otherwise, it has worked flawlessly.There is a filter under the intake grille, so be sure to clean it occasionally.

I have it hanging on a hanging basket shepherds hook by a wire I installed through the two holes that were already on the frame of the solar panel. I did this so that I can change the direction of the panel to move with the sun. In the pictures you can see the position of the panel; the sun was not shining directly on the panel but the pump continually worked. It is not like this on cloudy days but is what I expected. I find that I prefer this over the ceramic battery operated water mover I purchased in 2016 which lasted one season before getting all corroded.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 26, 2024
reviewTitle: Works in all weathers - deserves 6 stars
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I've had a solar fountain for 4 years which finally stopped working so replaced it with the non battery version from this company. Unfortunately it only worked well in direct sunlight & stopped when the sun went behind a cloud. So I replaced it with this model and what a difference. It even continues to work on dull days due to the battery.The foam makes it float well and the clip on arms keep it towards the middle of the bowl. A great product.Don't waste money buying one without a battery if you live in the UK.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I pump to a horizontal manifold at 14" and drip down to plants
reviewText: Like others have said, the solar panel is sensitive to pointing almost directly at the sun but that's to be expected. reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2024
reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Requires full sunshine
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. The price was right and it shipped fast. There were minimal directions for assembly, but pretty self explanatory. Comes with a variety of fountain tips - which all do pretty much the same thing. I created a small fountain so I didn't need a big spray. However, the biggest negative is that it spurts when there is not full sun. If a shadow is on the solar cell anywhere, it won't work. It will do for this little project but won't buy again.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for diy fountains
reviewText: These do a great job on my DIY fountain leading into a small bird bath in my back yard. So far it's been in use for over a month and it's worked consistently. It has the power needed to carry the water up 3 feet to the top of the fountain. The kit came with plenty of fittings and tubing to do what I needed it to do. Another great feature is the auto shut off. My fountain isnt very deep, and during the 100 degree heat, i wasnt thinking about refilling it.Well water evaporated and the pump stopped running. I was qorried at first, but then realized it only turns on of water is contacting the pump which is awesome. The #1 reason for pump failure is running them dry, and with this you wont have to worry about it I have no complaints, and I'll be buying another set if I have another fountain project in the future.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works well with direct sun
reviewText: We attempted to use this in the Chicago Suburbs as part of a hummingbird water fountain. The system did a great job in direct sunlight. Clouds or tree shade rendered the system to no working as there was not enough energy to convert to drive the pump. I ended up changing over to a USB pump (wired) so the fountain could facilitate operating in all conditions and keep the water move for the hummingbirds and to stave algae growth. I think the product works, but our use case asked more of the product than it was capable.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars still working great!
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. UPDATE: After more than a year, pump is still working great. As long as you clean gunk out of the pump every so often, it will last a while. Honestly, I've only cleaned it three times so far.As soon as I put this out in the sun it started working. I am using it as a hummingbird fountain and it's perfect for that. I rigged up the fountain according to a youtube video I saw. Very easy assembly, the tubing that comes with it fits perfectly to the base of the pump. If you wanted to purchase additional tubing, the opening is right at 5/16". As you can see and hear in the video, it has a very strong flow coming up through the nozzle, I have the pump sitting at the bottom of an old planter and the water is pumping up through about 8" of tubing and is doing a pretty good job pushing water up and out at that distance. For a small pump, it is surprisingly powerful. I've had it for 2 months and I haven't had to clean the filter yet, but not much can get through the small holes I've made in the top cover, it keeps leaves and other debris from clogging filter.Two months later, it's still working very well. I also observed the fountain working in complete cloud coverage on a few occasions. It wasn't coming out as high as it was in the video, but it was a steady flow, to be honest, it is not the norm, most overcast days it does not work. The still photo was taken in the rain and you can see how well it was pumping out. The video was taken on a sunny day, but in a partly shaded area. It doesn't work at all at night, but it's not expected to, it has no battery back up. I would definitely purchase another one.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2024

reviewText: It worked great for a few months and has stopped working. I bought three different size pumps and only one with a different brand solar panel is still working.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 2 for the price of 1
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. The size is small but don’t let that fool you. These pack a powerful spray. All you need is at least 50% sub and you’re able to enjoy your water feature. Everything assembled great and it’s easy to use. You just need a planter and water. The water with provided tubing can handle 3 feet projection on a cloudy day. Great value. Can’t beat the price of 2 for 1. UPDATE: Have my water feature installed with tubing and fountain head sprayer. Sprayer does not fit tightly on tubing. I recommend cutting the tubing at an angle in order to get a snugger fit. Not a deal breaker but wish the sprayer attachment was the same size as fountain pump.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2024
reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Tubing does not fit the nozzles, no 'charge' - must have full sun, all the time
reviewText: I like the idea...however, living in reality where clouds are a real thing, if you do not have 100% sun (no clouds, no shade), do not have high expectations. When there is full sun on the panel, it works well. Otherwise, it barely runs. There is no 'battery' that gets charged in case you do have a cloud or two so it all but stops running. The very irritating part though was the tubing provided does not fit the nozzle pieces. I wanted a solar pump to make a small bird bath/water decoration. I am having to constantly move the panel so it gets 100% sun, I had to get an adapter to use the nozzles, and not all of them work with the adapter, so I'm limited there as well. I figure I'll keep this for now, but certainly would not recommend it to anyone else and will likely have to find a better option at some point.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It works flawlessly!
reviewText: What's not to like, it works flawlessly, easy instructions for setup and maintenance, various options for spray and the birds love it! I used an old 9" pie plate for the space I allowed. The dribbler spout gives enough water movement to attract hummingbirds, California Goldfinches and a sundry of sparrows.In the future, I may upgrade to a larger "bird resort" to take advantage of the other spray features. I know the hummingbirds would love that!Update RE Maintenance: it's necessary:-) I have regularly cleaned the bath and the fountains exterior. However, I found it not functioning one morning after about a month of use. No worries. I took it apart and cleaned the rotor following the instructions. Voila, back in the business of happy birds.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Nice pump and features, BUT this is the 2nd one I have purchased
reviewText: The pump worked well, so good that I purchased another since another 5 yr old pump stopped working.The pump worked for since mid March 19, 2024 and stopped August. I guess too good to be true since my last 2 pumps lasted 5 years. It seems the solar panel gave out and no longer supplied electricity to the pump. Now lets see how pump #2 does, it only has about 2 months in.They seem like a very nice pump set up and I know they only have 30 day warranty but it seems when the solar panel gets hit with a big rain water must infiltrate the panel and it stops working.Do not buy this product. This was my 3rd one, something changed in manufacturing and they are not as good as the first one purchased over 5 years ago.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars works great
reviewText: first off: even though I read the dimensions several times, I was still shocked at how small the solar panel was/is. . . having said this, it works soooooo well I literally just purchased a second one!! also, the cord is super long so there's plenty of flexibility to catch the sun & if yr around you can angle it to throughout the day as the sun moves for maximum effect.things to remember: this is solar powered ONLY, not electric, & there is no battery cell to store up energy so it will not work after the sun goes down (although it does seem to work - albeit more minimally - when it's overcast!).if you intend to use the larger fountain spraying attachments, you may need to use a wider bird bath/basin, something like a 20"+, to prevent water loss. for smaller basins the smaller nozzle attachment is probably best - it will provide movement, sound, & aeration without over spraying & water loss.also remember to periodically clean the pump! there's a sponge filter in there to catch debris - this needs to be rinsed out from time to time, & also an impeller to pull out & rinse off as well. performing these simple maintenance steps should keep these working great for some time to come.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect if you want a solar fountain but also prefer to keep your bird bath in the shade.
reviewText: SO happy with this little solar fountain! Went through three other solar fountains before finding success with this one. This is perfect if you want a solar fountain but prefer to keep your bird bath in the shade. The long cord allows you lots of leeway to find the perfect sunny spot to hang the small but mighty solar panel. Package includes various fountainheads which gives you many choices for different sprays. We prefer the "gurgling" head which minimizes evaporation.Easy to take apart and clean. We do this every week or so. Expected because the neighborhood birds LOVE taking baths in our clean, immaculate birdbath but boy, they sure do leave behind a lot of dirt when they bathe! It's very easy to slide out the little propeller, as well as sanitize the filter in a little bit of hydrogen peroxide. (Previous solar fountains we bought did not have a way to clean the motor, so things got pretty gross pretty quickly. Get this if you're a clean person and love providing fresh crystal clear water for our winged friends).Other likes: The suction cups hold the little fountain firmly in place. The volume of water flow is impressive considering it's size.Note: Water flow is best in the most direct sun. Even a slight tilt to catch the rays can make all the difference. This will not work under shade or with ambient light.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Its good but …
reviewText: I was hoping this would work well in a shallow birdbath. While it functions best when the birdbath is full, the spouts eject the water so high that it shoots out of the bath, causing it to empty quickly and stop working within a couple of hours, requiring frequent refills.Additionally, the solar panel only works in direct sunlight and is ineffective on cloudy days. The wire to the solar panel is also very stiff, necessitating the use of the provided stakes to secure it.Overall, this item works, but it doesn't perform as well as other all-in-one solar birdbath fountains I've used.

reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So fun to watch the birds!
reviewText: My mom requested a fountain for her birdbath for her birthday. She loves birds and has multiple feeders up and a birdbath, and thought a fountain would be neat. It’s worked really well! My mom puts about a gallon of water a day in it to keep it going. This seems to be all the maintenance it requires. Highly recommend if you love watching birds!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice fountain action with just solar power!
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This is a very nice fountain for a small water feature or pond for keeping water fresh and aeriated for bird baths and other wildlife like butterflies, dragonflies, etc. ... with no electrical cord or outlet needed!Please keep in mind that it needs good sunlight to work to it's fullest pumping capabilities. It will continue to work to a diminished degree if it becomes shaded during the course of the day, but don't expect it to spray as high as it is capable of doing under direct sun when it is very cloudy or in shaded conditions. That said, this new model works much better in the shade than my older model. You also should be careful that it's not emptying your water reservoir if it isn't centered so as to not spray water outside the bowl or pond ... especially if the wind picks up and blows the spray in directions you didn't anticipate. On this new fountain I'm using the included plastic "bumpers", on my old one I use rocks to keep it from drifting in the bowl. You will also have to play with the eight or so fountain heads to see which you like the best, as well as which heads don't spray water out of your reservoir and empty your water! Also, remember to check your water level in your reservoir on a regular basis, keep it free of leaves, etc., and occasionally clean the little fiber filter which only takes a moment to clean. Other that that this is a very dependable little "work horse" for a very reasonable price!I have an older day & night version of this fountain with LED lights and separate power bank and a sensor that lights up and sprays after dark that is still working very well after more than a year and a half, (see the ground level red/blue/green/yellow bird bath in the background). This particular new version is only a daytime version w/o the LED lights, (the copper/green raised bird bath in the foreground), but I like it quite well and it does work better in the shade than the older model. I see that they also still offer the day/night LED lighted version, so it's just a matter of preference and a bit difference in price.I included a short 8 second video of what to expect if your fountain becomes shaded during the day from clouds or from shading from a fence or tree blocking the sun at different times of day/season. That doesn't mean it's broken, just not getting full sun ... assuming the filter is not blocked, of course.I think you'll really enjoy this little fountain. I know my cardinals, blue jays, wrens and dragonflies do, as I can watch them throughout the day while they are drawn to and visiting my bird baths! ; -)

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality, long lasting
reviewText: Fountain works so well, made of great quality, long lasting materials. Solar panels work and Fountain pumps water every day, no problems at all. So simple to setup and beautiful to look at!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2023
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice little fountain ⛲️ But I wished it would work in the shade
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. It was super simple to set up and worked immediately. The only thing that I don't like is that it has to have full sun to operate. As you can see in my video, my shadow even causes it to not work at full strength. So I wished they could come up with something that would allow it to work in the shade. Because I don't want to put my birdbath directly in the brightest and hottest part of my yard. I wanted to put it in a flower garden that I have made for birds and butterflies which I purposely created to get only morning sun and not the hot afternoon sun. A place the birds can cool off in the shade and have a water source. But I cant put it there because the fountain doesn't work at all in that particular flowerbed. So it kind of defeated the whole purpose of getting it. In order for it to work, I had to move it to another flowerbed that is in the direct afternoon hot sun. The birdbath is small and shallow so when the fountain is working at full strength, the water sprays out of the birdbath which quickly empties it of water. So it will only work about 45 minutes max before the water is completely emptied out. This of course isn't an issue with the fountain but with my birdbath. Otherwise this is really a cute fountain and I like that it comes with different spouts so you can change out the waterfall style. It also floats around a lot and doesn't stay in the middle of the birdbath. Although it comes with these plastic straws to use as "arms" to keep it from moving, they don't help at all. I ended up having to put a rock on each one of the arms to keep it from moving. But by doing this means that my birdbath holds even LESS water than it normally does because of the rocks taking up space.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great
reviewText: Birds and butterflies love it

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Motor is easily plugged and may go out of order
reviewText: The usual issues with made in China stuff, the instructions appear to be written in English but, the translator is not fully fluent in English. They at least added some trouble shooting ideas....I bought two of these, with the thought that some parts might not work that well and I was right.The implication in the instructions is that if the pump fails it is due to either a lack of sunshine or a clogged filter...no mention is made that the motor itself can simply stop working, which one of mine did.If you hold the apparatus in the sunshine and you do NOT hear the motor, assume it has failed and NO apparent way to fix it exists.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars GREAT FOUNTAIN WITH MULTIPLE SPRAY PATTERNS !!!!!
reviewText: I was hesitant to buy this but SO Glad I did! I am using this in a hanging birdbath that is 12" round x 3" deep at the center. The assembly took less than 5 minutes. There are 7 different hard plastic spray nozzel attachments to create different looks to the fountain. I opted for the multi spray nozzel. At first it only shot the water up about 1 inch because it was still morning. Once the bright 11am sun hit the solar panels surrounding the fountain, the water shot up about 15 inches and ran steadily!!!! It was Amazing and Fun to watch!!! The only thing to be aware of, is that if it is windy, the sprays of water may go outside of your container, thus diminishing the water levels and could damage or burn up the pump. Just be sure you always have plenty of water at all times in your birdbath. I would Definitely suggest getting one of these. It adds fun to your birdbath and you can change the spray patterns Very easily!!!I took one star off, because it only has solar panels, and does NOT have a solar battery to keep the output of the fountain running constantly. Like they stated in their ad, if it is cloudy the pump will not function as well, if at all.A Great improvement would be to add a solar battery with a light sensor or timer, so it would operate during the day and would shut off at night. I know they do this with patio lights and garden lights so I'm sure it could be done.....

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable bubbler for the garden and birds
reviewText: This is the second fountain of this style I've owned. Although the fountain comes with several attachments that direct the water into a spray, I found that the straight forward gush of the unadorned fountain worked best for attracting birds. In addition, the lower height of a fountain's spray helps the water to stay in smaller vessels, so you don't have to refill them every couple of days. This fountain is simple and reliable. It emits only the gentle sound of a small water bubbler, which is enough to attract and not scare birds. A fun addition to any garden.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Twice+ daily refills required
reviewText: This pump definitely has its pros & cons. The pros are that it's inexpensive, and really pumps the water through it creating at times at least a 16-18" high stream of water. The cons are that if there is no sun, it doesn't work. It doesn't retain power that it can use later. If it's cloudy sometimes I will get intermittent bursts of water which isn't a bad thing, or none at all which is. One other con is that when it's really sunny out that fountain is powerful. So much so that it spews the water right out of the birdbath & onto the ground. What this means for me is that if I want my fountain going all day I have to refill it 2-4 times a day depending on just how sunny it is. If you don't mind refilling a few times a day on a sunny day, this is an inexpensive fountain that actually works.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2023
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Worked great but died in 10 weeks
reviewText: Update: 07/23/23The pump was great while it worked. However, 10 weeks after receiving it, it failed and would no longer work. I don't know if the solar panel failed or the pump itself died. I haven't taken it apart to diagnose the problem. It was never run on an empty birdbath and I would clean it on a weekly basis. I would flip it over when it was out of the water so it wasn't facing the sun to prevent the motor from running without any water. One evening it stopped when the sun went down and the next morning it wouldn't start up. I've now bought a different pump that has the panel separate from the pump so that the panel isn't submerged. Let's see how long that lasts.This pump includes stabilizing straws that keep it centered in the birdbath that I bought with it. Also, one of the included nozzles sprays water horizontally which keeps the water in the birdbath. The ones that spray the water vertically end up splashing the water outside the bath and the water gets drained in 2 ~ 3 hours. With the horizontal nozzle, the water stays for up to 3 days.The pump does stop working when it's no longer in direct sunlight even if it's bright daylight and the sun is shining in other portions of the backyard. It works for 6 ~ 7 hours continuously depending on how you place it.
