reviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on October 20, 2020
reviewTitle: Fun little solar fountain
reviewText: It needs full and bright sun. I live in BC, Canada, and if the sun isn't mid-summer hot, then the fountain doesn't perform well. I am sure that if you lived anywhere that had full sun (everywhere south of the 49th parallel?) , this fountain would be great. It was great, but the weather this summer could have been better. No fault of the solar fountain.In full sun it has a nice high fountain. When it has part sun it spurts and the birds don't like the erratic water pressure. I have 2 parrots and I was able to put them outside with this on sunny days and they loved the shower. If it is not anchored to the center of the water fountain, it can drain your water, because it has a 12"+ high fountain, that (depending on the wind and the shower head used) can spray water off the edge of the bird bath or dish that you use. The dish has to be large enough to catch the excess spray so you don't lose too much water.It is a great little solar fountain that needs a little set up from you, but otherwise creates a small area of cool air for the birds to bathe in, in the summer heat. The robin juveniles liked it the most.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My wife loved it
reviewText: I purchased this in tandem with a bird bath and recieved them the same day. It is decievingly easy to install. As soon as the sun hit it, it came to life in my hand. Unfortunatly the water inlet was located on the palm of my hand where the skin is thinnest. Soon the suction of the fountain had adhered itself to my hand with such force that I was unable to pull it off. In a matter of seconds, it started pumping a pretty, red fountian of blood out of my hand that was doing a Jackson Pollock painting all over the deck. My wife passed out so she was little to no help and I found myself alone fighting this parasitic puck that was slowly taking my life. In the throes of battle I turned, and for a second caught the rising sun through the crimson drops and thought "how beautiful" just before opening my eyes and realizing it was all just a dream.If you've made it this far, just know that the good reviews have already said it all. It works well. has plenty of fountain patterns, and is easy to assemble. I can't speak to longevity as we've only had it a few weeks but we are very satisfied with it and will repeat this purchase if it "breaks" for whatever reason.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic Solar Fountain Bird Bath - A Delightful Addition to My Garden!
reviewText: I recently purchased the solar fountain bird bath, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. This delightful addition to my garden has exceeded all my expectations. Not only does it attract a variety of beautiful birds, but it also adds a soothing and tranquil ambiance to the entire outdoor space. First and foremost, the solar-powered feature is simply outstanding. The fountain operates solely on the power of the sun, eliminating the need for any electrical connections or batteries. The fountain itself creates a gentle and mesmerizing water flow, which provides a refreshing and inviting space for birds to bathe and drink. One aspect that pleasantly surprised me was how well the solar fountain bird bath handles different weather conditions. While it functions optimally under direct sunlight, even on slightly cloudy days, it continues to operate efficiently. However, it is worth noting that excessive cloud coverage or prolonged periods of overcast weather can impact the battery abilities of the fountain. During such times, the fountain may not operate at full capacity or may temporarily pause until it receives sufficient sunlight to recharge the battery. Nevertheless, this occasional setback doesn't overshadow the overall performance and functionality of the bird bath.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Birds love this!
reviewText: Bluebirds and hummingbirds love this thing, and it is really dependable - I've had it for three years, and except for when I forget to clean the bath soon enough, it works like a charm! Sometimes, like when I am on vacation, algae can clog it a little, but a quick rinse and scrub cures it. This is a great gift for a bird lover!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars BASICALLY ONE FLAW
reviewText: This is a pretty nice little unit. Bought it last summer. Works well and motor quite powerful with lovely spray patterns. Does need to be in the sun. Slightest bit of shade will decrease or stop the spray. The one flaw is the amount of spray that makes it so pretty to look at and listen to is also its only negative. Needs to be in a large container or pond as it will rapidly empty with the slightest breeze. Take this comment seriously that everyone is cautioning in reviews. It is definitely a fact. I have mine on our south facing deck and most days there is a slight breeze. I fill it 2-3 times a day and it is a deep container. If you don't mind the inconvenience, for the price, it really is a terrific unit that adds a lovely ambiance to your patio or deck.

reviewDate: Reviewed in Germany on September 14, 2024
reviewTitle: Bewertung für AISITIN Solar Springbrunnen
reviewText: Ich habe den AISITIN Solar Springbrunnen vor etwa zwei Monaten für meinen Teich gekauft und bin bisher sehr zufrieden mit dem Produkt. Die Lieferung erfolgte rechtzeitig und das Gerät war gut verpackt, was für einen sicheren Transport spricht.Der Springbrunnen funktioniert einwandfrei. Die Solar-Panels sind effizient und sorgen dafür, dass der Brunnen tagsüber regelmäßig in Betrieb ist.Ein Punkt, den ich noch nicht beurteilen kann, ist, wie sich das Gerät im Winter verhalten wird. Ich werde es im Auge behalten und hoffe, dass es auch in der kälteren Jahreszeit gut funktioniert.Insgesamt kann ich den AISITIN Solar Springbrunnen bis jetzt sehr empfehlen. Er bringt Leben in meinen Teich und sorgt für eine angenehme Atmosphäre.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2024

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Zero assembly required
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Zero assembly required except securing the screw attachment for the power wire. The battery was already charged partially so the moment it hit the sunlight and the pump went underwater it began pumping. It seems high quality for it's class, the lowest priced class. I did not want to spend a lot on this item. It functioned flawlessly all day so far. As sunset came, it was also overcast and raining. There was enough sunlight to keep it pumping!!! Most fountain pumps would have stopped at this point. The extra features of a battery to keep pumping for a while after dark, compared to direct current to the pump is great. The feature to prevent overheating of the pump by low water levels is also great, most in this class lack that feature. It has a long power cord so the solar panel can go in a better light area than the container pond which is partially shaded intentionally. I honestly think that his is the highest quality system in the $14 to $17 USD price class. Pick this one. (in the video attached, I did not add the fountain attachment and instead only need the water to move across the surface, you actually get better aeration and cooling that way, but you can still see the water move. the betta fish seems to like it.)

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works Great!
reviewText: Birds love this fountain in their birdbath. I previously had the round floating version with the solar panel right on the fountain. This fountain has a remotely placed solar panel so the birds can splash in the bubbling water as much as they want. They love it! The battery backup keeps it bubbling for hours after the panel is out of the sunlight. Very happy with it!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023

I can see that dirt will compromise function if I’m not vigilant about keeping gunk out of the bird bath on a daily basis. That’s kind of annoying. For that reason I’ll probably just get a water jiggler when this thing inevitably breaks. A bonus… you’re not limited to the nozzle assemblies in the pictures. I played with it and have more of a bubbling action going. My bird bath is on the small side, so the tall spray patterns were pumping the water outside the basin and it turned itself off pretty quickly.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great fountain for the price
reviewText: The GAIZERL Solar Fountain Bird Bath Fountains Pump was purchased to provide a fountain for an improvised bird bath. Though some reviews claim it does not work in the shade, I found that it works in spurts in an overcast sky. When it builds up enough energy, it will pump water for a few seconds. This occurs about every 5 or 10 seconds. So for my purposes that is good news. I don't want the bird bath water becoming stagnant and encouraging an infestation of mosquitos.In full sun, the pump works well for its size and power. With the 8-nozzle head, the spray is approximately 18 inches high. I am using the side spray nozzle as the wind was blowing the tall spray all over. With the side nozzle in full sun light, the pattern is approximately 12 to 14 inches in diameter.This review asked for a rating on longevity. I have only had the pump a few weeks. So far, I am pleased with its performance. At this price, it can easily be replaced without too much hassle.The arms that keep the pump away from the sides of the bird bath are approximately 4 to 5 inches long. They do a good job keeping the pump away from the edge of the bird bath. There are no instructions of how the arms are to be fastened to the pump. Sliding the fitting in the locations on the bottom of the pump were there is a rubber section seems to work.I wanted the pump to stay centered in the center of the bird bath. I used a clear plastic container that food chains use for prepared fresh fruit. It's diameter is about an inch larger than that of the pump. My bird bath is 4 inches deep. So i cut the plastic container down to about 3 inches high to keep it below the surface of the water. I drilled holes around the lower portion to allow the water to flow into the pump. Small pebbles hold the container from moving around. I will change that to using industrial double stick tape to hold the container in place. Then I will not need the small rock to weight the container down. The pump floats nicely in the center of the container. As a result, the arms are not needed.

The little pipes used to keep the pump in the center do not stay on. I am going to glue them in place then it will be good.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So Cute!!! Love it!
reviewText: I love this fountain! The photo that I included was taken on a cloudy day when it was lightly sprinkling rain. The water, in straight-up sun, usually sprays up about 12 inches. Tbh, I got this a few weeks ago. I opened it, and there were several tiny plastic bags with parts, and I didn't feel like dealing with it. I wish I had put it out sooner! Today I dumped out the package. The little parts included are not complicated. There is 1 piece you stick on to be like the fountain part. Then you choose one cap to be your sprayer thing. There are several choices. I just picked one and haven't tried the others yet. Then you stick the 4 things that look like straws on the edge around the bottom. These are just to keep it from drifting to the edge of your container. I filled an old planter with water just to try it out. It works perfectly in full sun! I love it! I'm planning on doing something more creative with it. Maybe I will create a rock garden around it and have this in the center. I love the soothing sounds of water trickling. This fits the bill for me! There's no way I could afford one of those expensive, outdoor fountains. At this price, I plan to buy several more! I want to put one in my bird bath to see if the birds enjoy it. We are redoing landscaping in our yard, and I will make unique places to put them. Low to no maintenance!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best one so far
reviewText: I have tried several solar fountains and this one is the best so far. It has a glass panel so is easier to keep clean, and I really like the stabilizers to keep it centered in the birdbath and the additional cleanable filters, which some of the ones I tried didn't have.It isn't as powerful as some of the others I've used, but in my case that's a plus. For a regular-sized birdbath, the higher wattage models often pump so hard the water ends up on the ground, or getting blown away in the wind, and you run the risk of the fountain running dry or low, which can negatively impact the motor. In a larger water feature or pond it wouldn't be an issue.I really love the action of the water and the fact that it runs off solar. Yes, that means it doesn't run in the dark, but it's surprising how much it does work even in limited sun or on cloudy days. I just want it to have enough movement to discourage mosquitoes -- and to enjoy the water movement.I bought one of these to replace another that had failed and liked it so much that I bought a second to replace a working fountain (2 birdbaths). Give it a shot if you want a nice water feature in your garden at a reasonable price and with no digging or wiring!

reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great price, pushes water up 5 inches even in the shade
reviewText: I actually bought this for use as the pump for a hummingbird feeder, after watching a YouTube video "Hummingbirds Birdbath How to Make $1 Flower Pot into EASY Hummingbird Solar Fountain". What I didn't think about was that our place for where the hummingbirds land is actually in the shade of the back side of our house. This means that it isn't a continuous stream of water. BUT... thankfully the way this item works is that when the light is very low, it runs the fountain for like half a second... then shuts down for a second, then runs the fountain for half a second... and so on. And the power is tiny: only enough to lift the water about 5 and a half inches when the panel is in the shade.It turns out though, that this tiny lifting ability, and intermittent operation, is still perfect for my use case. It's great to be able to make a birdbath so cheap!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than expected, updated: still working
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I know some have written less than positive reviews. I guess I have been blessed with a good pump. I had previously purchased this pump a couple of years ago. Held up to I would say heavy use. Decided to get a new one and chose this one again. I have actually had great success with it. Has pumping power that I would expect and runs well. It does state that it needs to have full sun for optimum operation. Well, yesterday had stormy weather, rain expected. I went out on the deck and that little pump was still bubbling even with complete cloud cover. Then rain came, still kept bubbling. (attaching photos/video). Although not full power pumping, the little bubbling was quite nice. I'm ordering another one for a different area and would recommend this one for a great little garden/bird bath addition.Update 5/6/2024: This little pump keeps on working. It's had pretty much constant use since I installed it. Even in the hint of sun behind clouds it still has a little bubbler action. I'm still pleased with it and did purchase another unit, no problems with it either.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Works ok as long as it has FULL sunlight
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I didn’t realize this was the same one I bought last time. It lasted about 6-7 months last time I bought it, which isn’t terrible for the price. My biggest issue is the ad clearly says their solar panel will work “even with a leaf on it” compared to other brands and this is simply not true. The moment any tiny shadow is on the solar panel, even in direct bright sunlight, if a tiny corner or anything is covered it stops working entirely. I’m already finding myself moving the panel constantly to keep it in the sun so I can enjoy the sound of running water. I decided to just return it for one with a battery back up since it’s only a few dollars more and they’re built to last longer and just work better all around.The pump/suction works well but these are not built to last. My last one worked for quite a while, but it very obviously wasn’t putting out the same amount of power after only about a month, even with cleaning it often.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2023
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Lasted 3 Months
reviewText: Not sure if I got a bad pump or what since the reviews for this particular pump are good, but I bought this fountain in mid-July of last year (2022) to use for a hummingbird fountain. I assembled my fountain and had it in use from the end of July to the beginning of September (about 2 months) and it worked great. Before it could start freezing out, I drained the pump, cleaned it (full disassembly), and brought it inside for the winter. I brought it out and set it back up again at the beginning of April of this year (2023) and it was working great until earlier this week (less than a month), when it stopped working almost entirely, with the solar panel in full, very bright sun (upper 60's & clear skies). I completely disassembled the pump to clean it, but found nothing blocking/stopping the impeller and while the impeller wasn't spinning, it was occasionally "flinching" so the motor is getting power. Even though the solar panel looked clean, I wiped it off with a damp towel to see if that would improve solve the problem. It didn't. The pump & its solar panel have never been run dry, roughly treated, frozen, had the power cord kinked/damaged, or even been plugged up with debris...it just quit working for no reason.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It really does work
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I was skeptical this thing would even work. I live in South Florida and despite full sun baking everything all day most solar items don't work or don't display as brigthly as the listing says - but this does! I was pleasantly shocked when I put this together and it immediatly started functioning. My bird bath sits in a part sun / part shade area and its very shallow. Despite those two aspects this fountain immediatly started working. Assembly was very easy; just insert the centering straws, adjust to the fountain width, add the pump cover and fountain tip and off it went. I appreciate that 8 heads came with it so I could choose my desired water pressure/height. Had it for a while now and still surprised at the power for a solar item. It also came with a few filter replacements for the future. I really like its automatic water level sensor that shuts it off when the water gets too low. I have had several plug-in fountains and they all burn out from constant running when the water is too low. I like this solar unit because there are no cords. The colors at night are much more vibrant than I expected which was a nice surprise. Its also very quiet - all you hear is the sound of the water trickling, not the motor which my birds like. I got this unit to keep the water flowing for my birds and to avoid standing water to attract bugs. Turns out all the wildlife like it. Yes it took them a day or two to adjust to it but now they come for water and it doesn't bother them. It's oddly relaxing to watch especially at night when the colors are most vibrant. Very pleased with this unit and I highly recommend it. Yes its a bit pricey but you get what you pay for. I hope in the near future the makers add an app to this unit so you can control the colors. Right now the unit cycles through the different colors very nicey but I would like the option to choose my color in the future.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars [Quit Working] Beautiful glow in sand-colored concrete bird bath
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. 2023-04-09 Update - quick working. Product will occasionally spit water during the day but quits far before sundown and doesn’t light up. Started less than a week ago. It has been out in the open too, so charging isn’t the issue. Water level is the same shallower level as when it was first working fine.[initial review]Easy to put together, and works in shallow water.Best thing about it is the glow that comes off the sides at night; combined with the gentle sound of water - this is an awesome addition to circulate birdbath water and provide some evening ambiance.Would buy again based on current performance.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2022
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Looks great at night
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. If it is shady the fountain doesn’t have enough power to work. It spurts on and off, and even from the shadow of your own body it will turn it off. So if you want it to function during the day, and your fountain gets shade, this may not be the one for you.However, it stores power it gains during the day and at night the fountain is shorter and the color changing light turns on. It is really nice and runs for hours and hours like that.There are many different tips to create all sorts of water displays, and it has a very powerful spray.The straw like things to keep it away from the edge of the fountain and emptying out the fountain are a plus. I do wish the straws were longer because my fountain is pretty wide and it would keep it on the center more.I love that it has a sponge filter to keep it from being plugged up. There are also spare sponges if you need to replace the original.I am pleased with this purchase.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Only on sunny days!
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I added this solar fountain to my deck for the summer. It works fine as long as the solar panel gets direct sunlight. The brighter the sunlight the better the fountain works. On cloudy days, there was intermittent water spray or none at all. I ended up attaching the solar panel to an extension pole, so I could adjust the panel to always be facing the sun. Not ideal for me, if it constantly needs adjusting to maintain the flow. It would be perfect if it was located in an area that always has direct sunlight. For me, as the sun moves across the sky, my deck doesn't always have direct sunlight. I will say that this little solar panel does generate ample power. To its credit. when sunlight conditions are just right, this fountain works great with beautiful spray pattern accessories. As an experiment to keep the fountain flowing consistently without direct sunlight, I tried some alternate lighting. This little solar panel responds to a Phillips 1600 fluorescent Twister bulb. I would recommend this fountain, only if you can keep the solar panel in direct sunlight.

This is both good and bad as it means if the water runs dry (can happen in hot summers) the pump will still run even though dry as long as their is sun for the solar panel.So as long as you keep the water topped up or hide the panel if you don't want it running this really is a great addition to a garden.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love It!!
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This thing is great!! I’ve only had it a few days but so far it’s exceeded my expectations. I didn’t have high hopes because my bird bath doesn’t receive full sunlight all day. But it works just fine - even on a mildly cloudy day! And the birds freakin LOVE this thing. Within an hour of setting it up droves of them were coming to check it out. I have never really seen blue jays or mockingbirds at the bath previously but now i have a few of them visiting several times a day. The funniest are the four sparrow fledglings that spend most of every morning playing with it - just like kids at a water park! They take turns jumping into the shower and getting a good dousing and now they’ve figured out they can ride on it too LOl! A few things to consider;1. How deep is your bird bath? Mine is a good 2.5 to 3 inches. A shallow bird bath may not work as well with this.2. If the wind blows heavily or the fountain isn’t anchored and drifts to one side you may run out of water quickly. I had to play with it a bit - I don’t like using the stabilizers because they leave little room for the birds to bathe. I tried all the different spray patterns and occasionally used rocks to keep it in the best spot. In the end I found a nozzle that works well and keeps the water in the bath without needing anchors.3. I think this thing is supposed to light up at night. I haven’t really seen that yet - maybe it’s because it’s summer and the days are so long that it runs out of stored power long before it’s fully dark. This wasn’t a feature I really cared about so I don’t miss it but if you do keep that in mind.I’ve already got more enjoyment out of this thing than I ever expected - well worth the price!

reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works very well!-update! Great Customer Service, Sunnie!
reviewText: The battery backup works to keep it going. The first 3 days were cool and cloudy( the water turned to slush in the 32° temperatures!) but the fountain continued to spout! Sunny days see a plum a foot high. The birds love it! I like the stabilizer straws that keep it centered. The motor and filter are easy to clean. Overall, a good buy!☆☆☆☆Update-22 June 24:A large bird took a bath and broke one of the staw & brackets that keeps it centered in the bath. I contacted Sunnie in Costomer Service, June 19th. I received a replacement today, June 22nd! Faster, more friendly and efficient service I have not seen in retail! I'd buy from this company just because of their employees and "can do it", attitude!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The BEST Small Solar Fountain/Pump
reviewText: I tried a few solar birdbath fountains and they did not function if the sun was not shining brightly. They also clogged with algae when it was hot and sunny. I bought this fountain as a last ditch effort. It cost more but it was well worth it. It pumps all the time even if it is a little cloudy. The best part is you can easily clean the pump and intake. It is very easy to clean. It has a small foam pre-filter that you rinse with water to clean and running water in the hole where the fountain heads are inserted clears debris from the pump. It also has sensors that will shut the pump off if the water level drops too far. The prevents the pump from burning out. There are also small plastic straw-like tubes that hold the body of the fountain in the center of whatever vessel you are using. I highly recommend this great little solar pump/fountain.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hard working little powerhouse of a solar fountain, easy to clean!
reviewText: I've purchased two of these so far in the last few months. They work well and are simple to clean. Pay attention to how it comes, how the center part is popped out, because to clean it later you pop that center part out again, rinse off the black sponge filter and all the slits w/a hose, and pop it all back together. Couldn't be easier. (Years ago I had gotten a different brand solar fountain and I didn't realize how to disassemble and clean it since it came assembled. So I never cleaned that one. Ooops.) So in addition to being easy to clean, and just powerful, it looks to be better constructed than my old one. I do wish the manufacturers lived in a world with wind so they would understand that you cannot use any of those cute fountain attachments to make the cute high spray patterns if you have a regular sized bird bath. Yes the straw-like spacers this fountain come with are cool and helpful, but if you use any of those spray-heightening attachments your spray would be too high and a breezy day would blow it out of your fountain and empty your fountain quickly. So you just use no attachments and it's a single bubbler look where the water goes up maybe 1.5" and back down. (This issue would exist with any brand fountain.) Then the only reason your fountain will empty is because a deer keeps visiting to drink up, but I don't mind. :-) It's now a bird & deer fountain. This seller is so thoughtful in other ways (in the good design and quality of the fountain) that I wish they wouldn't give people unrealistic expectations re. spray heights for bird baths. Now if you have some big pond, then you can play with 1' high pretty spray patterns. Anyway bottom line, this is the best brand to go with for sure due to quality, ease of cleaning, and spacer staws are cool, but do clean it somewhat regularly to maintain best functioning.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2018
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly effective!
reviewText: Okay, so I was very skeptical when I read all these reviews on how great this filter/pump is, but at $79.99 it was definitely tempting enough to take the risk.Came on time, and like others I went ahead and dissassembled everything to make sure all the pieces were tightly connected. By chance, in my case it was! I had one issue though - and it was opening the UV light compartment. There's this plastic lock mechanism that's tightly stuck and I was too afraid to force it open by hand so I just picked it up and shook it around to see if I could hear a rattling lightbulb - but I didn't. (note: this was a HORRIBLE decision on my part and I was lucky I didn't damage anything). I had to google to see if I could find any "box opening" videos and found out that this is the EXACT same model as the pondmax sf650. (Google/youtube that name and you'll come up with a few demos as well as "how to" videos.)I bought this mainly to put in a large rubbermaid container for an in between fish pond. The water was thick murky green and you couldn't see anything even if you put your hand right underneath the water line. The container is in full sun and I would estimate it's about 25-30 gallons. We did a partial water change (didn't help much) and then simply put the filter in and played with the different heads. (we just use the disk shape fountain head and the others seemed to work too so I'm not clear on which head didn't work for people)The timeline for me was basically this.Day 1 - Nothing - no noticeable changeDay 2 - GREY WATER - all the green colour was leeched out and it was still thick and murky but like scummy dish waterDay 3 - still grey, but around the edges of the container you could see some clearing upDay 4 to 7 - Slowly clearing up but significantly murkyDay 8 - Can the bottom but still a bit murkyDay 11 - Crystal clear. You can see right to the bottom and there's nothing clouding the water at all.Again, I don't have a full sized pond, but just a 30ish gallon container that was really filthy and gets full sun all day. I have about 12 small 2" and under comet goldfish in it so the bioload is quite heavy.I'm 100% satisfied with the purchase and if this thing still works in a year I'll be sticking with this brand and model.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Destroys Algae
reviewText: My plastered pond was so green and sludgy. I bought this to replace an older filter. After a couple days, I noticed the algae began to decay and clump in piles on the bottom. I took a sump pump and sucked out the dead algae. The results were truly remarkable. A crystal clear pond and happy healthy fish. The UV light worked better than expected. Highly recommend this pump and filter.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2021
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Painful to clean but it does its job.
reviewText: Update: This is a pain in the backside to clean but after a complete breakdown and cleaning the pump is working fine. Upped the score to four stars. The fountain accessories and latches to lock the top in place are pretty fragile.Original: I used this in a 110 gallon garden pond with a couple of small koi. After a couple of years the pump would fail to start after a cleaning. The fountain attachments worked reasonably well but easily break when removing for cleaning. I had to buy spares. Now approaching 3 years of use and the pump has failed completely. I never had any indication the UV was working. There's a little light tunnel which never looked different.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars AWESOME FILTER READ LONG REVIEW... SORRY
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Ok so I waited about a month to do a review of these filter/ pump combo, that also include some pretty cool fountain attachments.Now by my video and pictures you may be able to see my set up. I have formed plastic ponds not ponds with liners. Iv had them 25yrs and have used all kinds of filters. That said there's actually 2 ponds made to look like 1 continuous 1. One's 250 gallons the other 175.Now that you have the background. I bought 2 units 1 for each pond and have ran them for over a month now. And anyone who complains is either a troll or has no pond experience.The UV can ONLY be seen at night and there longer you use the filter the window that shows the uv light gets dirty abs you might not see but look close its on!When it comes to keeping pond clean and clear anyone who thinks a filter alone will do that is a fool. I use chemicals ( sludge reducer, pond clear, algea control and something to kill ammonia for my koi) too but very very little. Literally once a week only a few tablespoons to help everything else out. I also keep bio balls, the ones with foam in them in the waterfall section to promote good bacteria.Ok so as you can see I have waterfalls but use pumps separate from these units that are just stand alone pumps to move water.Now inside these filters I have read complaints about the 3 boxes inside 2 being heavy and the 3rd being very light so you must have gotten ripped off.... wrong 2 boxes contain gravel like you would find in a fish tank that uses as filtration and the 3rd contains plastic mini bio balls all of these 3 are to filter and promote good bacteria growth that upt pond needs to be balanced for fish and plant growth.Feel free to ask any questions as I am very very pleased with these filter systems and having had issues with other filters floating or clogging or just not keeping pond clear over the 25years in this hobby. These out performance of one's i.v paid double or triple for is amazing. Now you do have to take unit apart to house filter and 3 boxes 2 or 3 times a month but if you didn't have to then upt filters aren't working. After first cleaning you will see what these units collect that keep upper pond crystal clear all season long!!!

reviewText: I was trying to find a fountain that I didn’t have to chase around the sun all day so it would be charged enough to run at night. This one seemed to fit the bill. Unfortunately, these were its shortcomings:• Power cord is too short.Unfortunately the cord is very short so I needed an extension cord.• No auto shut off if out of the water.You shouldn’t operate it out of water so you have to unplug it every time you clear out the fountain (ever night so the raccoons don’t topple it).• Suctions don’t hold.Fountain tilts to one side soaking my nearby cushions.• Power is very low.My bird bath is 23” in diameter, this looked disproportionately small. The +/- fountain height was useless.• No way to secure the lights to the pump.I had to elastic band the lights to the pump so it doesn’t float away or turn upside down.• No fountain attachments.Self explanatory.It’s being returned.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2017
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exceeded expectations
reviewText: I bought this to pump new antifreeze into an engine and it worked well. It appears well made. It was self priming and easily drew liquid from 16" lower than the pump inlet. And it was quiet. I believe it was rated at 1.2 gpm but it appeared to pump at least 3 times that volume (with no back pressure because I was pushing fluid out with the new fluid going in). The wire leads are about a foot long. The fluid inlet/outlet are barb style and fit 3/8 ID tubing. The mounting feet are a really flexible rubber material and should provide good cushion from vibration if it's mounted (like in an RV). It was well packaged (wrapped in several layers of bubble wrap and boxed) and came with clear operating instructions. The pump has a a pressure cutoff switch (so it can be used in a closed water supply system) that the instructions say is adjustable (by turning a screw in the pump head). My application was an open system, so I did not get to test the pressure switch. Nice pump...lots of features at this price level.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2022
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Mine works fine with no leaks. It's loud, buzzy, and vibrates by virtue of what it is
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I bought this to cycle cleaning liquids into and out of the heater core for my Jeep. I'm too stubborn to remove the whole dashboard to replace the heater core with something aftermarket and inferior. So I used this transfer pump to cycle a mixture of CLR through the core and then let it sit, cycle it for a minute, let it sit, etc.... This ate up all the rust particles. After that, I used the pump to flush clean water through the heater core and moved onto my next chemical cocktail. Next, I used Prestone's citric acid coolant system flush chemical and cycled that through the heater core with this pump. Let it sit, cycled the pump, let it sit....What I'm getting at is that neither a basic or acidic liquid being sent through this pump caused it to fail or start leaking. So that's a big win in my book. I rinsed the pump out by putting clean water through it when I was done using it and put the rubber caps back on both ends.I powered the pump with a 5 amp, 12vdc power supply and it worked just fine. The pump itself vibrates so if you have it mounted to anything that will amplify noise, you're going to heat the buzzing. It's kind of loud for what it does. That said, I am sure it's putting out at least a gallon per minute. It seemed to work just fine. I can't comment on how it would work after hours... days... years? of service... But it did what I wanted to do for my project, so it gets a good review from me.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Powerful if noisy little pump
reviewText: I use this pump to drain automotive windshield washer tanks when switching from winter washer fluid to summer fluid. Works perfectly! If used as designed for an RV's fresh water system it might be a bit noisy though.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2017
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Decent choice for driving a water vacuum aspirator.
reviewText: I'm having a good experience with this so far. I'm using it to run a vacuum aspirator for doing vacuum distillation; this outperforms low-pressure, high-volume pumps (like fountain/aquarium pumps) by a factor of 5 for that purpose, easily.This pump is rated to draw under 40 watts, so you can use any computer power supply to run it. I've wired mine directly to a cheap, spare PSU I had laying around, but I'd recommend using an ATX breakout board if you want to go this route; some ATX PSUs won't stay on unless they have a load on some of the lower voltage lines, which a breakout board should handle for you.I've been running this for several hours at a time over the last couple days, and have had no issues with excess heat; after a few hours the motor housing is only slightly warm to the touch.The only con to this pump in my application is that when operating it in an enclosed room, it's a little noisy. The sound doesn't carry through walls or anything, but the vibrations do carry through the intake and output hoses; if either of those hoses wind up resting against a box or something, it'll be quite loud. I recommend mounting this pump to something heavy and to avoid operating it on top of any table that's prone to rattling.All in all, I'm quite happy with this. It serves the purpose I bought it for at a very reasonable price point.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2018
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars bayite 12V DC Fresh Water Pressure Diaphragm...
reviewText: It is an okay pump but nothing special. received it today and added the connector(The one I bought locally) to the wires, that I need(It does not come with a plug-just 2 bare wires). Wiring is very thin. Am guessing 22 to 24 gauge wire. Really too small for a max 3 amp motor. Had to fix a loose connector from the red wire that plugged into the motor. The connector had not been crimped enough and was loose on the motor plug. Also noticed that the motor is not completely encased. You can see that on the description page of this motor. That is not good. No matter where this motor is installed(inside or outside), dust and moisture will get into the windings. It is not a waterproofed motor and does not claim to be. I will be using mine on a 15 gal sprayer pump pulled behind my lawn mower. Dust will get into it and I have to be careful if it starts to rain while using it. As stated by other reviewers, the 2 small clamps that come with it are useless. Go buy a decent pair, if you cannot reuse the ones on your bad motor. I also have to reverse the motor/pump 180 degrees from the old bad pump-as the water flow through it is opposite. All in all, it is not bad for $22.00. Will install it tomorrow and see what the pressure is like. If I can get 6 months use out of it, I will be happy. 6/25/2018--Installed motor/pump today. Will have to buy another piece of intake line(From inside of tank to input plug on motor) due to having to reverse the motor position 180 degrees. Intake line is now about 8 inches to short. Pressure is not bad but not real great either. It will do what I need it for but would not recommend this motor. 7/22/18 edit-Pressure turns out to be pretty good. After 2 uses, had to turn down the pressure as I was going through too much weed killer to quick. Nice pump but the exposed windings are my main issue...

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2023
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars A no buy
reviewText: This will save you a whole bunch of time and money.The pump does not run on solar directly.Battery must be turn on for the pump to work.You can however run it and charge it at the same time. How efficient that might be..... Im not sureI checked the voltage with my meter and can see the jump when the panel is plugged in.It might extend your pump past the 4 hr mark however it doesn't stop it from draining. It'll just drain slower.By doing this. Yeah definitely the battery will have a shorter life and you might end up with dead pump next month.They state that you can run it on solar only.But there is no function button for that.You are better off getting a regular pump.Soldering it to a spare solar panel or one you buy, then it'll run on solar.The pump also itself is just ok.Not very powerful honestly.It's comparable to a lower budget solar pump.At this price, this is not acceptable.Your essentially paying for a small, simple no hassle pump. Something that will last the evening party, when people come over.Then after that. No more. Have to recharge.I was hoping to run it on solar in the day. Then into the night I can use battery function.So ultimately this thing is limited.I only turn it on when I'm out there.And off when I leave.That is the only option.Also I have to disconnect the solar when I'm running battery in the day time. For the peace of mind, knowing I'm not putting extra load on the battery.I also open it up.It's bad, guys. Come on🧐 it's a cheap battery. For that price.Really for the price thoughYou can get a couple other solar pumps that will compensate for what this thing is lacking.Last point ☝️..... The solar panel wire to the the battery is Soo short. But the light and pump wire is longer.Why not make the solar wire the same length or even longer ?The company does have some better cheaper alternative. But this specific product. I say is a no go.Or maybe they just need to update it or upgrade it.Version 2 🤣It does have a cute little 🎁 box and pumps a little.So I suppose it's worth 1 star.But if it had not worked.O O zero my friend..

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Only Works in Full Sunlight - But when it works it's great!
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I didn't realize that, being a solar fountain, this would not work at all unless it was in full sunlight. I thought maybe it would work less, or be smaller in height when it was cloudy. NOPE. When the sun is out all the way, it works GREAT. But if it's overcast, nothing. I have it in a small pond and have noticed that when it's partly cloudy, it works intermittently and spooks the birds as it suddenly starts and then stops. I plan to keep it, since I want something to disturb the surface of the water so insects won't lay eggs. It comes with a set of plastic straw-like leg attachments to keep it from bumping up against the edge of the pond. I stuck one of the legs between two rocks to hold it in place, since it always seems to drift to a spot where there's a shadow, and then it stops working. I may attach a little anchor to keep it more centered. It's great, just be aware it ONLY works in full sunlight!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2024

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just What I Wanted
reviewText: I wanted this fountain filter to put in my spare 100 gallon Rubbermaid livestock water tank. I have 20 goldfish in it and it can get dirty and green in a little over a week.This unit keeps the water clear. I can see the bottom of the tank where in the past after 2 weeks or so because of the green algae I couldn't see down 12 inches or so.The setup was easy. You have a choice of 3 fountain patterns. Cleaning the filter is no problem. Unplug the unit, dump the water within the fountain off to the side as dirty water will pour out.As others have said, don't forget to take the screw out from the bottom side.I would buy this fountain filter again.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars looking forward to liking it
reviewText: I purchased the CUF-6000 unit even though my pond holds only 600 gallons. I admit that I have too many minnows and I'm using air stones and the CUF-6000 to keep the minnows healthy.I also admit that if there's a way to get confused, I can often find it.I've had the 6000 for about two weeks. During the first week I eagerly watched my green pond water for improvement. It did improve. The filter was doing a good job collecting algae.But the improvement stopped after the first week and things started getting worse again. I cleaned the filter assembly and started to see improvement again. But there shouldn't have been so many bits of algae in the water.I began to wonder if the UV lamp was working. Cleaning everything out again, I opened the UV canister. This was also when I noticed the window in the filter box that would let you see if the lamp was working. It wasn't.Note that the instructions tell you how to open the UV canister, but they don't tell you how to remove the bulb. The bulb in the 6000 pulls straight out. I wasn't sure until I removed the shield around the socket. That's also how I inspected the switch and wiring under the base.The bulb looked okay, and there weren't any loose wires, so I wondered what else could go wrong. Below the bulb's base was a switch that would only allow the bulb to go on if the UV canister was properly closed.I decided to put two layers of PVC tape over the switch's small metal arm to reduce the clearance it senses. Mind you I very carefully made certain that the tape didn't touch anything else. It seems to me that this switch and wiring is likely not supposed to get wet. So you don't want to get tape on the base above the switch.Also note that if you get carried away fussing with this switch, the lamp might light up even when the UV canister is NOT properly closed. This could be a health risk, unless you make certain that it is properly closed before plugging in the power cord. On the other hand, if you break the switch, the UV lamp will never light up.My UV lamp works now. I am happy. I wasn't looking forward to contacting the company for a replacement. Especially since a new bulb would not have fixed my problem.I hope that the UV lamp will kill any algae bits that flow past it. Eventually it should kill all the suspended algae.Overall, I'm looking forward to being very happy with the CUF-6000. The filter really collects algae in the water, but the algae will flow around the filter if you don't clean it periodically. Now that the UV lamp is working, I'm looking forward to seeing what benefits it and the bio-balls will produce.I'm not quite as happy with the user's manual. Usually you can figure out what the manual is trying to say, but it caused me to experience some uncertainty.Take item 4 on page 02."4. Before all parts are installed completely, the equipment can not be plugged in."This statement caused me to open the unit to verify that "all parts" were indeed installed. They were.I've already mentioned that page 10 could tell you how to remove the UV bulb.The "TROUBLESHOOTING" table on page 11 could note that the UV-C lamp won't work if the sensor switch can't tell if the UV canister is properly closed. This isn't actually a user serviceable part, but it can be helped if you understand how it works.I subtracted a star for the less than clear manual and for having to "repair" a new product. Perhaps I'll rate it 5 stars if it performs as expected.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2021
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great filter
reviewText: Update, after 6 months:Possible replacement filter? This looks like it would fit:AQUANEAT Replacement Filter Pad Compatible with SUNSUN CUF-6011 All in One Pond Filter Sponge MediaThis still works great. We use it all the time, and have cleaned it 4 or 5 times (early on had to be more often), by hosing out the spongy filter and the rocks and plastic beads, and all of the black casing. This seems like a really good filter.As far as I can tell our UV light has never worked. I'm considering buying another bulb to see if that would help, but even without the UV light it works well. We have 5 small fish and several happy plants and volunteer aquatic snails in about a 100 gallon pond (probably 80-120 gallons depending on evaporation). We do get algae, but it only got out of control once.I highly recommend using water testing kits like the ones from Pond Master, to track ammonia, nitrates, phosphate, etc. to help figure out what's causing your issues. A filter alone won't solve all of your issues.Original review:We put this into our small pond just 4 days ago and it's already made such a difference. My kiddo had been overfeeding the fish in our natural (no filter, just plants and fish + a pump) pond, but now we can see the bottom again! We may not use it all the time...or maybe we will. It's nice that it's all in one unit - filtration and aerating the water. At first it seemed huge (relative to the size of our pond), but it's well worth it. Nice that it has multiple fountain heads to change how the water flows out.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great, even in a small pond!
reviewText: When I first received this filter, I was put off by the size of it. I have a very small pond (40 gallons, 10 inches deep). When I set it up using the regular nozzle, it started spraying all the water out of the pond! But then I switched to the "mushroom head" nozzle, and it works great! It keeps the water super clean, and my fish are very happy! I've had it for two months, and so far it is working flawlessly. I've only cleaned it once so far, and that was just spraying it with the hose to clean the crud off of the outside filter pad. I was also pleasantly surprised at how long the cord is.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing
reviewText: Have had a 100 gal outdoor water feature for a year. Despite cleaning the pump filters and replacing all of the water periodically within days the brown algae would make the water absolutely brown. I tried all sorts of chemicals for algae with no results. Could not see any of the rocks, fish, etc. just disgusting brown water.A friend told me I needed a UV light system. Did a lot of research and with some degree of skepticism I bought this pump about 3 months ago. The water was crystal clean within 4 days and has stayed that way ever since. I have used no chemicals since. This device is amazing.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars On or Off, no in between!
reviewText: All solar products I've ever experienced have 1. Diminished productivity with lower light levels; 2. Advised "full sun" by the manufacturer.These fountains work fine when the solar panel is completely sun-exposed. But there is no useful in-between. Even a 10% or less shading allows the pump to cease operating. The sellers ad did not disclose this very well. I was under the distinct impression it would work just like any other. The pools in working with have shifting partial shade through the day. These pumps will spurt water only during brief periods of total sun, no shadows.

I am going to getmore for my other birdbaths to help keep mosquitos from using them and they add so much.Also have multiple heads for different water patterns which is nice too.Would definitely recommend this brand...it seems more substantial and that is will last longer withthe glass panel.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Was great but fading fast, but wait seller to rescue
reviewText: The Latest Update- when my pump began to slow down I contacted the seller for advice on how to revive its performance. The seller immediately offered a replacement which arrived in two days. The pump when working is terrific and now excellent customer service. Nice to deal with a reputable company. I am sure we will be enjoying this wonderful fountain for hopefully long time to come.Update-We have had this set up for about 10 weeks. For the first couple of months it worked great as described in the original review below. Despite having a stretch of dry sunny weather the pump has now slowed considerably. It shoots water off and on, reaching maybe 3 inches. I clean the filter and housing almost every day but even with strong sun it is fading. Very disappointing because we loved watching this especially with lights at night- usually until midnight. Now it barely makes it to 9pm. Tried to contact seller to no avail. It should have lasted longer.Original-We purchased this to place in a bird bath in our garden. This was the first time buying something like this so didn't know what to expect. As soon as we placed this in the bird bath it immediately starting working, I guess it came with the battery partially charged. The water shoots up about 10-12 inches and it comes with a variety of attachments to vary the spray pattern. On a bright sunny day it works very well but on a cloudy day the spray is weaker. Following our first sunny day I was delighted to find that the fountain continued to spray water until midnight before exhausting the battery. And the best part was that after dark it puts on a beautiful light show with changing colors. I thought it might look a bit over the top but honestly it really looks great. I hope our little pump keeps up as the birds have now discovered the bird bath and we get regular visitors.. I am also hoping for more sunny days so the show can continue.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Birds Love This Fountain
reviewText: I purchased this for my bird bath as a replacement for my last one. Right out of the box I could see that the glass covered top was superior to many other fountains that have a top that eventually peels off over time. I have typically stuck with the black fountains, but with such a hot summer, I felt the white helped keep it cooler. Very easy to assemble with sturdy straw-like pieces to help keep it centered. Needs direct sunlight for power. Extra filters to keep it running smoothly. Some of the fountains caused water to spray over the side, so it was great to have options, and I was able to find one that worked perfectly. Birds love to visit it, especially on hot days. I do tend to bring my fountain in for the winter and store in a dark place. It helps extend the life of the fountain. Perfect for bird baths or small pond. I definitely recommend!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My birds love it!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Much smaller than expected, but it works!
reviewText: I laughed out loud when it arrived because it was so much smaller than I had expected, but it actually works great!My test panel is 100 watts (more powerful than this pump is rated for), so I shaded much of the panel for the first attempt. Worked fine. Then I allowed more light on it and the stream of water was quite powerful! I let it run like that for at least 20 minutes while I ran to get my wife and kids to watch what this funny little pump could do! It’s my opinion that this thing could probably run all day on a 100w panel and not have a problem, but I’ll still buy a smaller panel for it as to not overload it (or just hook up several of them to match the max 100w output). I do enjoy that it’s variable based on the wattage…makes for some interesting possibilities.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2019
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly Strong
reviewText: I'm using this in a home-built swamp cooler i made so i could cool my rig on solar. It pumps a more than sufficient amount of water through the whole system. That's about 2 feet up a 1/2" rubber tube and then another 10' or so of 1/2" PVC and all the water need to come out the jets onto cooling pad uniformly. Just eyeballing things it appears to put as much water out on to the pads as it pushes without anything on it at all so it sure ain't weak.I'd suggest some pretty good filter mesh in such applications though because the impeller looks fragile and i don't know how resistant it would be to clogging. I just wrapped some of the blue cooling pad stuff around the base with a zip tie.Anyhow i just wanted to give folks an idea of performance. I didn't know from looking at the flow rate if it would suffice or not so if you can picture a swamp cooler capable of cooling a 30' RV then you have a good picture. Good value for the money.

reviewText: Great filter and we got an added bonus . . . a whole new filter device! I thought when I ordered it that it was only the replacement filter we were going to receive. When the item came, I was pleasantly surprised to see that it was the filter plus the hose attachment plus the filter-housing! It's awesome to have a second one on hand so you can easily switch them out and then clean the old one for the next time you change the pond. These work great for our 200-gallon outdoor pond. I highly recommend it.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2015
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good filter for small ponds w/slight modification
reviewText: Bought this to go with a Tetra Pond Pump 325. It comes with a washable filter element (that I haven't had to clean yet). Not sure if I'll keep that filter or end up using one I can make (and dispose of) out of marine filter material. The filter attaches to the pump via included tubing, approx. 12" long and although it is 'flexible' you cannot re-shape it to stay put. My 50 gallon round pond does not have room in the bottom for the pump, tubing and filter to fit in a straight line so I used a couple long black zip-ties to secure the filter to the side of the pump (bending the tubing into a U-shape). It all now fits nicely at the bottom of the pond.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2012
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This Filter Realy Works
reviewText: What a bargain! We have a filter system that cost $50+ plus barley, etc.... And they where not doing the job on ~400 gallon pond.I had read a review about this filter that indicated that the persons pond cleaned up in just a few days. Needles to say that after my experience so far, I was somewhat skeptical.It was priced so low, so could it work? Since it was priced so low, why not give it a shot? But by jove, IT REALLY DOES WORKED. We can ounce again see our fish. The only problem is that the local Blue Heron can also see our fish.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2013
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Prefilter
reviewText: This was exactly what I was looking for. It attached perfectly to the 550 GPH and 100 GPH TetraPond pumps with the adapters it came with. I read previous reviews and was expecting to have to buy adapters from a hardware store to rig it to fit the pump I bought with it. Not sure what those reviews were about, it had the adapters to fit the pump perfectly. I used to have to clean off the pump itself. Now I only have to clean leaves off of this prefilter, or when the flow decreases, I take out the sponge filter and clean with a hose. It not only protects the longevity of the pump, it clears the water in the pond. Great product.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2021
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Needs a larger sized connector hose
reviewText: We have tried both this filter and the box filter and both work pretty well with some drawbacks. The biggest complaint is that although we use the largest 1900 gph pump, the largest corrugated pipe and that is connected to solid pvc piping, the connector from the filer to the pump is only 1” diameter. This cuts down on the flow of the pump drastically and thus makes for a smaller waterfall. The cylinder prefilter needs to be cleaned frequently! We don’t have fish to make the pond dirty, but get a lot of pine needles and pond worms in it. The box filter can go quite a long time without maintenance, but it is hard to make it stay on the bottom of the pond. I fill the box with 5 small rocks, but sometimes it will still rise to the top and cut off water intake to the pump. It is also difficult to screw it onto the pump with the rocks inside. If I cannot find a way to attach larger tubing to each of these devices, I am going to try putting the slotted cover back on the pump and place the whole pump in a mesh bag.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent product
reviewText: This fit my pump exactly like it needed to super easy installation my first one lasted me a year just now ordering my second one will definitely buy more.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars These are awesome!
reviewText: I use these as my pumps pre filter in my Tropical fish fry rearing station!It’s a 50 gal tub that recirculates water through a pvc pipe that’s about two and a half feet above the tub that has water lines that I can use individually for each container filled with baby fish! It allows constant, clean circulation in all containers without clogging! An integral part of my fry rearing setup! 40 years in Tropical fish experience. I never recommend anything I wouldn’t use!

reviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on January 2, 2022
reviewTitle: Good value. Perfect for my purposes.
reviewText: I bought this product to help filter out large particulates when circulating water through my tank which I use to grow water lilies in the summer. The slits on this cylindrical filter provide a large opening to draw high volumes of water if required. The walls are about 2mm thick so they aren't as rigid as I would have liked. They bend easily when held in my hand so I have to be careful. This is why I only gave it 4 stars out of 5. Otherwise I like this design as it is perfectly suited for my setup. For my situation, this filter will placed vertically in a 70 gallon stock tank so this will reduce the possibility of the filter slits breaking if laid on its side. I had to acquire some 3/4" (inner diameter) pvc fittings to get it to stand vertically in the tank. I connected the inlet (barbed end) to a T fitting using 1" inner diameter hose which will then connect to a bulkhead fitting attached to the opening on the side of my tank. The water will be drawn by a submersible water pump placed inside the waterfall box hanging on the edge of the tank. Waiting for spring to test my setup. The filter insert is coarse, but sufficient to prevent large objects from getting sucked up into the water pump. Accessing the insert for cleaning can be done simply by pulling the top off or unscrewing the entire cylinder. The product also comes with various diameter hoses (short length) to allow you to connect to different sized fittings. I didn't take pictures of those.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than I expected! Birds love it.
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. It's perfect for the water bowls I got to add between my two feeders. The birds took to it quickly (including the normally timid band tailed pigeons and mourning doves). So far the motor is strong enough to handle seeds that fall into the bowl and lodged into the filter. I just give it a light shake under water (under the sun so the motor is going) and it shoots the seeds right back out, making it easy to clean as long as I do it daily. The little adjustable extensions that keep it from moving/spinning help tremendously for the smaller birds like the chickadees and finches. No real assembly required which is always a plus, and it comes with these cute little spouts if you want a certain type of flow. Only thing is that it pretty much stops as soon as it's out of direct sunlight, but I dont mind because my yard gets consistent lighting. All in all, very happy with this purchase. Might get another one for my front yard bowl depending on the longevity of this one.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2014
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Used for homebrew AC unit; bothersome for this specific application
reviewText: I attached my pump to some copper tubing and a heat spreader, strapped the whole thing to a fan, and ran a line through my minifridge to make a fake AC unit (since the building has a ban on AC during the summer, too much power consumption or some other rubbish excuse). I am underwhelmed by 185 GPH, but that's all on me. The pump works great, and has continuously for over a month, stressed nearly to its limits by the length of my piping assembly. The biggest annoyance to me was the input filter. The plastic piece that holds the filter in place likes to pop off the pump and float to the surface at the drop of a hat, so I ended up zip tying it on. Good pump, probably works great when it's being used for fish or hydroponics, but the filter's a little iffy.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2016
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for Chilling Wort with an Immersion Chiller
reviewText: This has been a great addition to my homebrewing equipment. I connect to my HomeBrewStuff 25' Copper Immersion Wort Chiller - Deluxe Package with 2x 12' Hoses, Fittings, and Faucet Adapter, submerge the pump in a cooler full of ice water, and have the chiller water return dump back into the cooler at the opposite end. Invaluable in the Georgia heat when trying to cool wort to 80F or less.The pump itself seems to be quite durable as it has had several knocks and drops by yours truly and it just keeps on chugging along, never missing a beat. It even comes with several different outlet fitting sizes and shapes to fit various needs. Even though the fittings are all plastic, they have held up very well to the aforementioned drops and ice water.If I ever have to order another pump, I may step up to the next size for a little more flow, but with the way this one has performed, I'm not sure I'll need to buy another anytime soon.Could it be better? Of course, but what can't you improve on? Even as close to perfect as I am (sarcasm), my wife would surely make an improvement or two... It could have an on/off switch so I can control operation at the pump instead of having to plug/unplug from the wall/extension cord. And you know, I think that might be the only improvement I would make.Nothing but praise for this thing, especially at the price point.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2014
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Whisper Quiet, Economical, Reliable
reviewText: Posted Spring 2014I bought this pump a few weeks ago. Bought an 80 year old house that has 2 ponds (one about 1200 gallons, the other 1900 gallons). This pump I bought to drain each pond so I could muck it. It drained the 1900 gallon pond in a little over 2 days (meaning it was only pumping about 40 GPH). Had to buy a different attachment to hook it up to my garden hose, but it did the job just fine. This summer, I will use the pump to water my vegetable garden directly out of the pond.BEAR IN MIND: Max Gallons Per Hour listed depend on many many variables (vertical feet it has to climb, number of bends, diameter of tubing, etc).Side note, if you have decent to large sized ponds AND you garden, drain your pond, muck it, and put the muck in your garden, it is AMAZING natural fertilizer.Update May 2015 - This product is still going strong and has done a great job for me in the following capacities:1) Moving water from one of my ponds to the other.2) Adding air quality to my ponds for my fish3) Watering my gardens out of my ponds.4) Draining my ponds.Great product!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2016
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Thumbs up for this pump!
reviewText: EcoPlus 185 Submersible Pump, 158 GPH My husband has a greenhouse and spends a great deal of time on his flowers. They get a special diet of fertilizers and supplements, and most of those are mixed into their water, which has to circulate to stay oxygenated and fresh, and to distribute their supplements evenly. It's a 20-gallon container. He uses a submersible pump to keep the water moving, and his last one was about twice as expensive as this one, so he was thrilled to find a bargain here on Amazon! It arrived quickly, and worked perfectly right out of the box. It's got little rubber sucker feet to attach it into the water tank, and works fairly quietly. If you need a submersible pump, this is a great one to get!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2021
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars HORRIBLE customer support and it does NOT have a ceramic shaft or bearings.
reviewText: The listing for this pump and the distributor ligature FALSELY claim that these pumps have a ceramic shaft: They don't. They are stainless and subject to corrosion. Adding insult to injury, though the distributor list replacement parts for these pumps, they don't actually make any replacement parts available and the customer support is a joke. Replacement shafts and impellers are not available for these pumps, and you will need them. There is no glass fiber reinforcement in the impellers. They are just plain nylon. So they don't last long before they crack and separate from the rotor magnet. Similar pumps are available from SunSun and Atman, and there is no problem getting replacement parts for those units, and they are actually available with real ceramic shafts.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Shower power
reviewText: This is for the 1.5 GPM model. I am using this for a makeshift shower while our plumbing gets fixed. Also evaluating for camp / portable / zombie outbreak shower.I am using a ~ 15 gal tank, 3/8 silicone hoses for input and output. I connected it to a standard shower head, the same kind I use for normal showers. Result: basically a Normal shower, with the same flow and pressure as my everyday house shower. The 15 gal tank gives 10 minutes of shower time, which means it is flowing 1.5 GPM just like it is rated.Power comes from a small power station about 210 Wh capacity. The motor draws about 40 watts while showering. Doing the math, I could get over 30 showers per charge.Noise is not excessive; there is a buzzing or vibrating type noise due to the pump type, measured at 61 dB at 6 feet. That's in an echo-y bathroom too.The pump self-primes, and is able to pull water easily through a filter installed on the input side. No issues when the tank runs dry, it just gets a bit more noisy. The motor itself only gets slightly warm when using for this type of application, never gets hot and never feels like it is overheated even when inside an enclosure. I had no leaks anywhere, including at the hose barbs.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2019
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An Almost Exact Replacement of the Original PetMate Deluxe Fresh Flow Pump - And It Works!
reviewText: I purchased this product to replace a previous version of the pump that was shipped with a PetMate Deluxe Fresh Flow water fountain/dish. The main difference between these two pumps was that the original had a dial knob that was used to control the water flow (see attached picture). This new one uses a slider inside the front "filter", and must be adjusted with the unit outside of the fountain/dish; this is not a problem once the right flow is determined. But I did prefer the ease of use of the original flow control. Note: The old front flow controller/filter could be used with the new unit, but it is not as snug as I would like.The only negative I can really state is that the rubber suction cups REALLY work well on the plastic of the fountain. Unfortunately, the downside is that when I have to remove the pump from the fountain to clean it (and I have to do that at least once a week, as my cats tend to drop food into this dish), the suction cups stay behind, pulling out of the pump. I never had that problem with the old pump. I have found that this is not too bad, as with the help of a jeweler's flathead screwdriver, I can pop them back into the bottom of the pump without much effort.I have read other reviews stating that this pump is very noisy; I have always found this pump to run silently except when:a) The pump is just turned on after cleaning and it still has air in it; I have found that after 15 seconds or so, the air is passed and the pump runs silently as expected.b) The front filter becomes clogged and cannot pass enough water; then the unit does get noisy.When normally running, neither I nor my cats are disturbed by any noises from this pump. I am definitely happy with the silent running of this unit.One other small "gotcha" with this new unit vs the old was the on/off switch on the cord the old pump had. This is a minor difference, as I rarely used it anyway, as I would just disconnect the cord from the adapter when cleaning the fountain anyway; an extra switch is just that, extra.Overall, I am satisfied with this replacement unit (which by the way, had EXACTLY the same model number as the old unit). It does the job, and it does it silently. And it fits my PetMate Deluxe Fresh Flow water fountain/dish perfectly, once I replaced the 1/2" nozzle with the 1/4" (smaller) one. My cats love using the fountain, and will no longer use a bowl unless the fountain is not available (i.e., in the dishwasher).
