reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2014
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars a bit different than earlier model/ works for Petmate fountain
reviewText: This replacement pump for my Petmate Deluxe Fresh Flow drinking fountain, although the same model #, is slightly different but it works well. The white flow control lever on the old pump (which stuck through the hole in the fountain between the pump compartment & the water "bowl") has been replaced by a tiny sliding control nub on the face of the pump, only accessible before the fountain is assembled for operation (I would suggest setting it in the low flow position for the first time since it seems more powerful than the replaced pump). The ac/dc adapter power cord is about 14" long (note: 2 prior pumps I owned broke where the hard, very thin plastic power cord meets the cord "collar" on both ends... I suggest reinforcing this flex point w/electrical tape). The cord from the pump to its female end (where it plugs into the adaptor cord male end) is at least 4' long (I didn't stretch it out to measure) but is missing the dial power on/off switch of the last pump (although if you need it this is very easy to re-install onto the new cord if you are at all handy). If like me you are using this for the pet fountain, 2 things: make sure to keep the cord "clamp" from the old cord (the black piece that holds the cord in place where it exits the fountain's rear); and twist out the plastic 1/2" (outside diameter) "pipe/ nozzle" sticking out the top of the pump & replace it w/the smaller 1/4" nozzle (packed loose in the pump box w/no instructions w/it so you at first wonder what it's for) which fits into the water flow tube of the assembled water fountain.This is a cheaper option than buying a new Petmate fountain. After a few hours of use so far, seems more powerful & quieter than previous pump.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2014
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Has lasted over 5 years!
reviewText: Update December 2019:Well, after a few of days of use, the pump motor built up some slime, which made it much quieter.So, I never did return it.I must say, it has worked out pretty well, and it has been running not stop for 5 years.I thought it died the other day, but found that there was some fun that built up in the hole where the magnet on the impeller shaft sides in. I was able to use Q-tips to clean it out, and it is good as after break-in new!So, I would recommend this pump, if it still made the same.From 2014:I am planning to return this pump. I bought it because of the good reviews, and the short lifespan of the original Pet Mate pump in my cat's water bowl. He likes to drink at the top of the slide where the water comes out, and without a working pump, that is not possible. The original Pet Mate pump was nearly silent, but did not pump a lot of water. It was enough to circulate it though. Last week, the wire developed a break near the pump motor from being forced into a 90 degree bend by the design of the bowl. They should make the wire come out the top of the pump!! Anyway, I tried putting the Pet Mate impeller blade into this pump, which made it go from a loud rattle that scared the cat away completely to a lower grinding noise that he finally approached and did drink from. But, I cannot tolerate this noise near my desk all day! I will have to go to Target and get a whole new bowl and pump for about the same price as just the pump, once I am near civilization again.

reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worked better than expected

reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I read the reviews about the fountain going too high but decided to try this one anyway because I liked the idea of a better battery for cloudy days. I did not get the one with the lights. This fountain is working great for me. I did have to try different fountain nozzles before I got the right match. The ones that went higher were prettier but as the reviews said, I lost too much water. Nozzle B3 seems to work the best. I have an insert for my old concrete bird bath that is 16” in diameter and a little over 2.5” deep. If your birdbath is smaller, it might not work so well for you. I did have to cut down the little straws a little to get the fountain to stay in the middle but all is working great! This was filled at about 10pm last night and it is about 2 pm on a sunny day and the water levels are looking good. I would recommend this solar fountain.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Small, quiet and efficient.
reviewText: Got this to replace an old, basically bullet proof fountain pump that's been great, but it's oil filled and uses way more power. This is pumping to a fountain that's about 15' away horizontally and about 4.5' tall.The old oil filled pump was great and lasted over 10 years of running basically dawn to after dusk each day. But it's a bit loud, expensive and uses a lot of power. Also when they fail, they tend to leak oil all over the place.This pump is a bit smaller, a bit quieter, and most important to me, a lot more efficient. While not a huge pump, the old pump would use enough power that every 30-45 days, it used enough power to power the rest of my entire home for 1 normal day. So basically every year, it used enough to power my home for a week or so.Well this new pump is uses basically half the power of the old one and is actually more powerful.So a big win so far. Why 4 stars and not 5? I haven't owned it long enough to see if it'll hold up. The last one made it 10 years. While I don't expect that out of any of them, I'm hoping for at least several years. Also there's the question of if it'll need maintenance. The old pump never needed anything. These magnetic pumps can sometimes need to be taken apart to clean the impeller. They also sometimes have trouble starting up after being turned off once they get gunked up over time. So time will tell how hands off it is and how long it holds up.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2019
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I already have one-this is a backup
reviewText: The pondmaster pumps are great. I keep my out door pond pump running year round. I have a small pond (only about 80 gallons) (with 4 levels) to which I add a small Laguna Power Heat heater in the winter months to keep it from freezing. I'll admit its challenging when we have a heavy snow in Northern NJ. Ice can form on the brim of the pond and cause a path for water to be drained from the pond by the pumping action. I change out/clean the foam filter about once per week. Originally I had two 250 GPH pumps for several years but recently switched to the 350 GPH. Once or twice per year I swap out the pump in order to clean the impeller. Its an easy process. The pumps are really well built. If you use them in doors in a fish tank you could run it for years without maintenance other than filter cleaning.changes

reviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on September 6, 2024
reviewTitle: Really solid submersible pump with available parts
reviewText: So many of these submersible type pumps are sadly throw-away because you can't buy new impellers. We use ours to circulate CNC machine coolant, and we leave it running 24/7. After about a year, the impeller shaft wears down in its rubber bearings (probably because the coolant contains a certain amount of hard steel fines). When the wear is too much, the impeller body rubs the magnetic drive housing it runs in and eventually stops. All that's needed is a new impeller and the rubber bushings, a pretty cheap kit vs a whole new pump. And Danner sells those here on Amazon.

reviewText: Works very well for filling my aqjuariums. I also use it for recycliing the water when filtering and cleaning the gravel in the aquariums. You do need to prime these pumps as they are not self priming. They must also be run in water to keep them cool. A 5 gallon bucket does that for me.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice little pump for a small pond
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Okay, I've had this pump in my pond for about a year (though I take it out in the winter months). It's done pretty good for the money. It doesn't really have a filter on it, however, so I had immediate problems with clogging. This can be solved with a filter bag you can purchase on amazon for about $10. You pop the pump into the filter bag and use the string to cinch it up around the pipe and it works fine, though the bag will probably need to be cleaned about once a week depending how dirty the pond is and how much you run the pump. I have multiple bags so I can sit down and clean them all at once in a 1/2 hour session a few times during the summer.The pump comes with a couple of heads. I used the mushroom one for a while, but recently just removed it and let the water just gurgle out the top. This actually makes the lights useful in the evening. With the mushroom head the water was never illuminated, but when you just let it gurgle out the pipe, the water is lit up by the lights.The pump comes with suction cups on the bottom to hold it up, but this really isn't very useful in a pond situation, so I removed them and then used silicon glue to attach the pump to one of those saucers that sits below a ceramic pot. The saucer is heavy and wide, and keeps the pump from tipping over in the wind. The saucer and pump still sit within the filter bag without a problem.UPDATE - It's 2022 and this is the fourth year this pump has been running without a problem. I usually have it in the pond from May till November running 8 hours a day, which is enough to keep the pond clean.

Can't figure out how to open to clean.This could be a serious issue in winter (which has not yet ended).It also aspirates quite a bit of air in my birdbath, causing erratic operation and gulping sounds.On the 2nd one I bought I got an extension tube and the mushroom spray nozzle assembled, but the parts really felt much too tight or much too loose. When adjusting tighter, the extension tube telescopes causing most of the water to spray out of the birdbath. When adjusting looser, the water all trickles down the sides of the nozzle with no spray. Self loosens during operation, no stable setting of the nozzle.Lowered my rating from 3 star to 2 star.Lowered my rating from 2 star to 1 star, when 2nd pump also clogged less than a week after setup and couldn't figure out how to open and clean either of them.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2022
reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Lots of rust
reviewText: Unfortunately this one is going in the trash since I can’t use it for my application - a pool circulation pump. Might be good for someone but beware it doesn’t seem to have rust resistance coating in the impeller.+ PLUSSES +* It pumps well - pushes a lot of water- MINUSES* Rust - But why would you design a WATER PUMP that isn’t protected against rust?? I tried using it as a pump for a pool but it just spews out brown rust water every time you turn it on.* noise - it’s quite loud. Not crazy loud but louder than I expected. Not sure how loud a pump like this should be but it has a high pitch whine.~ Neutral ~* Finish/craftsmanship. I didn’t put this as a minus since most people don’t really care what their pump looks like. I was surprised at how cheap this think looked. This makes Harbor Freight look like a luxury brand. The paint looks like it was a rattle can job - can scratch it off with fingernail. Hard to describe but metal parts are super thin, parts should have been cleaned up after molding/casting, etc. Just little attention to detail.* Wiring - you need to be able to wire this yourself, which may be difficult for some but clearly states in the description.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2021
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Loud and Slow, but Steady and Sturdy
reviewText: I was using this for my fresh water tank in my off-grid cabin. It did a fair job of pumping water to the kitchen sink. The pressure switch worked great, and only turned the pump on when the faucet was open. However, it was pretty loud and the water flow was weak. I'm sure it was as advertised, but just not strong enough to get a spray at the sink. I ended up replacing it with a larger pump.But I still use this one. I use it now to pump water into the fresh water tank. I get clean filtered water from a nearby ice vending machine in 5 gallon jugs. Then I pump it up into the 26 gallon fresh water tank with this pump. It works great. The noise and speed are not a factor for this purpose. It pumps the water straight up about 8 feet with out any issues. It is a good pump.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Replacement pump for HF Greenwood atv sprayer.
reviewText: Purchased as a replacement for a harbor freight greenwood atv sprayer. Looks and fits like original except the inflow and out flow are reversed. Not a big deal for me as my suction hose was rotting after 2 seasons. Replaced the hose with a longer piece to reach the other port and was good to go. Performance was a little better than the original. Ran 4 tanks or 60 gallons through it the first use. Price was worth it compared to buying a new sprayer(20% of a new sprayer), we'll see how it holds up. For comparison, the original lasted 2 seasons for a total of maybe 15 tanks. Hoping to get at least another season from the sprayer.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2020
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Failed out of the box! [SEE UPDATE]
reviewText: Installed in combo with a brand new AquaSurge 4000 pump in minutes, no tools except Teflon Pipe Thread tape as advised. Initial trial run was great! No leaks at joint, Aquascape Signature Series Skimmer or 2" tubing.HOWEVER, when pump was off to check plumbing and Biofalls for leaks the Biofalls water level dropped 75% over a 8 hour period. Usually indicating the check valve was not preventing backflow. But I assumed we had a leak outside the main pond since the Aquascape Dual Union valve was brand spanking new. So I dug out behind the Biofalls so to inspect the bulkhead and connections. My 2' hole was dry and so were the connections. So I figured the worst, a crack some where along 75' of buried 2" tubing.Instead of inspecting the tubing we continued to clean out the 5,000 gal Koi pond for maintenance. After sump pumping the pond my wife noticed water still trickling heavily from the skimmer. The Aquascape Skimmer is brand new, so this means the new Aquascape Dual Union Check Valve had to be defective. I will return and exchange for a replacement. I will follow this review after installing the replacement next week.6/9/20 UPDATE:The replacement arrived the next day after my return request was placed!!!Before installing I did a very basic leak test. I blew into the discharge side - No pressure loss. Upon removing the defective valve I repeated this same test method - definite pressure loss.After installing the replacement I turn the AquaSurge 4000 pump on to fill the Biofalls, then shut pump off. This time there was no water level drop in Biofalls, meaning no back flow in to the pond. EXCELLENT!SUMMARY:IMO this model is very pricey, HOWEVER, it makes for the perfect fit when using brand new Aquascape AquaSurge pump and brand new Aquascape Skimmer. No guess work, fittings and connectors match perfectly for a complete new Aquascape upgrade.IF you are perhaps using different brand pumps and/or skimmers it may be best to use a more simpler Check Valve assembly to give you more adaptability for your particular installation.If this unit fails I will again update my review accordingly.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2023
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars IMO - 100% Avoid Aquascape products
reviewText: My experience with Aquascape products and the company has been nothing short of a nightmare. I cannot emphasize enough how strongly I advise everyone to stay far, far away from this brand. From the low-value products to their abysmal customer service, dealing with Aquascape has been a colossal waste of time and money.Adding insult to injury, their customer service is nothing short of a joke. When I attempted to contact them about the products I received, I was met with an infuriating run-around. It seemed like nobody knew what was happening, and they couldn't provide any reasonable solutions to rectify the situation. Their lack of accountability and disregard for customer satisfaction was utterly shocking.In an industry where customer satisfaction should be a top priority, Aquascape appears to be more interested in making a quick buck than in providing quality products and services. My unfortunate experience with this company has left me with a sour taste in my mouth and a firm resolution never to support them again.I highly recommend looking elsewhere for aquatic products and services. There are plenty of other reputable companies out there that genuinely care about their customers and deliver top-notch products. Save yourself the frustration and disappointment by steering clear of Aquascape.I wholeheartedly suggest a 100% avoidance of Aquascape products and the company itself. Don't waste your money on their low-value products, and definitely don't bother hoping for any semblance of helpful customer service. Choose wisely and invest your money in a brand that values its customers and delivers on its promises.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars First One Lasted 6 Years
reviewText: The PAL 2100 pump has plenty of power to lift water about 4 feet and fill a weir to feed a 18 inch wide waterfall while keeping operating costs reasonable. This is my second Alpine Pump. The first pump lasted 6 years of operating continuously for about 6 months out of the year. I purchased a second one and was surprised to see a 5 year warranty on the website while the manual and box state the pump has a 3 year warranty. I contacted Alpine and they recently changed their policy for the PAL series to now have a 5 year warranty. This review was left in June of 2024.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Troubleshooting easy peasy
reviewText: I purchase this pump in 9/22 and today the pump stopped working. While looking for information to submit a claim within the warranty, I read calcium build up around the impeller may be the culprit. I followed the easy manual instructions and used white vinegar to soak it along with its housing. And it’s back on like new! Hoping it lasts me another 3 years. And, purchased a back up today. Will schedule to clean it again or check it for calcium build up in 6 months. Happy I chose this brand.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2023
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Pump impeller blew apart within the first few months of the season.
reviewText: Bought to replace a 10 year old pump that was still working, but the cord was splitting.From the start, it felt on the cheap side. Despite both pumps being 2100gph, the old pump was clearly pumping more water. Not the worst problem, but a noticeable one, to say the least.I could look past the slight lack of power in comparison, but in addition to that, the front plastic filter piece that covers the impeller was only loosely held onto the pump and would fall off if the hose was bumped hard enough.That was a solveable enough issue, but it wasn't the worst issue.Within the first few months I had noticed the water wasn't flowing like normal, so I unplugged the pump thinking debris had been blocking the filter, but it was clear. So I checked the impeller to make sure there was nothing in it and it was also clear. So I checked the filter and it was also clear. Cable checked out fine, so I put it back in the pond and plugged it in. It must have been on the cusp of failure, because as soon as I plugged it back in, it made an audible sound through the water. So I yanked it back out and noticed the impeller was just completely broken

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Pump and Amazing Customer Service - Alpine PAL2100 Cyclone Pump Customer.
reviewText: I am a previous owner of this pump and recently purchased another one in April of 2020. The pump is reliable, runs quiet, moves a large volume of water, and, most of all, is energy-efficient. I recently had an issue with the pump impeller shaft and considered purchasing the same replacement pump until my brother reminded me of the pump's internal part warranty. Usually, I am skeptical about contacting customer service regarding warranty issues. But I decided what do I have to lose. So I contacted the Alpine customer service department via email along with a few photos regarding my pump issues and my proof of purchase. To my surprise, I received a response within approximately 4 hours from when I sent out the email. The response was from a customer service representative name Judy D. She was extremely helpful and genuinely wanted to assist me with my pump issues. To make a long story short, my pump issues had been resolved in a timely fashion, and the process itself was a breeze. They definitely stand by their products with a satisfaction guarantee during the warranty period. I am an Alpine customer for life. What a great company, as well as amazing customer service! Thanks to employees like Judy D.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2013
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice pump, quiet and powerful! Pre-filter works for a small pond or water feature but doesn't really stay on.
reviewText: Works well and quietly, powerful enough for a nice water feature a few feet high. I chose this one because I really needed the pre-filter since I have plants in my mini pond, which is set up in a plastic lined wine barrel. The previous filter had to be cleaned every couple days when it got clogged with leaves and mud. This lasts a couple weeks before needing to be cleaned, but unfortunately there is no actual way to secure the sponge pre-filter onto the intake tube. You have to choose between the protective cage which would still let plenty of debris in, and the sponge attachment which really easily slips off while you're placing it into the water. I would have given the pump itself 5 stars and the sponge filter 3 stars, because it would work but it falls off so frustratingly! And of course once it falls off under water it sucks up some water hyacinth roots and I have to re-clean the whole thing. I find that if I shove the pre-filter on while the output valve is on low, and then turn it back to high, it sort of pinches the sponge and helps hold it on better than nothing, but I feel like there should be some threading on the pieces to keep them secure.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Follow the instructions and observe the limitations.
reviewText: I use the pump to move ~140F degree (~60C) weater in a pressurized system that varies from 10 psi to 75 psi. The pump operates flawlessly. I have it mounted in a vertical orientation (inlet on top, outlet pointing down) which works well. The pump does not like air bubbles and will cavitate (no work is done, e.g. no flow) if there is any air in the system. The pump uses a very low amount of current so I can run it off my solar batteries when the grid is down (happens frequently during the winter). The pump is used to heat my hot tub using a heat exchanger. It works perfect. The life span for me is about 5 years of running a few hours a day. I just had to replace it due to a leak that shorted the control board in the pump housing. The pump gave excellent service for those 5 years.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just what I was looking for
reviewText: I wanted a solar small fountain for my deck birdbath. This one fit the bill. It worked as stated and there were many different sprays to choose from. it worked right out of the box and when the water was low the pump stopped so as not to burn it out. It worked best when in direct sunlight but even on cloudy days it got enough to work a little bit. The nice thing was soon as the morning sun hit it it was up and running just to the amount I wanted so as not to throw out very much water. I would probably buy the one with the larger battery if you want it to go longer in the evening or have the LED lights on it. I would buy it again.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very Impressive!!! Best I could find.
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. UPDATE: After more days of use, I’ve found that the pump requires more sun than it needed the first day. It pulses with intermittent ejection while not enough solar energy. The first day, it worked well with total overcast and even while snowing after batters run down.Original post: Works with total overcast and snowing after battery totally depleted overnight!!!! I am so surprised at how little amount of solar is required to make this pump work. The unit stopped working in the dark last night after the battery ran out, but the pump is working well with overcast skies and snowing. (See video.) I am using a nozzle that sprays horizontally to avoid any wind blowing a higher fountain of water over the side of the dish. I don’t know how strong a more vertical nozzle would spray with this amount of energy, but this pumps ability to pump this strongly with this weather is incredible. The temperature is 37F now, but I will have to move the pump indoors to protect it when temps approach freezing later today.The plastic tubes on the side do a good job keeping the fountain in the middle of the water bowl. However, the clip attachment is rather weak and can be easily knocked off of the pump base if mishandled. I would be inclined to epoxy the clips to the base if the pump were in a larger dish or a pond where the pump would be bumping on and off its surroundings.I like that the pump has an auto-shutoff if the water source is interrupted by depletion ir filter clogging. By the way, the filter is porous enough that fine debris will nit obstruct it unnecessarily. Extra filters are included and filters are cleanable.I would definitely recommend this battery backed up pump with its centering side tubes over the one sold with the pictured bird bath.The instructions are not the most detailed and are not written in the best English. There is no mention in the instruction booklet of how to best eliminate the air when placing the pump in the water. On the Amazon site, it is mentioned to submerge the pump and rapidly evacuate the air. No further detail is provided. I tilted the pump back and forth and got sufficient air out, at least for the horizontal nozzle to work without interruption. The vertical nozzles were more challenging.Only three securing ground spikes rather than the advertised four spikes were included. That’s not a problem for me though, as I placed a large rock on the pedestal’s base as many suggested, in addition to filling the shaft with gravel. I doubt that the spikes would be sufficient in heavy wind or if a large bird or squirrel were to join the party.I would give this pump 5 stars, except for the shortcomings mentioned in the last two paragraphs. It’s still the best pump that I was able to find and operates impressively.

reviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on February 15, 2019
reviewTitle: GREAT pumps bought a few in the past!
reviewText: Hello, I have purchased Danner pumps in the past for numerous pond and bubbling rock features. These pumps are by far an industry leader for quality and longetivity. I install these in ponds, bubbling rocks etc.. in the springtime and remove them before the frost sets in for winter. Every spring a disassemble the impeller housing and inspect the wear and tear and clean ANY deposits that may have gotten onto the pump. I also put a small dab of "vaseline" where the impeller meets the top cover and bottom .Even though the vaseline disappears in a few seconds/minutes this ensures easy startup for spring. I like these pumps because "they work" and they last if taken care of. The ONLY moving part is the impeller REMEBER when reassembling the impeller cover do NOT over tighten the screws or you WILL strip them. Snug us best and nothin more!!! I purchased this pump for a 3foot tall bubbling rock with a 3/4 hole. I use a "rubber" hose feed up the rocks hole. Should be plenty enough lift for this project Good Luck all

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Bellagio of birdbath fountains
reviewText: The lights on this fountain are amazing. The fountain seems to be durable. The filter does at time become clogged. That means it's doing its job. If you push the unit up and down in the water and create suction you can free the debris without using a new filter.The downside to this unit is that it needs constant direct sunlight to operate at full blast. At night the unit switches to it's battery and the lights turn on and the fountain operates fully until the battery runs out. Our backyard has a fair amount of shade thoughout the day so it doesn't have enough time to charge. It does enough to churn the water so it doesn't allow the water to be ome stagnant.Oh and on windy days the pump is so powerful that the spray will blow the water out of the bath. Good news is that the fountain has a shut off when there is no water so it will not burn out.We would definitely buy this product again. Next year we are going to buy a birdbath and this fountain for our front yard as it has full sun all day out there.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2019
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and fuss free pump protection
reviewText: I absolutely LOVE this barrier bag. Hate the sponge things small pond pumps come with to cover the intake, I'd rather not fiddle with slimy sponges non-stop. I don't want to run the pump with an uncovered intake, as I'm pretty sure my filter would have a lot of ground guppy in it if I did. This was just right for what I needed, brought it out of the pond a couple times this summer and sprayed it out to clean it, it's flexible, sturdy, low maintenance and didn't cost a fortune. I bought a small rectangular plastic basket from the dollar store, removed the side mesh and the bottom, and used the resulting open frame to form a cube inside the bag to keep the intake away from the mesh. While some adventurous guppy fry may have taken their final swim, the mesh openings are large enough not to constantly clog but small enough to protect the adult guppies, loaches and my goldfish. I have a preformed 300 gallon pond shell, so this isn't trying to sift out a ton of bottom crap as might be the case with a 'natural' pond.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2016
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Durable and effective
reviewText: One of our frogs got sucked in to our pump last year (they love to hang out in the skimmer and we can't keep them out), and I got this bag primarily to help keep the others from that fate. It's been in place for around a year now, and I can happily report that there have been no more frog deaths! Additionally, this bag helps to keep out larger chunks of debris and gunk that manage to slip past my other filter media. It's a good "last resort" for keeping muck out of your pump. My only minor complaint is that I wish the bottom of the bag were flat. The seam of the bag runs right through the middle of the bottom, and it sometimes makes the pump a bit wobbly on the bottom of my skimmer box.I can definitely recommend this item overall.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2015
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not for everybody.
reviewText: This may not be a fair review, but I can only report my experience and let the readers reach their own conclusion. I have a 4,000 gal. pond, presently with no vegetation. I do live in an area subject to substantial wind blown debris (leaves, seed pods, mown grass, etc.) too numerous to effectively skim from the surface. Therefore, the pump is clogged with both large and small particles and must be cleaned on a weekly to bi-weekly basis. My pump is a Little Giant, rated at 3,200 GPH., with two discharge ports, one to the filter the other directly to the waterfall. This splits ths discharge into two equal, more or less, quantities of 1,600 GPH. The filter's internal parts further reduce its discharge to about 1250 GPH.I was sure bagging the pump would solve the large debris problem, but immediately on enclosing the pump and placing it back on line, the discharge was about one-half its unbagged quantity. Seems the mesh of the bag in itself was acting as a blockage by small debris. I left it to run for the next 24 hours. That evening we had a tremendous storm which resulted in flooding the yard and washing soil and other debris into the pond. Later I noticed the pump discharge was a trickle. When I lifted the pump from the pond the bag was completely covered with soli particles which were blow or washed in by the preceding storm. Good news is that the pump itself was clog free, so I guess I could say the bag did its job to protect the pump.End of story, this may be the answer for those with a small, debris free pond. If you do decide to bag you may want to increase your pumps discharge. if you are in an area such as I, and/or you cannot increase your pump's capacity, you may wish to avoid the bag. For a small pond, easily skimmed of debris, the bag might work.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2019
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bag works Great!
reviewText: I installed the Pond Boss Pump Barrier Bag on a 400 GMP pump in my 270 gallon goldfish pond. It has been in place for a month now and I've not yet needed to clear debris from the bag. My pond is full of plant life and, prior to putting the pump inside the barrier bag, I'd have to remove debris at least every-other-day.Some other reviewers referred to problems with the barrier bag clogging up and inhibiting pump flow. That may be a true for a high volume pump. However, its not an issue at all with a relatively small, low throughput pump.I've very glad that I got this.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2016
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great here as well
reviewText: I got this product last year (2015) and another one this Feb (2016). Both were the 396GPH models. The first one was purchased in 2015 for use in a large 500 gallon pond for aeration and a little bit for aesthetics but mostly to keep the water clean and free of bugs. We run it about 4 hours every evening from 5-9pm and sometimes a lot longer in the weekends. The second one runs a small nft system running water through 1/2" sprinkler hose with branch 1/4 inch drip irrigation lines. Works great here as well, this unit runs 30 min every hour and has held up well so far.Both units came withthree-.75" Barbed x .75" Threadedtwo-.5" Barbed x .75" ThreadedNozzle x .75" ThreadedPre-wired 69 inch 120v power cordUnit contains a removable reusable and cleanable filter.ProsVery quiet, so quiet in fact that you may not even hear it running even close by.Very efficient, I checked with my kill-a-watt meter and it says it uses only 13 watts or so most of the time it is running.Pump can lift almost 6 ft (linear) with a 1/2" tube without any kinks or bends. The unit works best when it lifts no more than 5 feet from the bottom of the pumpVery tolerant pump, I even ran it off a 30 watt solar panel with a small 100 watt inverter. No problems here either.ConsWater volume goes down almost exponentially with heightNot the cheapest pumpOutdoor usage where pump sees constant sunlight can make the shell somewhat brittle

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2014
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars 3 out of 4 lifted water 6 feet.
reviewText: I purchased 4 of these pumps. The first one worked perfectly from the start and has continued to run faithfully for two weeks. The second only lifted the water 4 feet. This pump needed to be unplugged and plugged in several times before it would lift the water the full six feet of the tower, a defect which was evident within a few hours of installing it. I purchased these pumps for hydroponic towers, so it is imperative that the water flow regularly. I was able to provide nutrient solution to two hydroponic towers using one pump for a while, but this pump would be likely inadequate for any long term configuration involving more than one tower.The last two pumps seem to work fine, but each has only run for a day or so, I needed to test both just in case another one failed. I have these pumps on a timer - 15 min. on/15 min off.I returned the weak pump and was given a prompt refund. Replacement was not an option, so I had to purchase a replacement. I am keeping one for a spare, in case one of the working pumps dies. I don't know how long that will be but I will post an update when that happens.The specifications on the packaging state that the maximum height this pump will lift water is 6.5 feet. Two of the pumps are very quiet, one is a bit louder, but not distracting. The package contains barb adapters (1/2 inch and 5/8 inch(?)) for intake and outflow. Removing the housing and filter provides access to the intake where the adapter can be screwed in. This pump fits just fine in a five gallon bucket with room to spare and provides a good flow of nutrient solution to the top reservoir for distribution to the plants.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2021
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Used with Python water changer to easily complete water changes
reviewText: I'm using this pump to connect to my Python water changer to pull water out of the aquarium during water changes. Does a great job of this (using a lot less water than the original design of the Python). Good water flow to remove water at a reasonable rate. Only issue is the provided attachments to the pump, the only one that easily fits the existing Python tubing has a side nipple (last connector in the last photo of product). Connected a small piece of tubing with a small check valve closes it off well enough. Has a sponge filter built into the intake, but can be removed and any of the connectors can be added to the intake. Plan to take advantage of this to attach a hose to the intake to provide more control of where the water is being sucked up.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars You get what you pay for and this item fails in all aspects.
reviewText: This is a very weak pump that's poorly designed and manufactured.The construction is horrible.That vented area you see is held on by these inexcusably small plastic "nubs".The first time I picked up the pump out of the original box the vent popped off and the pump hit the floor. VERY FIRST TIME.I put it back on then gently pulled and popped off.When I went to put it in my reservoir, it popped off while I was sitting it in the water.That says it all. It's a poorly constructed product. Period.This will be the last EcoPlus brand product I buy.Edit: Tried using it and boy am I disappointed. It couldn't pump nutrient solution 6 feet away and 6 feet back and because of that, my water temperature got too high. I had to manually lower it.This means the pump failed in every possible way, short of at least "turning on" when plugged in.When I checked in my reservoir, the front cap and filter had fallen off. It hasn't been touched and there is no movement inside the reservoir other than air stones making bubbles on both ends while the pump stays in the middle.TL-DR: This is absolute crap. It's an underpowered, poorly developed pump made from lowest-bidder parts and aimed at making as much money as possible off YOU, the consumer.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Handy cordless tool with many uses
reviewText: This water pump is a great cordless option for a variety of outdoor and household water-pumping tasks. I was impressed by its powerful flow rate, it was super easy to pump water from our pool. I plan to use it on our fish tanks as well, and I'm sure it will work just as good when I do. It works with a 20V dewalt battery and because of the submersible design, it safley allows you to use it even in deep water, without the risk of damage to your drill battery. The fact that it is cordless along with the included adjustable hose fittings, it provide versatility as well as functionality. The battery life seems decent, although it will depend on your level of use. I found that it worked well when emptying and refilling our kiddie pool. The automatic low-voltage cutoff is a nice safety feature to protect your Dewalt battery. My only minor complaint is that the plastic construction feels a bit lightweight, so I'd hesitate to use it for any heavy-duty jobs. But for its intended purposes, this pump performs very well. It's a handy cordless tool to have around the house in case of flooding and for a number of outdoor activities and jobs.

Is it going to last I don't know I just got it a few days ago I'll update in six months. A good tip to keep pumps going for along time is keeping debris from going in your pump. Build a pre filter, or use a sponge to rap around it or something and don't let the impeller get gunky. Clean it regularly cause if you don't it burns pumps out. reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2016
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Strong Output. Solvent safe. Replaces the cheap Harbor Freight pump. (UPDATED July 2021)
reviewText: The media could not be loaded. (ORIGINAL Review September 2016) Strong Output. Solvent safe. Replaces the cheap Harbor Freight pump.See the attached video for my installation into the Harbor Freight parts washer.Installation Notes: The valve above the oil filter serves 2 purposes. 1) Keeps the fluid from siphoning out when you change oil filters. 2) Allows you to adjust the flow rate from full-blast down to a dribble. The full-blast flow rate from this pump is actually so strong that it can cause splashing. Dialing it back just a bit with the valve makes for a much neater operation.Not shown on video. I drilled 3/16 holes in the base of the washer legs to screw the legs to the dolly. Drill these holes while the washer is upside down before you fill it up with solvent. Also, I replaced all fiber lock-nuts and machine screws in the switch box with aircraft grade hardware. Make sure you reinstall two good grounds inside the switch box. I re-crimped high quality lugs onto the ground wires and used solder.The Little Giant pump works great. The big unknown is long-term durability. I will followup on this.UPDATE June 18, 2018: Little Giant pump continues to work perfectly. Output flow remains strong. Original solvent in the tank is now dark from old oil and grease forming on bottom of tank... however, the filtered fluid passing through the oil filter comes out of the flexible nozzle clean and almost clear. This is a great modification!UPDATE July 15, 2021: Still running strong. No issues after 5 years.UPDATE December 2023: Still running strong after 7 years.

I expect years of service from this unit and am very, very happy with the purchase. Thanks

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars perfect for bird bath
reviewText: As a mom who loves a beautifully maintained garden, I couldn't be happier with the Yzert Solar Fountain. This 3.5W floating solar bird bath fountain is a delightful addition to our outdoor space, and it brings so much joy to our family and visiting birds alike.**Full Glass Panel Design:**The full glass panel design is not only elegant but also highly efficient. It adds a touch of sophistication to our garden, and the glass surface ensures optimal solar absorption, keeping the fountain running smoothly throughout the day.**2200 Capacity Battery:**The 2200 capacity battery is a game-changer. Even on cloudy days, the fountain operates seamlessly, thanks to the stored solar energy. This reliability ensures that our bird bath remains a lively focal point, attracting birds and adding a tranquil water feature to our garden.**Fixed Rods for Stability:**The four fixed rods are a fantastic addition. They keep the fountain securely in place, preventing it from drifting around the bird bath or pond. This stability is especially important in windy conditions, and it ensures that the fountain remains a consistent and reliable water source for our feathered friends.**Colorful Water Display:**The colorful water display is absolutely enchanting. It creates a magical ambiance, especially in the evening when the light hits the water just right. Our kids love watching the vibrant water patterns, and it has quickly become a favorite feature during outdoor playtime.**Versatile Use:**We've used the Yzert Solar Fountain in various spots – from our bird bath to the garden pond, and even in the pool. Its versatility and ease of setup make it a wonderful addition to any part of our outdoor area. The fountain is lightweight and portable, allowing us to experiment with different placements effortlessly.**Eco-Friendly and Low Maintenance:**Being solar-powered, this fountain is an eco-friendly choice that aligns with our family's commitment to sustainability. Additionally, it's low maintenance, requiring only occasional cleaning to keep it in top condition.**Conclusion:**The Yzert Solar Fountain Full Glass Panel with 2200 Capacity Battery has truly enhanced our garden experience. It combines aesthetic appeal, functionality, and eco-friendliness in a way that delights both us and the wildlife. As a preppy mom who cherishes a well-kept garden, I highly recommend this solar fountain. It's a beautiful and practical addition that brings life and color to our outdoor space.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars works great in full sun
reviewText: This small solar water fountain is wonderful to watch (in full sun). Obviously, since it uses a solar cell for power more sun means better operation. Our fountain was sited in a small enclosure near the bird feeder. We loved it. Minimal assembly required when it arrives. We discovered that a little shade covers our fountain in the afternoon, and this causes it to "pulse" as it gains enough energy to run the pump and then soon uses that little energy it has collected and shuts down till it can accumulate more sun power. When in full sun, it is a delight.

I wouldn't go to deep or the bubbles would barely blow. I would put it in a 10-15 gallon tank not a pond. I replaced this pump with one that burned out. The burned out pump I had running would churn the water as if it had undertow ripples. This pump barely moves the water with it's highest settings. I'm going to keep this pump because I like the fact it runs on solor, so far it comes on when the sun comes up and runs for a while after the sun goes down. For this reason and this reason only I'm going to keep this pump. Would I recommend this pump for a deep pond or tank no!. But if fishing and you want to keep the fish alive yes it would be great for that. Otherwise no, I don't recommend this pump for ponds and deep aquariums.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing! Still working after 2 years!
reviewText: This fountain just keeps working! I’ve had it running continuously, 24 hours a day for over 2 years! It must however be cleaned occasionally and if it stops working it probably needs cleaning which is simple, pop the end off, remove the foam filter, wash out the entire unit, pop the end back on. I’ve cleaned mine a few times per year and it takes a couple minutes. I have it in a huge ceramic pot filled with large rocks which the birds love bathing in all day and at night it looks beautiful. Maybe it’s magic, but I honestly think it’s just a really great fountain that’s well made. FYI pump power is great, fountain level is adjustable height. Zero noise except the wonderful sound of a waterfall. There is no battery, it’s electric. The cord is long, but my outlet was far away so I use an outdoor extension cord and I control the fountain with Alexa.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect powerful garden tub mini fountain!
reviewText: I bought the upgraded solar fountain with rechargeable battery back up. It took a few days for it to be consistent with cloudy skies or sun down. The 16.5ft long cord from the pump to panel is a great for our greenhouse patio where sun is not consistent. Just move from one end to the other where the sun gets blocked from the building shadow. It comes with a stake and the panel angle is adjustable. Easy to put together and came with multiple sprinkle or spouting disc's to change up the spray.The in sun water spray height is very nice. As the skies get cloudy and sun goes down, it does reduce the spray power but keeps going at about half height ( pic #2 is cloudy most of day taken after 6pm).So far, it does not run through the night yet it runs longer than any without the battery. It helps prevent standing water bug issues and adds a nice soft water feature noise to the area.Have had this a week and am very happy I went with the upgraded model. Perfect addition for a wide galvanized wash tub pond I am growing mini water locusts in.We love utilizing solar lights and to find a small solar water pump for the mini pond feature that works this well, deserves a rave posting. Great value and quality for the money.Yes, I do wish it would continue through the night for those weekend gatherings. But for the price, the quality exceeds what we expected. We are ordering one for my mom so she can have a little pond water feature on her balcony with her plants and not worry about power cords.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2023
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Pump died within two months
reviewText: Update: lowered to one start as the pump died after about eight weeks.First the good: This is an excellent pump with good power - if anything the head pressure is a bit too much (see "flaws" below). The cord is high quality and long enough to place the solar panel in a sunny spot. The panel and battery work very well with a steady flow even on a cloudy day. I really appreciated the water level sensor that keeps the pump from running dry - these pumps usually end up draining a smaller bird bath as the wind blows the spray out of the bowl. When this happens the pump will be protected.The flaws, and there are a few: The pump is too strong and the spray will end up landing outside smaller bird bath bowls. An adjustable flow rate would have been appreciated at this price. The pump doesn't work well in deeper (two inch) bowls. The spray head ends up below the surface of the water and the spray pattern doesn't break the surface well. Including a simple extension piece, as many solar bird bath fountains do, would have helped significantly. Without an extension, six of the seven spray heads are worthless in a moderately filled bowl. On the plus side, this uses the same pump riser diameter as most other solar fountains so I was able to borrow a piece from a previous pump. The biggest flaw, and it's a show-stopper, is that the water filter holder is poorly designed. The pump has a small square of filter material keeping plant debris from being sucked into the impeller - this is a good idea for an outdoor pump. Unfortunately the holder for the filter block is open at the top. Either the filter floats out when the pump is off or a curious bird steals the block - either way the pump quickly becomes blocked without a filter. Fortunately the package includes extra filters but after losing two filters in two days, I had to fashion a wire cage around the filter holder to keep from losing the filter. Designing the filter holder to properly retain the filter could have solved this issue but instead the customer will have to devote time finding a way to keep the filter in place. This is very disappointing for a pump in this price range.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2020
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars pump when the sun shines
reviewText: I've been pumping water almost every day for almost 3 weeks to fill a trough for cattle from an old and shallow hand dug well. My original wiring dropped the voltage too much and did not work well. I rewired the pump directly to the 100W panel through a heavy duty battery switch, a heavy duty outdoor J box, SAE connectors with 10 ga pigtails and now as long as the sun is shining it works very well, not so well when it's cloudy. I'm satisfied for now. This beats the alternative, a gas powered trash pump. Next steps are battery and controller, maybe another panel, and automation.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Requires Wiring, Frustrating But Got It Figured Out in The End
reviewText: Im updating a fairly negative review I previously left. Although it's definitely not ideal that blunt end wires have to be connected and it would be helpful to have a manual showing how all the parts go together, the owner of the Amazon store contacted me directly after some not super productive correspondences with Amazon chat and provided clear answers that showed a strong understanding of my question and the product along with offering a substantial (and id say generous) partial refund on the product. Id stand by my initial complaints about it the kit requiring wiring and not having good instructions for combining the separate parts, but in the end I did receive good customer service and the issue resolved.Initial Experience:I don't know if the system works. If you order this you will receive a solar panel, some additional wires, and a pump with their own manuals but no instructions on how to combine them.To connect the solar panel and pump directly requires connecting two blunt end wires which isn't a trivial task, although I'm sure it's super simple to people more experienced in this. Not only do additional connectors need to be bought, but when I've contacted customer service several times to have them recommend a connector or further guidance on how to connect the blunt end wires they just send me back a diagram showing that black goes to black and red goes to red, which is already on the listing, and doesn't help actually physically making the connection.Additionally, the pump came with a manual saying that intricate prep like greasing and pulling back the wire coverings was required for the pump or the warranty would be voided, but that had appeared to already be done for my pump (as confirmed by the company) but is another example of the materials poorly matching the instructions.I hope to get this working with only $15 or so in extra parts. After about 6 back and forth a with their customer service, I'm largely giving up on them and trying to make it work with friends with more electrical experience.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best cost vs. function solution for water pumping in remote areas
reviewText: I will update with pictures if I can later on.I'm in eastern Washington state and needed to pump water with a *surface pump* from the little creek up to where my cabin is for gardening and showering purposes.I used one unit to pump water up the hill for 600 ft and 180 ft elevation where I placed a 275 gallon tank for collection purposes. Then I used another unit to pump that water for another 500 ft and elevation of 150 ft into another tank. Both systems works as intended overall and I'm happy with this product.A regular well would cost 500 times more at my elevation (I was quoted by a drilling company) and I was able to do what I needed (to water, take showers and even a little summer pool) at just a fraction of the cost.This season is over so I'm putting my pumps away and will update how well they work next season.So far I'm happy with the purchase and rate it 10/10. Will update later if something breaks next season etcMake sure you do research before buying to see if this is the right fit for you. You may have to accumulate water to wherever you're pumping to, because the pump doesn't pump continuously and is sun depended and wouldn't work at night. But in a sunny day I was able to pump all the way up to where my cabin is at 330 ft from the creek around 250 gallons.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works surprisingly well.
reviewText: I am thus far (2 weeks in) pleasantly surprised. The solar pump works quite well. The solar panel seems to work even not pointed directly at the sun and and under passing clouds.The battery will run the unit after sun down, maybe 2 hours. However, I unplug the connection between the solar panel and pump once the sun no longer hits the panel. My reason is, the worst thing you can do to a lithium battery is to run it down to zero charge every day. That will certainly shorten battery life. In the morning, I don't plug the pump in right away. I assume/hope this allows the morning sun to charge up the battery and keep it from running down. For me, the battery's main use is to keep the pump running on heavily overcast days. For this reason, I wish there were an on/off switch so I wouldn't have to unscrew and unplug the connection, but I realize that most users are not going to unplug the pump to keep the battery in top health.Frankly, this is a 5 star review based on 2 weeks of ownership. I took off one star because other reviews indicate these things tend to have a high failure rate and short lifespan. I am relatively surprised that it has worked so well, but not holding my breath until it fails. Also, the pump is not terribly powerful. It is suitable for a large birdbath or a very small pond, like less than 50 gallons. Finally, there are others much cheaper with the same/similar pump and panel that have no battery. At $26, your paying a lot more for the battery, which is not necessarily a critical component in many applications. But if you want a small, solar pump with a backup battery, buy one.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2019
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Replacement Identical to Original Kit, Still Doesn't Always Sink
reviewText: I have the Aquascape aeration kit that originally came with 2 for these aeration stones, and use it on small outdoor Koi pond in my backyard. I feel much better having extra air from these going into the water for when my pump and waterfall gets clogged up and slows to a trickle if not completely blocked. So this help give them backup oxygen, and for more energy on other days. Raccoons punctured my air lines so I had to pull my existing ones out, and while out, my dog got to one of the pond stones and chewed the connection off. So I am glad to see I can get an exact like kind replacement aeration disc easily. I can say it looks and works the same as a new disc that came with the kit at the beginning.My only gripe with these isn't about the replacement, but just what bugged me about the original disc. I have a hard time getting it to sink to the bottom of my pond. Sometimes it floats to the top. I had taken to tying rocks to it with twine to help hold it down. I think you have to remember to soak it in water before connecting it for hours first for it to work correctly.While replacing, it would have been nice if it came with some original tubing too. But I actually really like my thicker replacement tubing. However note that although the replacement tubing connected great to the aeration stone itself, I had to use some tape on the other end by the flow direction piece near the air pump, but would probably connect better directly to the pump. I found this to be compatible with 5/16 in OD / 3/16 in ID 20 foot line that worked great for this and much more durable.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Quiet operation, flexibility, and durability, making it appealing
reviewText: I recently purchased this Submersible Water Pump to replace an old pump in my outdoor courtyard fountain, and I’m thrilled with its performance! The installation was a breeze, and the 6.1ft power cord gave me plenty of flexibility to position the pump.One of the standout features is how incredibly quiet this pump is. Even though it’s powerful, pumping at 200GPH, you can hardly hear it running—just the soothing sound of the water flowing through the fountain. I also appreciate the adjustable flow control, which allows me to customize the water flow to suit my fountain’s design perfectly.The build quality feels solid, and with its dry-burning protection, I’m confident this pump will last a long time. It’s been a great addition to my courtyard, keeping the water moving smoothly and quietly. If you need a reliable and flexible pump for your fountain or other water features, this one is worth considering.

It just needed a cleaning out a few times...I didn't take it apart all summer, just wiped off the intake port and it worked fine. I did clean it more thoroughly when storing for winter.It's got pretty good power! The fountain spray (through a small hose) shot up as much as 6 inches. Should work next summer too.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Very Compact
reviewText: I bought the small unit as a larger one I had ordered (same mfr) hadn't shipped after a week and Amazon couldn't tell me with any certainty when it would arrive. I had to cancel that one and get one that promised two day arrival. My rating is with the understanding the pump has only been running for a week now. So I am really not addressing longevity. I am using the pump in an outdoor fountain and for that I would say it is undersized. The description says it can pump to six feet and includes a fountain as a use. My 3 level fountain is maybe four feet high (and not that big) yet at full open it works but not much "oomph" coming out of the top, and this is brand new with no debris or hard water buildup impacting performance. I wouldn't go any less than something in the 400-600 GPM for an outdoor fountain if I had to do it all over again. An aquarium should be no problem. Also, pay close attention to the two connections that come with it. They are very small and if you are trying to connect to a threaded hard plastic pipe to move the water up to the top of the fountain, you are likely to have connection issues. The bigger pumps generally come with more connection adapters. This one is more suitable to plastic tubing. Other than that, size is nice and compact and it is easy to install and is quiet. I actually bought this brand for the dry burning protection. Only time will tell on that feature. So just pay more attention to the description and measurements than I did to make sure it will meet all of your needs.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Soft and Luxurious Material, Great Size and Comfort
reviewText: The velvet material is amazing. It feels so soft and smooth, The fabric is also skin-friendly and breathable. Even though it’s super soft, it’s not heavy at all. I used to think velvet might be too warm, but It’s the perfect balance of warmth and lightweight comfort. I love running my hands over the quilt because the texture is so luxurious. I didn’t expect it to feel this fancy, but now I never want to go back to regular quilts.One of the best things about this quilt is that it works all year round. It keeps me cozy but not too hot. When it gets really cold in the winter, I just layer it with a thicker comforter, and it adds the perfect amount of warmth without feeling bulky.I’ve also used it during cooler summer nights, and it feels so nice against my skin. Since it’s breathable, it doesn’t trap heat.The design of the quilt is another reason why I’m in love with it. It has a beautiful cross-stitched pattern and subtle striped details that make it look so classy. The color is perfect for my room because it goes with everything and gives off a cozy vibe. The design isn’t just pretty—it also feels durable. The stitching is really high-quality, so I’m confident it’ll hold up even after a lot of use. It fits my bed perfectly. The quilt is large enough to cover the sides of the bed nicely, and the pillow shams are the perfect size for my pillows. It makes my bed look neat and put together.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Soft, Warm, Nice Weight…But Spots
reviewText: I got this quilt to replace another light weight one, with the only issue being color. The other one is a mint green, and I am neither a fan of pastels, nor mint green. I’d been hoping for a more sage color when I bought it, but alas, the color gods weren’t with me on that one.This one came to my attention, being of similar weight, tho a bit heavier, and a very different green. Took a chance, and am very glad I did. The color of the green 2 one is very like what you see in the product page. It’s a medium green, very nice, not anywhere near pastel land.The velvet makes it somewhat warmer than my other quilt, which had a regular fabric finish. That’s fine with me. I am one of those people who overheats way too easily, and I prefer a cool bedroom (ceiling fan on at night all year around). This quilt is just fine for me, quite comfortable in terms of warmth.I don’t use pillow shams, so no opinion on those, tho they look quite nice.The reason for the star deduction is some curious spotting on the velvet. I’m taking into account that the diamond pattern of the fabric reflects light in different shades, but after carefully washing according to product directions, it has these spots of darker color spread throughout the surface. The first picture shows it the best, to my eye, but the color differentiation is more widespread in the second picture. Not sure how well this will come thru in my pics, but the first one with the smaller spot seems more clear to me.Due to the manner in which the diamond pattern reflects light with natural variations from shadows and such, these spots aren’t terribly noticeable, yet they’re there, for no reason that I can think of.It’s a nice quilt, and the velvet is very soft. I like it and will keep it. But…those darn spots!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars light silver/sage
reviewText: I ordered the green. Read the reviews about it being lighter than expected...yes, it is lighter - a soft silver-sage color (not too blue like teal/not too yellow like olive). I will be keeping as it works for my needs. I am concerned about the fold creases throughout. I washed it in cold and dried it in a cool dryer but they'er still there. I'm giving it time and then might try washing warm/drying hotter but I don't think it should be ironed (?). Quality it good though with a medium weight - more bedspread weight than light comforter weight/thickness

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Soft and warm! Looks really nice on the bed!
reviewText: I really love this quilt! The velvet is so soft and adds just the right amount of warmth for cooler nights, and the underside is comfortable and breathable against the skin if you're someone who doesn't use a flat sheet. The sizing is more generous than most of our other quilts (Queen size fits our mattress with well over 1ft hanging over all sides), which is great if your spouse tends to roll over and try to take the blanket with them like mine does, lol. It's not bulky at all and fits in our home washing machine so I don't have to go to a laundromat to use an XL washing machine when it needs to be laundered. Also, if you have pets like we do it's worth noting that it does not attract pet hair and doesn't snag on claws. I have zero complaints and love everything about this quilt set!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pleasantly Surprised at the quality and beauty!
reviewText: This quilt is not heavy or thick like a comforter, more like a soft blanket but structured enough to be your top layer. It is really beautiful and silky to the touch! Its breathable yet warm. We have a sheet, a thin blanket, and then this quilt is our top layer. We both feel that it is the perfect temperature and that rarely happens! Typically one person throws off a layer or two because were too hot but not with this!! Considering other colors to be able to change it up with the seasons!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful heavy but cool blanket!
reviewText: I fell in love almost immediately with this blanket! The quality is amazing, literally. I ordered emerald green and the color is gorgeous. AND ITS SOFT. Velvet but so soft.I wish I came across this set sooner because it was exactly what I was looking for and more! If you’re thinking about buying, just do it. You will not be disappointed. If you love emerald green, also buy it. It’s heavenly.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars LOOKS RICH!!
reviewText: I wasn’t sure what to expect, but I was very impressed. This comforter is super soft and has an expensive look to it. The fabric is light yet it keeps me warm all night. I paired it with a white comforter and they look great together. I would recommend this item. LOVE IT!!!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Ten Star Product!
reviewText: I got the F/Q mocha brown and was hesitant on 3 fronts - the size (thought maybe since it was touted as F/Q it would be smallish) , the color and how it would hold up after wash. No problems at all! The size is very generous. Doesn’t hit the ground but covers the thick mattress and over hangs nicely. And it feels so soft! The color was exactly as shown, not really the mocha brown I'm familiar w but it is absolutely in the same color-hue family and matches great tying the browns & grays in my bedroom together. Washes fabulous too, no issues. For the price you can’t go wrong. Actually, I put this in one of the top ten in Amazon purchases I’ve made! Very happy.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfectly Sized, Cozy, and Beautiful Rustic Touch
reviewText: I couldn’t be happier with this velvet quilted blanket! The king size is actually generous, which is rare since most king quilts tend to run a little small—this one fits perfectly. The color is exactly as pictured, a gorgeous burnt orange copper that brings a wonderful rustic yet elegant vibe to our cabin.It’s super soft, lightweight, and cozy, making it perfect for year-round use. It’ll be ideal for summer, and in winter, we’ll just add a throw blanket for extra warmth. Highly recommend this blanket for anyone looking to add a cozy, stylish touch to their space! Five stars.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent!!!
reviewText: I was unsure when I ordered this if this is what I actually wanted because I was looking for something elegant, lightweight, easy to wash, and soft as air. Something so soft that it just wrapped you in softness. Guess what? This is it!!I am so pleased with this and it’s lightweight nor does it wrinkle. Great value. I would definitely recommend it. I think it’s pretty true to size. And both sides are soft

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2024

reviewText: My husband and I love this velvet quilt bedding. It fit our king size bed perfectly. We moved somewhere warm so we didn't need anything heavy. The material is just right - not too thin and not too thick. It's so nice and soft.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cute!
reviewText: The earbuds are very cute and my daughter loves them! They pair just fine with her Samsung Tab A8. The audio works for videos like YouTube, etc., but when she’s on a Messenger Kids call, the audio comes out of the tablet instead of the earbuds. The earbuds do NOT work with Messenger Kids, which is unfortunate. But in doing my research I have learned this is the doing of the Messenger Kids app, and is of no fault of the actual Disney earbuds. Again, the earbuds work with everything BUT the Messenger Kids app.

reviewerName: Ramon Leonardo Fabian RomanRamon Leonardo Fabian Roman
reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Great disappointment, broken item, broken box, burnt smell, does not charge or produce sound
reviewText: The charging case lid had broken notches, the charging case smells burnt, and the earbuds produce no sound.I bought these Lilo and Stitch Bluetooth headphones with great excitement, as they were a special gift for my daughter, who is a big fan of the movie. However, the experience was completely disappointing from the moment I opened the package. When I took them out, I noticed that the box was broken and visibly damaged, as if it had suffered several impacts during shipping. Not only was it deformed, but it also looked like it had been handled carelessly.The product’s presentation is an important part, especially when it’s a gift, and this damaged box completely took away the charm. I couldn’t even give it to my daughter with the excitement I had hoped for. I also had to spend time looking for a last-minute alternative so she wouldn’t be disappointed. I believe that a product aimed at children and presented as an "ideal gift" should have better protection to avoid these kinds of issues.Please consider improving the packaging or taking additional precautions in shipping. I would not recommend this product if you plan to give it as a gift; the risk of receiving it in poor condition is very high and ends up ruining the experience.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stitch earbuds
reviewText: These aren’t just cute but sound great and love the feel in my ears and how it sits nicely. Highly recommend and not just a great price too.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Ear bud work great but lid broke after 2 months
reviewText: Gave these to my daughter for her birthday. Earbud are very easy to connect and work great.Cons: not very durable. She dropped them once and the lid no longer stays on.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Issues after a 1 1/2
reviewText: The product was loved by my daughter. We had no issues, it connected easily, charged and the sound was good. Now that we had the product issues are arising. The right side is very low, I’ve cleaned it but it was rarely used because she used one side only. The left is not going on, doesn’t indicate if it’s charging and no sound is coming out. I’ve watched the video for troubleshooting but nothing complies to our situation. I know It’s been a long time but Im trying to connected to the company but there is no site to help. I just want to know what I can do to fix the problem. If they only last this long then that would really suck.

I’m very pleased with this bags .

reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome set
reviewText: I needed a new set of luggage desperately and was looking for a hard shell case set. I was surprised at the price and knew it was a steal. So pleased and would recommend to others!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
reviewText: I bought this 3 piece to go on a cruise from NY to Miami and while packing the night before, the handle broke off with the allowed 50lb weight. It was too late to return so I travelled the next day hoping that it would at least hold up for the entirety of the flight and cruise. Arrived at JFK and the side handle broke off also. Got to Miami the next day and the largest suitcase was scratched up and extremely dented in like it was made of plastic. On my flight back to NY, the only thing that held up was the zipper. There is absolutely nothing to salvage. The suitcase is banged in on all sides, the top and side handles were gone before the suitcase ever got on a plane. I would now have to purchase another suitcase. The carry on held up nicely though. I'm guessing it's because I carried it onto the planes. If you're a frequent traveler like me, it's not going to work and you will be pissed and disappointed like I was. Don't waste your money and save yourself the anxiety of having to wonder and worry if you'll be humiliated with an open suitcase at the baggage claim carousel.Ps, there are no extenders on any of them. The best thing was the pretty colors but don't let that fool you. The handle is also flimsy. It felt like it was going to break off at any given time but surprisingly after experiencing all of the above, it did roll well.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Held up great for a week in Florida!
reviewText: You seriously cannot beat this price for all you get. Huge checked bag, perfectly sized carry on & personal item. The toiletries bag is a little weird and honestly it doesn't do anything that the bags you already have don't, but for $100 for all 4 things I'd count it as a free gift. I would've preferred the personal item to have some pockets inside but I can live without them.I found it hard to move on 4 wheels when it was full but that could also be user error. It moved fine on 2 (tilted, pulling it behind me). The expander worked perfectly and the organization inside the hard suitcases was as expected, nothing special. There was a bit of scratching/denting on the checked bag but nothing to damage my things inside, but again, can't beat it for the price.If you're looking for super cheap luggage that still gets the job done fine, this is it.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good luggage
reviewText: I bought this set for a family trip to Europe this summer and it worked out great! It's a tad flimsy but par for what I paid for! It did hold up great through multiple airports and trainstations so I do recommend this set if you're not looking to spend a ton on new luggage!! Love the color, too!!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Hardside Luggage set
