reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Struggled entire vacation with this set
reviewText: So let me tell you about my briefcase expirience with this specific briefcase. So I like to enjoy the finer things in life and look at the glass half full kinda person. So let me start with the positives the briefcase is super cute and stylish. I like that they look good. The storage capacity is amazing you could honestly pack up a water buffalo and take it home. The storage and looks are great couldn’t ask for better. So now that you made it this far here comes the drama and the bad that you all have been waiting for. The wheels on this thing suck I have made an appointment with my chiropractor because I’ve had to drag this thing across the country literally. The wheels would be better off if they were square. The wheels on this thing was probably molded by a blind Chinese kid they felt oval. While my back is shot from lugging this thing from on and off the plane to a cruise ship my mental state is also shot. I called my therapist to up my Zoloft prescription because it’s been so frustrating dealing with briefcase. If I had spare money I would do us all a favor and throw it off the cruise ship. The wheels are so terrible they would probably work better in the ocean where this thing belongs. So now the bright side if you want to become a strong man and participate in the worlds strongest man competition this bag is for you. Because like anyone else my wife and I pack everything but the kitchen sink and when we are on vacation probably by half of the Bahamas. Thank you for making me stronger cause I carried this darn thing literally everywhere because you couldn’t figure out how to make a wheel. You made a oval. Thanks for making me stronger,blowing my back out, and on the verge of a mental breakdown.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars I put this [brand new] to the 38,000 km test [24,000 mi], and found it somewhat wanting.
reviewText: Five weeks, 11 time zones, 33,000 km by air, and 5,000 km driving overseas. <23 kg and <7 kg [for those who know the drill], but never needed to open the "expansion zippers" on either hard bag. Bought a *second* set for my 13 yo daughter, so this review reports on BOTH sets, which had similar problems.a) Nearly every screw on the extendable dragging / pushing handles came loose, the first one by the third airport. We scrounged a tiny screwdriver and kept resetting the things, but had not my farm-girl noticed the problem and fixed it temporarily with the nail-file on my toe-nail clippers, it would have been a huge PITA. Now home, we will reset all of them with Loctite. Too expensive for the Chinese manufacturers, apparently.b) Nearly every internal zipper failed, on all four "hard-case" pieces, and the only zippers on two of the four (much smaller) soft-case pieces. They split apart, jammed, and were generally uncooperative on a consistent basis. Inexcusable, since an extra 10 cents per zipper probably would have taken care of the sucky-quality problem.c) The fabric for the zip-close sections of the "hard case" luggage ripped in a couple of places. Annayance, not problem, but SHEESH, people, this is not high-dollar stuff I'm asking you to fix.d) The "hard case" is not as "hard" as suggested. I had one "casualty" even though well-packed and set to contain any mess.We'll keep using this luggage, since it's basiclly decent, but if you're a serious traveller -- like 150,000 or even 100,000 ... go up a notch for quality.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Pretty good product
reviewText: I recently purchased the Showkoo luggage Set, and overall, I must say I'm quite pleased with my purchase. The set offers ample space, comfortable handling, and a sleek design that makes it stand out on the baggage carousel. However, I did encounter an issue with the larger piece's retractable handle mechanism, which detracted slightly from an otherwise positive experience.Let's start with the positives. The luggage set boasts generous storage capacity, allowing me to pack all my essentials and more without feeling cramped or constrained. The internal compartments and pockets help keep belongings organized and easily accessible, which is a definite plus during hectic travel days.Moreover, the luggage is surprisingly comfortable to maneuver, thanks to its smooth-rolling wheels and ergonomic handle. Even when fully loaded, I found it effortless to navigate through crowded airports and busy streets without feeling fatigued or strained.The durability of the material also impressed me. Despite being subjected to the rigors of travel, the luggage held up admirably, showing minimal signs of wear and tear. This bodes well for longevity and speaks to the quality craftsmanship that went into its construction.However, the standout feature that sets this luggage apart is its spaciousness. Whether for a weekend getaway or an extended vacation, I never found myself wanting for extra room. The ability to expand the suitcase for additional storage is a game-changer, accommodating last-minute souvenirs or unexpected purchases with ease.Unfortunately, my experience was marred by a notable issue with the retractable handle mechanism on the larger piece. During my last trip, I encountered difficulty retracting the handle, which became stuck in the upright position. Despite my efforts to resolve the issue, I ultimately had to force it down to check it in, which was inconvenient and concerning.While this hiccup was frustrating, it didn't overshadow the overall positive impression I have of the Showkoo luggage Set. Its comfort, spaciousness, and durability make it a solid choice for frequent travelers like myself. However, I hope the manufacturer addresses the retractable handle issue to ensure a seamless experience for future customers.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far, really nice!
reviewText: Tired of inline-skate type wheels and ducted-taped corners of my old soft-sided luggage, I purchased this set for my upcoming month-long cruise. So far, I'm really impressed! Transitioning from soft-sided to hard-sided might take a moment (opening like a book instead of a box), but I think I'll really like it. The 28" and 26" can both expand, which is a necessity for this habitual over-packer! The zipper on the 26" case had two places where the teeth of the zipper has pulled apart, but in running the zipper over them they closed up fine. I am watching them very closely though and will replace that case if they cause any further trouble. (I purchased the 3 year coverage.) The corner of the 28" case has two small areas of discoloration (like the plastic had been stressed), but there is no damage to the case otherwise, so I'm not concerned about that. The TSA locks were easy to change the passcode. The zippers don't fit as deep down into the locks as I expected, but they locked fine. The locking mechanism doesn't appear to be the best though -- somewhat small and flimsy. A couple bad hits or bumps, and they'll probably not work. Makes me glad I purchased the coverage! However, the zippers do have holes to put a padlock type lock through if they do fail. The lock on the 26" case got caught and wouldn't open at first. I gently manipulated the lock until it finally released and opened. I'm hoping that it was a sticky place due to newness and not being used. However, it that happens again, I will request a replacement case. The material inside the cases is so nice! It is not plastic like in less expensive types of luggage. The interior zippers do seem a little thin for my taste, but they work very well so far. Each case has three interior pockets, the dividing sheet which zips closed on the left side, and an x-type elastic band to hold clothing in place on the right side. The wheels work well, but I hope they are attached very well to the cases (you can't tell how they're attached). The telescoping handles seem par for the course. I love the soft feel of the handles on each of the cases (one on top, one on the side), and they go flat so they shouldn't catch on anything in transit. The thin rubber along the edges of the cases where the zippers are don't seem to be very sturdy. I think the rubber stripping should be a bit thicker and sewn on with at least a double stitch. As they are, there's only one line of stitching attaching the rubber to the case. This is definitely something I'll keep my eye one.Once I use this luggage set, if my opinion changes or if anything goes wrong, I will update this review by Dec of 24. I gave four stars rather than five for the concerns mentioned previously. However, so far I am very pleased with theses cases.I would recommend purchasing.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!
reviewText: I bought the 5 piece set in 2021 before I moved to Wales. I moved all my belongings over in it. The two smaller bags are not very useful, I use a backpack instead of the tote and lost the little travel bag. The three rolling bags however are amazing. A little over 3 years later the two bigger ones are still being used. I personally broke the 20" carry on by overfilling it (cramming in my neck pillow). This broke the plastic shell, which I then proceeded to tape with Gorilla tape and some stickers and keep using for another year and a half before I bought a new one in a new colour. My mom has since claimed the mildly broken one and is using it.These bags have moved my belongings from USA to Wales, then to Scotland, and then to Slovakia. I use them now every time I travel back to the states or splurge for a an extra bag on a Ryanair flight. I absolutely love them, great value for money. I don't know what people are doing to break them so easily, other than some scuff marks they are doing really well.I will say the blue colour I got is very popular amongst luggage, it doesn't stand out very well.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My Comprehensive Review of the Travelers Club Chicago Hardside Expandable Spinner
reviewText: Introduction:The Travelers Club Chicago Hardside Expandable Spinner Luggages in black are a popular choice for travelers seeking a durable and functional carry-on option. This review aims to provide a comprehensive and unbiased assessment of this luggage, highlighting its strengths and weaknesses to help potential buyers make an informed decision.Design and Durability:The black hardside exterior of the Travelers Club Chicago luggage exudes a sleek and professional appearance. The construction appears solid and well-built, utilizing ABS materials known for their resistance to impacts and scratches. The spinner wheels allow for smooth maneuverability, making it easy to navigate through crowded airports or busy streets. However, it's important to note that some users have reported minor issues with the wheels' durability over extended periods of use.Size and Capacity:With a 20" carry-on size, the Travelers Club Chicago luggage adheres to most airline regulations and provides ample space for shorter trips or overnight stays. The expandable feature offers extra packing capacity when needed, allowing travelers to fit in additional belongings. The interior compartment is well-designed and includes organizational features such as zippered pockets and compression straps to keep items secure during transit.Handling and Maneuverability:The four 360-degree spinner wheels provide excellent maneuverability, allowing users to effortlessly glide the luggage in any direction. The retractable handle extends and retracts smoothly, providing a comfortable grip. However, it's worth mentioning that some users have reported occasional wobbling of the handle when fully extended, which may cause slight inconvenience during use.Security Features:The Travelers Club Chicago luggage includes a TSA-approved combination lock, providing an added layer of security for travelers. This feature allows airport security personnel to open and inspect the luggage without damaging the lock. Users appreciate the peace of mind that comes with having a lock integrated into the luggage, although some have experienced minor issues with the lock mechanism.Weight and Portability:Despite its durable construction, the Travelers Club Chicago luggage remains relatively lightweight, making it easier to lift and carry when necessary. The compact size and manageable weight contribute to its overall portability, ensuring that it doesn't become a burden during travels.Price and Value for Money:The Travelers Club Chicago Hardside Expandable Spinner Luggage offers good value for its price. It provides a balance between durability, functionality, and affordability, making it an attractive option for budget-conscious travelers. While it may not possess the premium features found in higher-end brands, it delivers on its promises and offers a reliable travel companion at a reasonable price point.Conclusion:The Travelers Club Chicago Hardside Expandable Spinner Luggages, Black, 20" Carry-On offer a sturdy and practical travel solution for individuals in need of a reliable carry-on suitcase. Its durable construction, expandable capacity, and smooth maneuverability make it well-suited for short trips or overnight stays. While it may not be without its minor flaws, such as occasional issues with the wheels or handle wobbling, it remains a solid choice in terms of value for money. Ultimately, the decision to purchase this luggage will depend on personal preferences and priorities

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, cute, expandable, & cheap; but inspect it upon arrival
reviewText: I originally bought two of these for my kids. They are sturdy and the colors are super cute. Perfect size for carry on, even when expanded. And the wheels expand with it, so it does not fall to one side when expanded (like my old luggage). I particularly appreciate that the wheel base expands when the luggage is expanded. The extendable side is under the zipped lining, so it keeps the clothes in.I find the elastic band with the buckle a bit too stretchy and it does not really hold the items in place when opening the luggage, but just being careful to open the luggage with that side down does the trick to keep everything in place. I also put the larger items on that side and placed a large towel on top to ensure everything on that side stayed in regardless. It’s a bit of a hazle, but can’t complain considering I paid about $35 for this luggage.I like the squareness of the design: it fits a lot of clothes and shoes easily and is spacious inside. The handle rails do not take a lot of space internally, so it’s easy to pack items without them interfering too much (another challenge I had with my old luggage).The hard side kept everything protected and did not get stained even after having to check the bags gate-side and pickup at baggage claim. I think the fact that the luggage was comfortably full helped, but I was pleasantly surprised that the hard case was not stained, dirty, cracked, or damaged after that.I love the colors! So I ordered 3 of these. The last one came with a torn stitch which caused the lining and stretch buckle to be loose on one side (see pictures). Thankfully, I was going to use it right away, so I unboxed it right away. Too bad that this caused me to have to travel with my old luggage (which is having trouble with the handle retracting.). But, I was able to return it to Amazon, so no issues.overall, I’m really happy with this purchase, and my daughters love their luggage!One thing I noticed is that these hard case suitcases are not very forgiving when unevenly full and become really hard to zip, but moving things around inside did the trick. I was a bit apprehensive about packing too much in and whether the lining and sticking was going to hold, but was pleasantly surprised after our first international trip with these.The wheels and handles worked well and smoothly, making it easy to maneuver around the airport. I like the rubber pads on the side, which keep the luggage from cratching essily. Overall, great value for the money!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars DO NOT PURCHASE THIS SET!!!!! Broke on first use in a terrible way.. keep reading
reviewText: I NEVER leave reviews but buyers need to look elsewhere for their luggage. I purchased this set at the end of 2023 as a Christmas gift for my son's fiancé, for their honeymoon in October of 2024. She has never traveled over seas and she was so excited for the new set as she did not have any luggage.The photos provided are not one corner, BUT 3 CORNERS. The first wheel broke as they got to the airport to leave on their FIRST flight. Meaning, it had never been used and it broke upon first use almost immediately. They persevered with the other wheels still in tact.FORTUNATELY- they went on a cruise so once aboard they did not have to use it again until departure.They are currently flying back over the Atlantic on their return home and the next 2 pictures are what happened on the first flight of their travel home. THEY ARE DOWN TO ONE WHEEL Y'ALL!!!!Obviously- I am just mortified that the first big gift I gave to her as a future family member was total crap and literally fell apart on them with only 2 uses.I am sure there is nothing the seller or Amazon will do since it has been so long since purchased so I just want other potential buyers to KEEP SCROLLING for another seller and different manufacturer so you are not gifting crappy luggage or even plan to use for yourself.If you made to the end... you a real one.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2015
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An Honest Opinion
reviewText: Okay, so this is my first purchase of luggage. I've never really traveled or had need for luggage before, but I knew I wanted something that stood out against all the black, red, and purple luggage I saw the one and only time I flew. I scoured the internet for something bright but at least somewhat affordable and came across this set. I read the reviews and noticed they were a little back and forth but went ahead and risked it anyway. Here's what I thought.If you're looking for something that can be completely beat up while traveling without a single sign of tear and wear, then you probably don't want to order this luggage. However, if you take into consideration that you're getting a four piece set for $100 and that it's going to get beat up, it's not a bad deal. I used the largest suitcase to travel to Las Vegas from Detroit for my wedding. The luggage itself actually help up really well. I didn't have anything torn or anything like that. Only down side was now I realize why people get dark luggage. You can totally see everywhere my luggage touched on the conveyors and what not. It's pretty dirty looking, but it's just dirt.You can sort of tell the cheapness to the luggage when you open it, but honestly, for $100 for a four piece set, it was 100% worth it in my opinion. It protected my stuff and got it moved safely back and forth and that's all I needed it to do. Plus now I can use the smaller ones for traveling by car to see family. I would definitely recommend this to people who want something that isn't just the same boring suitcase everyone else has. However, for those of you who travel a TON by plane and need something that's going to really last you, I'm not sure how well this would work out. You just really have to remember you're getting what you pay for in a way.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2012
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Skeptical Based on Reviews, Impressed Upon Arrival!
reviewText: I had read all the reviews of this set after I ordered it. I ordered 2 of them, the Zebra print and the Camouflage print. I was becoming very nervous based on the reports of the seams and zippers being broken. However, when this set arrived I was very impressed. The only defect I noticed was minor fraying on the strap of the largest piece. I trimmed with scissors and now it looks perfect. I rolled them around the house and didn't see any issues with the wheels. I took out and tested each individual piece as this is a purchase for our upcoming trip in 2 weeks from AZ to TX and another trip at the end of July from AZ to NY. I packed the middle piece with my son's medical supplies weighing 40 pounds. It still rolled nicely after being packed. Also, I noticed on the other reviews that there were complaints about the luggage standing after being packed. I didn't have this problem, the luggage stood perfectly on both tile and carpet. I packed heavier items towards the wheels and the lighter items towards the top strap. The little tote bags that came with set are large compared to what I have seen. My son has played with his quite a bit in the last 24 hours. Opening and closing it and filling it to the top and emptying it. So far there haven't been any issues with a broken zipper or seam. Based on other items that I have seen in the stores, this is a great value. I have seen comparable items in the store for $99 for just the largest piece. I haven't yet put these through an airport test. As I stated we don't leave for 2 weeks. If I find that these pieces don't hold up, I will be sure to add an update.There are a few cons that I noticed. The locks that come with the set are cheap and chinsy. I would recommend buying separate locks if you need them. *****Major Con for Zebra set**** The coloring is definitely off. It is not a lime green outline. It is certainly more of a neon yellow. This didn't bother me as I will need something that sticks out at the airport. However, if you are someone that is looking to match something else with this set it will be difficult, if not impossible.Overall, I would say this is a great set for the price. If you are looking for something that is top of line, I wouldn't recommend this. However, if you are looking for something that is affordable and decent, I would highly recommend this set.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Happy Vacationer
reviewText: I recently purchased the Coolife Luggage 4 Piece Set Suitcase and I have been extremely impressed with its quality and functionality. This set comes with four different sizes of suitcases, making it perfect for any type of travel, whether it be a short weekend trip or a long vacation.One of the standout features of this luggage set is the TSA lock. This provides an added layer of security and peace of mind when traveling, as it allows only TSA agents to open and inspect your luggage without damaging the lock. This is especially useful for international travel where customs may need to inspect your bags.The suitcases are made of a softshell material, which not only makes them lightweight but also durable. I have used this set on multiple trips and have not experienced any tears or damage to the material. The spinner wheels also make it easy to maneuver the suitcases through busy airports and streets.The black and red color combination of this set is sleek and stylish, making it easy to spot on the baggage carousel. The interior of each suitcase is also well-designed with multiple compartments and pockets, allowing for efficient packing and organization.Overall, I highly recommend the Coolife Luggage 4 Piece Set Suitcase for anyone in need of a reliable and stylish luggage set. It has exceeded my expectations in terms of quality, functionality, and customer service. I am confident that this set will last me for many more trips to come.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2019
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars UP date on my previous Review - Disappointed that it did not even make it through my first flight
reviewText: Update on my previous Review -I would like to make an amendment to my previous review about my Coolife suit case. While I was disappointed about the large suit case collapsing during my first trip, which compromised the entire suit case. I contacted Coolife about my experience, and I was emailed back immediately by Blair. Blair took the time to look at the photos I sent, read my email to Coolife and read my review on Amazon. I was surprised at the amount of time she took to resolve my issue. I even received a personal phone call from Blair. During this phone conversation, she listened to my concerns about the suit case and why it was important that I have one that is very sturdy. She offered me two options for replacing the previous suit case. She sent the links directly to my email, so I could look at the links at my convenience. Once I had made a decision, I emailed her back and got another prompt email with details about the replacement suit case. Coolife sent me the replacement hard shell suit case at no charge. Even after I got my replacement suit case Blair called and sent me an email to touch base to ensure that everything with the new suit case was good.Blair provided exceptional customer service, and I was very happy that Coolife replaced my suit case with no charge. Even though my first suit case was compromised, I highly recommend Coolife due to the incredible customer service I received! A big Thanks to Blair for all her help! Based on this experience I will be changing my rating to 5 stars, great costumer service goes a long way.Previous review -I ordered this luggage because my old luggage had fallen apart. I was very excited to get this luggage because I had a number of trips coming up this summer. I read a number of reviews about how easy to move and durable this luggage set is. Durability is very important to me because I travel to a variety of places, everything from resorts for ballroom competition to remote places around the world. I am very disappointed that the largest suit case of the set did not even make it through my first flight. One side of the suit case a few inches above the wheel collapsed or the metal wire bent, but either way it compromised the entire suit case. It made it very difficult to wheel the suit case once I had arrived to my destination. Due to this, it made me very nervous when I was flying back because I did not know if it would hold up through my travels' home or not. Even though this was extremely disappointing because I was hoping this suit case would be as sturdy and long lasting as my previous large suit case, the carry on suit case was amazing and full filled all the expectations I had for it.I do want to note that the carry on suit case and the middle size (which I have not used for travel yet), and the large suit case arrived in good condition and as described by the seller.Due to my experience, I am going to rate this a 2 instead of a 1 because the large suit case was not durable enough to make it through my first flight, which made it difficult to move the suit case once I had arrived and during my travels back. The carry-on suit case held up wonderfully, which helped earn the additional star for this review.

reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Turns out I don't like zippered luggage.
reviewText: This is the first set of luggage that I've owned with a zipper instead of a hard-shell case with a snap-down latch. Thought I'd try it. There is definitely lots of space in these things and they roll SO SMOOTHLY!!! I gotta give them that. But the outer shell is quite flexible so there is the chance that more fragile packed things could get damaged if you don't pad them right, and none of the zippers seem very strong to me. I am planning to return to the clamp-style. No more zippered cases for me. The other thing is that these come with little combination luggage locks that are completely worthless!!!! Weak locks, not TSA-friendly, and they don't always set right when you try to change the combination. Worthless. Anyway, loved the colors and the great rolly-wheels... but that's about it. :)

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect carry-on
reviewText: Holds a lot but meets airline size restrictions for overhead bins. Half has a zipper cover for the whole compartment which is great for smaller items like socks & underwear. The other half has a nice "double-Y" shaped elastic strap which securely holds items in that side. It's quite lightweight, but the spinner wheels and the handle are both sturdy. Plus it's unique with the gray and orange, so it doesn't get confused with the multitudes of black bags.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works great for me. I would recommend for light travel.
reviewText: I have owned a piece of luggage just like this for the past 10 years or so. It is not fancy, but it gets the job done. I travel with my job, pretty much on a weekly basis. Driving to my destinations. This piece works great for that. I have used it while flying several times and has done well there also. It was worth the cost. But recently the handle broke so I went shopping, when I say I went shopping, I pulled up Amazon😁😁. Luggage is so expensive, and I’m not giving upwards of $200 for a “carry on” so I went back to my old standby. I purchased this piece , It is by for not the most expensive, or probably not the best luggage, but if it lasts like my last one it is well worth the cost. It is easy to maneuver around, and comes with a small combination lock, if you chose to use it.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Durable
reviewText: I ordered two. Luggage durable, survived cross country trip from Balto. to Wales, UK! And back with all wheels still working & luggage fairly unscathed. Luggage handlers are not known for their gentle handling techniques. No matter, this luggage handled it! Zipper lock was flimsy and unreliable, thank God I was able to find luggage straps in T. K. Maxx (TJ Maxx in the US) that matched and fit around to hold the luggage closed perfectly!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2024
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Two wheels broke off while we were traveling
reviewText: We bought the 20" version of this bag about 18 months ago and traveled with it multiple times since without a problem. Before traveling to Alaska for three weeks, we decided to replace our old 28" bags with the 28" version of this brand, since we liked the smaller version so much. We bought two sets and packed both to be well under the 50-lb limit set by the airlines. The wheel broke off my husband's bag as we wheeled it into the hotel on the first night of our trip. The first wheel on my 28" bag broke off on the 10th day of our travels, and a second wheel on my 28" bag was missing when we got to the airport for our final leg home. We left home with a total of 8 wheels between the two bags. We made it home with 5. Not great odds. I admit that we were on and off multiple planes, trains, and buses during our journey, but that's what travel often is and that's what your luggage is supposed to survive. According to the manufacturer, this luggage is, "...made of ABS. The major benefits of this material - it is extremely lightweight, it is durable, and protects the contents of your luggage." I would suggest that unless you're packing to do a driving trip that doesn't involve anyone else handling your luggage, pick a different brand. Their five-year warranty doesn't cover "damage by the common carrier" making this stuff worthless for anyone traveling on commercial carriers...which is most of us.

reviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on May 2, 2019
reviewTitle: Excellent Product at a Great price!
reviewText: This set was fantastic for my very first plane trip, but now I see why most people carry black luggage lol. I got the pink set and it's gorgeous. Received many compliments from others at the airport. However, when the flight is fully booked and this pink carry on has to be checked, it runs the risk of it being put facedown into a puddle of deisel fuel (which happened to me). So with hot water and Dawn, I washed and scrubbed as best I could. There is still a little bit of the dirt/grease mark still on it and the fabric glue has come off inside on the large front pocket because of my scrubbing, but it does not affect the integrity of the carry on. Nothing is ripped, the fabric on the pocket is justa little loose now when the bag is empty. Still fills out well! I'm still happy to use it! It just looks like I've travelled a lot lol ;-)

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2021
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Does not include TSA Locks as advertised in description. Normal combo lock. ABS plastic is thin.
reviewText: Completely disappointed. This item is Sold and Shipped by Amazon but the description was clearly not vetted by Amazon. The built in locks are not TSA approved locks as advertised in the description. They do not contain the TSA approved logo/mark. The locks have no physical keyhole for a TSA lock key. No instructions were included on how to manage the lock (e.g. change the code). The hardware for the luggage is installed overtop the protective film on the case itself. It took me an hour to remove the film fully from all three bags. The abs plastic is thin ensuring limited durability. Spend a few extra dollars for something better. This item is being returned.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2021
reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Skeptical after just opening the box
reviewText: When I first opened the box, i noticed what appeared to be scuffs in the largest suitcase. Upon removing them from the packaging, I realized they had a "protective film" covering the suitcases. This immediately brought to mind the question "if this is a durable finish why does it require a protective film?" I began removing the film and encountered 2 primary issues. First, I have arthritis and chronic tendonitis in my hands, it has taken me almost an hour to get the majrity of the film off 3 suitcases. The film does NOT come off easily at all. Second, with out the use of something like a utility razor, there is NO way to get all the film removed (see pics). The film simply stretches and tears to shreds when you try to remove it from the edges and fasteners. I would prefer to not have to take a razor or knife to my brand new suitcase before I even have the chance to use them. So my brand new suitcase set looks quite ragged, as if the finish is peeling. Why, if a protective film was necessary for shipping, did the manufacturer not make certain the film was not trapped under every edge of every fitting to allow for full remaval. And if the manufacturer was confident in the durability of the finish, was a protective film necessary in the first place? Another concern is they feel rather cheap. There is a flimsiness to the structure and fittings that does not inspire confidence. Also, there are no included instructions on how to reset the lock codes from 0-0-0. My next step will be searching online to try and figure out how to reset the codes for some degree of security for my belongings.On a positve note, the color is lovely as is the current finish and design. The zippers, handles, and wheels all move easily. They are lightweight. And they were inexpensive.As a side note, I bought a simlar set of a different brand for my son at the same time I bought these for myself. The price of the other set was comparable. It felt much more durable and did not have a protective film. My suggestion to anyone looking to purchase a new suitcase set is keep looking. There are other sets in this price range without the hassles I have encountered simply removing these from the packaging.*I travel several times per year for work and pleasure. If I don't forget, I will update my review at a later date once I have put these to use a few times.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2021
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cute and seemingly sturdy luggage!
reviewText: UPDATED REVIEW: I traveled to CA and the luggage held up so well! I’m truly impressed. I haven’t even notice more damage than a couple very tiny scratches. I flew on a smaller plane, so overhead space was limited, but I easily carried my small suitcase on the plane and it wasn’t too heavy to put in the overhead bin. These sets are awesome!! Worth the splurge in my opinion.ORIGINAL REVIEW: I bought this set because my older, soft-sided luggage was on its last leg from my latest trip. I love that this Betsey Johnson luggage has more than 2 wheels so it’s nice and easy to maneuver.I haven’t traveled with them yet-I’ll be using the carry on only for my CA trip in July, but I expect the carry on will hold up just fine.The one thing I’m concerned about, which others have mentioned, is that when/if any of the bags are checked, the TSA agents are very unforgiving, and the luggage may not hold up very well. This is my reason for 4 stars instead of 5.FedEx delivered the box to my front door which was so helpful because I live on the third floor of my apartment building. The luggage comes in a large Betsey Johnson box, so I imagine if you wanted to surprise someone with it, it may be difficult to hide what it is.I believe that unfortunately, there’s really no way to guarantee that you won’t receive a set with damage or defects... it’s kind of the luck of the draw. My set was perfect, but obviously there are reviews where that was definitely not the case.All in all, I might buy again , however Amazon raised the price from around $250 to nearly $275 in the last week, which seems unfair and unfortunate.I do recommend this luggage- great buy!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2022
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent, reliable suitcases
reviewText: Surprised at what great quality these even with the beautiful design! They’re everything I wanted in luggage: easy to maneuver/agile, sturdy, very* generous capacity, great internal zipper compartment to keep (plenty of) shoes (even boots and heels) and toiletries separate from clothes and other items, sturdy handles, and quality inner lining. Zippers are also thick and slide easily (my toddler can’t get enough of them and hasnt broken any yet and I’m not worried she will cuz they’re sturdy). My mid size one was heavily filled on a recent trip (packed 10 days into it plus dresses to attend a wedding, all without the zipper expander) and took a good tumble off the curb and slid a bit into the street on a slant when I wasn’t paying attention (tho it rolled standing upright with some finesse before going down) and came out with the casing pretty much unscathed, just a little mark on the handle where it hit, so I’m pretty confident these can handle being tossed in and out of a luggage trolley pretty well and maintain the nice exterior. Also, they just make me happy to see in the room during travel— they’re bright, have hummingbird animal spirit vibes, and my little girl seems to think they’re all for her! And if they truly hold the test of time by the time she’s big enough they will be :)

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 3, 2023
reviewTitle: Cheap, thin, plastic
reviewText: I would not recommend buying this luggage set, in no way is it ‘hard shell’ or ‘extra thick’ material as advertised, or that you would expect from hard shell luggage. All 3 cases are made of cheap, thin, flimsy plastic, that bends easily when pushed. Nor does it have a textured finish to prevent scratches, it’s shiny and will scratch very easily. The zips are cheap and flimsy too, with some of the teeth already misshapen. This luggage set will not withstand airport handling, and is being returned.The seller has also stated on the advert, that they offer ‘free returns’ for ‘any reason’… This is not true, I generated a return, only to be told I am responsible for the return fee, and they will only refund up to £4.75 towards the return cost. The weight of the cases combined is around 26lbs, without the huge box it came in, so you can imagine what the cost of return will be!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2024

reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Cute Luggage... that's about it
reviewText: First of all, the luggage comes wrapped in a plastic film that took me 2hours to get off, had to use an exacto knife around corners and edges to remove. Once off, luggage shines beautifully. Very cute set (I get a few compliments in the airpots when people see them) but not well made. Very thin plastic shell, wheels cute but too small for luggage to maneuver smoothly, if luggage is packed to the max it tips over when trying to roll. Ive taken all three pieces on two trips now, by the second trip, on arrival the smallest luggage, the plastic around wheel was busted after I checked it under the plane. These also do not expand or have a tsa lock. If you want cute luggage, go for it, if you want luggage that's going to last and be reliable I'd look elsewhere.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2022
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Disappointing, at this point I wouldn't recommend
reviewText: I chose these because the reviews were pretty good and it was a nice looking set. Unfortunately the plastic coating ruins the looks because you can't get it off of all areas. I spent hours with tweezers trying to remove it. I also used an old credit card as a scraper which helped a little but I wrecked my nails AND my tweezers and still can't get it all off. Don't have much confidence that they will stay shiny if they had to be covered like that just for shipping.The case seems like flimsy plastic as are the handles, the zippers don't zip very smoothly; and it is NOT expandable as the description says. They aren't roomy, I filled the largest with quilts etc. just to test the wheels, it was packed full and only weighed 29 pounds. The one good thing I can say is that the wheels did move easily with that weight, although I wonder how they will do with heavier items. This was NOT what we were expecting as we thought Rockland was a good and dependable brand. I'm concerned on how these will hold up going through airlines, guess we'll be bringing duct tape along on our next trip for emergency fixes. Don't recommend these at all.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice carry on for the money
reviewText: The built in charger slash cup holder on this thing is great. Yeah, it's plastic, no it's not built to be abused but what is these days? It's a really nice feature to have waiting at the gates to change planes or anywhere you have limited access to power. I'm old, fat, and disturbingly clumsy but I had no trouble draggin this thing through ramps, escalators, elevators, moving walkways you name it. Like I said.... Clumsy, so I (repeatedly) bashed the wheels on this thing into walls, smacked the sides into car doors, posts, .......... Other people.... Oops. It took it all like a champ. I'm sure this thing will comply with all the airlines carryon rules.It will expand a bit by use of an expansion zipper so you can over stuff it if need be. If you need an inexpensive carry on that looks great and does the job this is your pick. One last thing. The expanding handle has been mentioned in other reviews as flimsy. Well, it's not made from pillars of steel that's true but I have had no problem with it.Update: July 2024 I read an extensive rather negative review about this piece of luggage and it's really unfortunate. Really my mind gets blown by some of these reviews. One complaint was that the USB charging feature was unreliable. Baloney. What's more likely is your portable battery is unreliable. It's a simple connection ok? Plug the battery in, zip it up in the pocket and then plug your phone , tablet, whatever in the other side. They make a ZILLION of those connectors in thousands of products every day, they rarely fail. Complaint: the color looks faded. What? Look at the picture. That's what you get. I call BS. Complaint: no compartments. Holy crap on a cracker. It's a CARRY ON. carry ons are SMALL. They are supposed to be........First time flyer? Complaint: cheap material and zippers. What are you......a gorilla? Unless you plan on a mid trip temper tantrum where you plan to grab this thing by the compartment divider and throw it at your equally angry spouse, it should last many years. Complaint: the lock was flimsy. WHAT LOCK? I didn't get a lock with mine. I have no idea what the reviewer was expecting from this luggage but it kinda seems like he expected a 300 dollar piece of Samsonite. And.....I gotta tell ya, the reality of that is well......Go ahead and over pay for something else if it makes you feel better.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2023
reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Fails to Deliver on Promises
reviewText: I recently purchased the Wrangler Smart Luggage Set with Cup Holder and USB Port in Olive Green, specifically the 20-Inch Carry-On model, with high hopes of a convenient and reliable travel companion. However, after using this luggage extensively, I can confidently say that it was a regrettable purchase. This thorough and detailed review aims to provide honest and unbiased feedback to potential buyers, highlighting the product's shortcomings and explaining why it fails to meet expectations. While I understand that experiences may vary, I believe it is important to share my personal encounter to help others make informed decisions.Design and Build Quality:The first impression of the Wrangler Smart Luggage Set was underwhelming. The olive green color appeared faded and lacked vibrancy, giving an overall cheap look. The material used in the construction of the luggage felt flimsy, and I had concerns about its durability even before my first trip. The zippers, handles, and wheels seemed poorly made, which raised doubts about their longevity.Functionality:The primary selling points of this luggage set are the built-in cup holder and USB port. Unfortunately, these features turned out to be more of a gimmick than practical additions. The cup holder is positioned on the side of the luggage, making it almost impossible to access when the bag is upright. Additionally, it lacks stability, causing drinks to spill easily, posing a risk to valuable belongings. As for the USB port, it was a complete disappointment. The charging function was unreliable, frequently disconnecting, and providing inconsistent power output. It is frustrating to have a luggage with such features that do not work as intended.Storage Capacity:The 20-Inch Carry-On model promised ample storage space. However, the design of the interior compartments was inefficient. The main compartment lacked dividers or organizing pockets, making it difficult to separate and locate items quickly. The flimsy lining tore after minimal use, compromising the overall structure of the luggage. Furthermore, the external pockets were not deep enough to accommodate larger items securely. The storage capacity did not live up to its claims, leading to constant reorganization and difficulty in packing efficiently.Maneuverability:One would expect a 20-inch carry-on to be easy to maneuver. Unfortunately, the wheels on the Wrangler Smart Luggage Set were a constant source of frustration. They lacked smooth rotation, often getting stuck or veering in awkward directions. Pushing or pulling the luggage required excessive effort, resulting in unnecessary strain during travel. The telescopic handle was loose and wobbly, adding to the overall inconvenience. Moving through busy airports or crowded streets became a tiresome task, and I found myself longing for a more reliable and effortless experience.Durability and Longevity:The build quality of the Wrangler Smart Luggage Set did not inspire confidence in its long-term durability. During my first trip, I noticed scuff marks and scratches on the exterior, suggesting poor resistance to rough handling. The wheels showed signs of wear and tear after minimal use, making me question their ability to withstand long journeys. The handle mechanism felt weak and unstable, leading me to worry about its potential failure in the future. Considering the price point of this luggage set, I expected a product that would withstand the rigors of travel, but sadly, it fell short in this aspect.Customer Service and Warranty:When I reached out to the customer service department regarding the issues I faced with my Wrangler Smart Luggage Set, I experienced further disappointment. Their response time was slow, taking days to reply to my initial query. Furthermore, their solutions were unsatisfactory, merely suggesting basic troubleshooting steps without addressing the specific concerns I had raised. The warranty provided was limited and did not cover several aspects of the product. It was evident that the company's commitment to customer satisfaction was lacking, leaving me feeling unsupported and frustrated.1. Security Concerns: Another aspect worth mentioning is the lack of security features in the Wrangler Smart Luggage Set. While it does come with a standard lock, it felt flimsy and provided minimal protection. The overall structure of the luggage did not inspire confidence in keeping belongings secure during travel. The absence of any additional security measures, such as TSA-approved locks or reinforced zippers, raises concerns about the safety of valuable items.2. Weight Distribution Issues: During my travels, I noticed significant weight distribution issues with this luggage set. Evenly distributing the weight across the wheels proved to be a challenge, resulting in imbalanced handling. This imbalance not only affected maneuverability but also caused the luggage to topple over easily, especially when navigating uneven surfaces or while in transit. It was frustrating to constantly struggle with a luggage that lacked stability.3. Inadequate Padding and Protection: The Wrangler Smart Luggage Set provided insufficient padding and protection for delicate items. The thin lining and lack of additional cushioning left items vulnerable to damage during transit. I found myself having to be overly cautious and packing extra layers of padding to ensure the safety of my belongings. For a product marketed as a smart luggage set, the lack of adequate protection was a significant disappointment.4. Limited Color Options: While personal preference may vary, it is worth noting that the Wrangler Smart Luggage Set offered limited color options. The olive green color, which I opted for, appeared dull and unattractive in person. It would have been beneficial to have a wider range of colors to choose from, allowing customers to select an option that suits their personal style and preferences.5. Price Point and Value for Money: Considering the price point of the Wrangler Smart Luggage Set, it is crucial to evaluate its value for money. Unfortunately, this product falls short in terms of quality, functionality, and durability, making it an unsatisfactory investment. There are alternative luggage options available in the market that offer better features, sturdier build quality, and superior customer support within a similar price range.Conclusion:In conclusion, I cannot recommend the Wrangler Smart Luggage Set with Cup Holder and USB Port, Olive Green, 20-Inch Carry-On to anyone seeking reliable, functional, and durable luggage. From the poor design and build quality to the lack of functionality, this product falls short on multiple fronts. The storage capacity is inefficient, maneuverability is subpar, and the promised features like the cup holder and USB port are more hassle than convenience. Moreover, the questionable durability, coupled with disappointing customer service, further diminishes its value. I highly recommend exploring other options that offer better quality and functionality within a similar price range.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Samsonite Saga: A Family Affair
reviewText: I don't typically review products immediately after purchase. I prefer to use them extensively to form a truly honest opinion. This Samsonite Freeform 2-piece set, purchased back in August, has now been put through its paces and has proven to be an exceptional travel companion (for someone other than myself, though!). Let me explain:I purchased this Samsonite Freeform Hardside Expandable 2-Piece Set with my daughter in mind, as she was about to embark on her year-long study abroad adventure. Needing a new carry-on myself, I decided to invest in this bundle. The price was surprisingly affordable for Samsonite, so I opted for the stylish navy color.The moment I laid my hands on these suitcases, I was impressed by their lightweight design. Despite their spacious interiors, they feel surprisingly light when fully packed. The smooth-rolling spinner wheels glide effortlessly, making navigating busy airports a breeze. The expandable feature is a game-changer, allowing for extra packing space. The built-in TSA-approved locks provide peace of mind. The interior compartments are well-designed, making packing and unpacking a breeze. The telescopic handle is sturdy and extends smoothly, making it easy to maneuver the suitcase.Unfortunately, my joy was short-lived. My daughter, smitten with the Samsonite's sleek design and effortless maneuverability, claimed my carry-on as her own. She justified her theft by claiming she needed it for her frequent weekend trips. I guess she couldn't exactly "find herself" without a stylish suitcase!While I initially mourned the loss of my beloved carry-on, I can't deny the quality and functionality of Samsonite luggage.Overall, the Samsonite Freeform Hardside Expandable 2-Piece Set is a fantastic investment for frequent travelers. If you're looking for luggage that can withstand the test of time and make your travels more enjoyable, I highly recommend this set. Just be prepared to defend your luggage from family members who may have a sudden case of "luggage envy."

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars You can nest 21/24/28-inch together, but 28-inch must be expanded
reviewText: So I just got the 24-inch size, after previously getting a set of the 21-inch and 28-inch. With the size difference between the 21-inch carry-on model and the 28-inch checked baggage size, there is of course no problem with putting the smaller one inside the 28-inch.Unfortunately the 21-inch, like all carry-on luggage, really only holds enough for a couple of days by itself. So I wanted to get the 24-inch middle size. Anything larger than 21 inches will need to be checked, in case anyone is still not sure about that. Some airlines will even complain if your 21-inch case is expanded and can't fit easily in the provided metal frame baggage size tester you see at a lot of gates or check-in counters. So be careful about leaving the 21-inch size expanded when you're actually trying to use it as a carry-on.I was hesitant to order the 24-inch because I wasn't certain that it would successfully nest inside the 28-inch model. I could find no information on this in the answered questions or anywhere in online reviews of these exact "Freeform" luggage models. The dimensional difference between the 24 and 28-inch models isn't nearly as much as between the 21 and 28-inch models.This is potentially very important if you either A) live in a very small place to begin with, or B) wind up in a very cramped hotel room (or even just one with a really awkward layout) where they don't provide a decent spot to store both a 24-inch and a 28-inch luggage case separately without one of them really being in the way. Closets are typically just big enough to store one or the other size, but probably not both if you can't nest them first. Trying to stack them vertically will typically just use up all available space for hanging outerwear in an already tiny hotel closet.I took a chance and ordered it anyway, without knowing the answer. The news is mostly good. I found that the 21-inch fits easily within the 24-inch. So that was a very good start. But the 28-inch won't quite close with the 24-inch inside. Not nearly as easily as when I fit the 21-inch into the 24-inch. Seems like the 24-inch is a bit too thick. Luckily, all three models have an expansion zipper around the middle. Once the largest case is expanded, the main zipper will successfully close all the way around with the 24-inch inside.So, technically, you can nest all three together, 21/24/28, as a set. You just have to expand the 28-inch case first. The complete set of three cases will then take up a couple of inches more room than expected in the front-side to back-side dimension wherever you decide to store it. I don't think I would recommend trying to compress it to re-close the expansion zipper and then leave it that way in long term storage. Probably not a good idea.As for a review of the cases themselves, they have been pretty sturdy so far, and they are pretty lightweight without really feeling flimsy at all. The double wheels on each corner provide more stability and ability to roll over slightly rough surfaces like tiled walkways, moderate carpeting and asphalt, compared to spinner cases that only put a single inline-skate type wheel on each corner. I really dislike those. And of course they are all spinners, which is a far superior arrangement to tilt-and-roll types of luggage. You can actually put quite a large bag (like a ~30LB backpack) on top of any of these sizes and still roll the whole thing around on its four wheels without too much trouble. The larger sizes will be more stable, but even the 21-inch isn't too bad.Put two of these spinners back to back and it's not too difficult to hold the extended handles together with one hand and angle the two so that you can use your knee behind the larger one to get it going, and then push the smaller one along in front of the bigger one. Once they start moving it works out pretty well.The sides are plastic and tend to develop a lot of static when the humidity is low. So you may wind up with a lot of dust/hair all over them if you lay them down on a carpet before a thorough vacuuming. Rubbing the outside with a dryer sheet may help with this.Some colors seem to have a glossy finish. The navy blue and others have a sort of tiny diamond-shaped matte texture except in the grooves. They will all get scratched as soon as they go through even a single airport baggage system. It may be less obvious on the lighter colors. But the really light colors will show the black marks from luggage belts much more easily. Just remember that they are hard sided, so no outer pockets or fabric on front/back to get torn up easily like soft-sided luggage, and they have expansion zippers, which a lot of hard-sided luggage don't include. So just pick the color you like and try not to worry about it. And they do go on sale now and then. I was able to get the first set of 21/28 for under two hundred. I think they are kind of overpriced most of the time.

We ended up struggling to navigate through our destination airport with broken suitcases and twin babies, and the return trip was no better. These suitcases were supposed to make our experience easier, but they couldn't even last one trip, which is baffling.

Plenty of space is available with or without the expandable zipper. The strap on the back of smaller case allows you to attach it to the handle on the suitcase, you can use two fingers to push two suitcases with ease! reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A case for every case!
reviewText: TLDR: Great set with plenty of options for any kind of travel!I've been on a luggage kick recently, I went on a quick trip where all I brought along was my carry-on- everyone else on this trip had a spinner suitcase and I had my trusty old fabric two-wheeler. Know what? Going completely to the opposite side of ATL dragging that behind me was the pits. I also got gate checked, twice. My trusty case was worse for the wear after that trip, so I started researching. I ordered several different styles of spinner cases to find the right one for me, individually running $100-$200 and when I received these, I sent them all back - and not just because this set is a bargain.These come in one box, Russian-doll style, which means that they're easy to stow away. They all have telescoping handles and spinner wheels except the 14" case. The largest 3 have TSA approved locks and the 4th has a built in combination lock. They're lightweight, but more durable feeling than the other cases I tried. The interiors are well designed with pockets and zippers and those click together straps of holding. I could fit more into the 20" in this design than in the others.There is also a surprising amount of room inside the 14", I was able to pack a pair of jeans, lightweight long sleeved top, vitamins, deodorant, and a thin full sized throw blanket inside without any issue - it's a fantastic one night case - or as it's intended - for your bathroom odds and ends.I love that there is an 18" AND 20", so all of your carryon needs are taken care of. And, you can check the 24" with your fully packed 20" inside so there's plenty of room for the souvenirs on the way home! Or conversely, you can always open the expansion zippers and give yourself that extra wiggle room.The 28" is massive. Looking forward to using that primarily for family road trips - one suitcase to rule them all. Imagine that? Everyone packed into one suitcase in the back of the car, no tetris-ing necessary.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2020
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful Luggage Set!
reviewText: All three bags were shipped in one single box and were packed inside of each other (thank you Amazon for not wasting boxes!). Their sizes and ability to fit inside of each other are perfect for reducing storage space when not in use. They also arrived a day earlier than expected! I chose this set mainly because of the stylish exteriors and was very pleased to see that they look exactly as pictured online.The variety of sizes allows you to switch up suitcases with different trips. I took the smallest size with me on a three day weekend trip out of town and was able to fit three complete outfits (two bottoms, two tops, a dress, & one pair of shoes), my makeup bag, and a couple travel-sized toiletries all in the one bag! I took the largest suitcase on a week-long trip out of town and had plenty of room for my many souvenirs on the way back, I didn't even have to use the zipper that extended the bag. I probably could have taken that one large suitcase on a three-week vacation with all of the room inside!I love how I can easily pull/push my suitcases when they are standing upright (because of the 360 degree spinning wheels) instead of dragging them behind me. The two smaller bags are perfect sizes for a carry-on and personal item on airlines (I tested it myself!).My only complaint is that the material stains easily. After my first 1.5hr nonstop flight, I was disappointed to pull my bag off the luggage carousel and find several dark stains over the front, back, and corners of the exterior. After my returning flight back home, I found several new stains. Nothing in my bag leaked, so I assumed the cause was from other luggage or oil in the cargo bay. I was not able to get the stains out with fabric cleaner once I returned home.Overall, I am pleased with the bags for their price. I 100% recommend purchasing a protection plan with the suitcases though because they will definitely get stained from flying. Other than that, sizes are perfect and bags have plenty of storage compartments and zipper pouches. 360 degree spinning wheels make mobility easy. And the style is beautiful!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2020
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Classic Affordable “Fabu-luggage”
reviewText: I’ve had my eye on this Steve Madden Harlo Black Luggage Set since last Winter when I “lent” my old set to a friend, who abused the bags and they smelled like smoke, so I didn’t want them back.I’ve seen this set and/or separate pieces at higher prices elsewhere, then found it here on Amazon and put it on my Shopping list. Then COVID-19 hit, and my travel plans were cancelled so I didn’t order. Fast-forward to the end of June…With a last-minute trip scheduled, I made the purchase at such a great price with quick shipping. Now we’re ba-ack from our first trip and happy together! Here’s why:The 360-degree spinners don’t add to the height of the luggage which is all-important for carry-on bags. They also were excellent for the necessary starting and stopping at the airports to navigate the TSA maze and so many travelers over the holiday while maintaining social distancing.In addition to the sturdy, maneuverable wheels and affordable pricing, I gave this set 5 stars because:1- I wanted a set with classic lines that would still be distinguishable from other luggage in the overhead bin and on the baggage carousel without the loud colors and styles that are so popular today.2- The design closely matches the overnight/underseat bag from my old set. (It’s pictured with the others from last night’s arrival home.)3- Gotta love the bag tag that refers to shoes (always admired Madden’s shoes and accessories) because I pack so many on every trip!4- The tassels are a nice touch. I hang them from the zippers for easy opening and I don’t mix up the open/expand zippers.5- My TSA-approved locks slide right in the zipper holes.6- The bags stack inside each other as they arrived for minimal storage space.***Check out the pictures for all of the above***AND, SO IMPORTANT: I had a minor issue with one bag. I reached out to the Seller and received an almost instantaneous reply from a Fashion Luggage rep who resolved it for me. I’m impressed with the product quality and the stellar customer service from this family-owned business based in the USA.I’d gladly do business with them again and look forward to many trips with this luggage, and I would recommend both to friends and family.

reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars This luggage was a joke
reviewText: So we traveled to Italy and made it off two trains and the handles broke on the first one. The next day, the others broke. They are plastic with a wire inside that will NOT hold up to travel. The London fog luggage has held up great! But this luggage was horrible. The zippers began slightly pulling apart the first time we packed them so I should have known. Very expensive any extremely low quality. Honestly, I've owned a lot of different pieces in my 47 years and Walmart brand Swiss gear held up better. This is like dollar store luggage that looks really pretty but it's not functional I don't have photos because we were forced to leave the luggage at different stations as it was falling apart. And yes, half of our clothing and essentials we gave to the homeless at the stations. Really there were no options

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars very attractive product
reviewText: I like the fact that my new luggage blends in with pieces of luggage that I previously had bought many years ago. Now I have more options when panning a trip.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple rugged design.
reviewText: I bought this off-brand luggage set because the price was right. I've been very happy with the luggage. The design seems sturdy, even rugged, and simple. No fancy dividers or flaps, just a good open space to put your clothes with some tie-down straps to secure them. The locking zippers are a nice touch for keeping things secure during flights. The wheels work well and have given good service so far. It looks like this luggage was a good find and I recommend this to anyone looking for simple, functional luggage in a color other than black.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Important Parts are Crucial.
reviewText: I bought this set as an afterthought and was a bit in a hurry to have a new set for a trip. I spent a couple of days, at 3-4 hours each, browsing for luggage. Can’t tell you how much fun that was🙄. I decided on my set of burgundy, trio 28”24”20”. The fact is; this luggage is not just good, but very good. Certain things are important as in the wheels and casters, zippers, compartments and outer shell material.The wheels are quality metal with polyurethane treads. (Very quiet for hotel hallways or concrete and wooden floors). Each piece spins nicely and doesn’t drag.The zippers are strong and metal. They glide nicely and don’t usually hang up when shutting or opening. The outer material is very tough and should never tear or give me any problems. The burgundy color with black trim looks very cool and I even received a compliment. The inside compartments are the standard pockets with decent elastic and quality zippers on them also. I really enjoy the built in combination locks. I have been accustomed to using small padlocks and carrying keys. The outside of the luggage has two zippered compartments with same strong zippers and work well. The handles on them are plastic but I see no reason why I should have any issues with them. They extent nicely, lock in the right places, and extend extremely long so I don’t need to slouch or lean to pull them behind me. I am 5’10”The insides are lined in satin type material that should hold up over time. All three pieces for under $200 seems like a bargain to me. I’m satisfied with the purchase and recommend the type and brand.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice luggage set at a good price
reviewText: Overall, this is a nice set of luggage! The 3 pieces nest inside of each other to save space. The army green color is nice and subtle, but helps to differentiate it from all the black luggage in the world. The luggage is sturdy and light, and the wheels roll smoothly and are easy to maneuver.My only complaint is that the handles drop back in too easily. I'll be walking along, pushing my luggage on all 4 wheels with the handle up, and it will just drop unexpectedly. Even if I don't push the button at all, the handles will drop. It's a minor inconvenience, but it is annoying, hence only 4 stars instead of 5.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great product
reviewText: Quality, sturdiness and beautiful. Suitcase was the perfect option for my trip. Unfortunately got visibly dirty easily. Still 5 star.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Need to get away?
reviewText: This luggage set is everything it promises to be and more. The quality is very sturdy with plenty of room to pack what you need and then some. No problems with the sturdy zippers. The 360° wheels roll great and they make the luggage easier to maneuver. The carry on is roomy and can accommodate quite a bit of items you might need on the plane, train, and/or bus; plus the extra items you might need should your claimed piece of luggage doesn’t arrive when you do. The built in locks are TSA approved and sturdy. I bought the purple set with 2 thoughts in mind, 1) it would be easier to spot at baggage claim and 2) I’m mad about purple!

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight well made luggage
reviewText: I like the color, olive green, the many pockest, the locking capability and the reasonable cost. If theair line handlers damage them I will not be broken hearted.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good product, Amazing customer service
reviewText: My daughter bought a set of this and was happy with it. So, I bought a set. I love the green color, and it's easy to pick out on the belt. On our second trip (less than a year), the airline broke a wheel. I was upset to think my set was ruined. I contacted the company to see if I could get a replacement wheel. They sent the complete assembly to me (less than 3 weeks from China) at no cost!!! We were pleasantly surprised by this. My daughter needs another set, and plans to get another one now.

reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2024
reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent set of luggage
reviewText: Great price for 3 piece set of luggage. Multi directional wheels, largest bag fully packed comes in just below 50 lb limit on airlines. Just took largest piece through checked baggage, packed to point of just barely able to zip shut. Weight measured 46.8 lbs on trip out, and 48.2 lbs on trip back (shoved few souvenirs in bag for trip back). Smallest bag is great carry on and fits below seat at feet if no overhead storage available.Took one star off for production smell. Strong chemical smell when unpacked manufacturing puts each piece in plastic bag upon completion. Needs time for off gassing of urethane used in system. Took two weeks of airing out bags before smell dissipated.Happy with use so far, many car trips, two airline trips, no sign of wear.

reviewDate: Reviewed in Canada on December 4, 2024
reviewTitle: Durability & looks
reviewText: Have not used yet but first travel in Jan. 25 so will test drive then .

reviewText: El producto llegó en tiempo, muy bien embalado, el color de las maletas es exactamente el de la publicación, el material se ve muy fuerte, la terminación no tiene fallas, muy cómodo de trasladar por su mecanismo de rodamiento. Estoy muy satisfecha con el producto, por lo que lo recomiendo.

reviewTitle: Good
reviewText: Very nice
